76/*
77 * Speed up all those if ( blarg == "structure" ) statements that are used everywhere;
78 * assemble "structure" once here instead of repeatedly later.
79 */
80static const std::string part_location_structure( "structure" );
81static const std::string part_location_center( "center" );
82static const std::string part_location_onroof( "on_roof" );
83
84static const itype_id fuel_type_animal( "animal" );
85static const itype_id fuel_type_battery( "battery" );
86static const itype_id fuel_type_muscle( "muscle" );
87static const itype_id fuel_type_plutonium_cell( "plut_cell" );
88static const itype_id fuel_type_wind( "wind" );
89
90static const fault_id fault_belt( "fault_engine_belt_drive" );
91static const fault_id fault_filter_air( "fault_engine_filter_air" );
92static const fault_id fault_filter_fuel( "fault_engine_filter_fuel" );
93static const fault_id fault_immobiliser( "fault_engine_immobiliser" );
94
95static const activity_id ACT_VEHICLE( "ACT_VEHICLE" );
96
97static const bionic_id bio_jointservo( "bio_jointservo" );
98
99static const efftype_id effect_harnessed( "harnessed" );
100
101static const itype_id itype_battery( "battery" );
102static const itype_id itype_plut_cell( "plut_cell" );
103static const itype_id itype_water( "water" );
104static const itype_id itype_water_clean( "water_clean" );
105static const itype_id itype_water_purifier( "water_purifier" );
106
107static const std::string flag_PERPETUAL( "PERPETUAL" );
108
109static bool is_sm_tile_outside( const tripoint &real_global_pos );
110static bool is_sm_tile_over_water( const tripoint &real_global_pos );
111
112static const itype_id fuel_type_mana( "mana" );
113
114// 1 kJ per battery charge
115const int bat_energy_j = 1000;
116
117// For reference what each function is supposed to do, see their implementation in
118// @ref DefaultRemovePartHandler. Add compatible code for it into @ref MapgenRemovePartHandler,
119// if needed.
120class RemovePartHandler
121{
122 public:
123 virtual ~RemovePartHandler() = default;
124
125 virtual void unboard( const tripoint &loc ) = 0;
126 virtual void add_item_or_charges( const tripoint &loc, item it, bool permit_oob ) = 0;
127 virtual void set_transparency_cache_dirty( int z ) = 0;
128 virtual void set_floor_cache_dirty( int z ) = 0;
129 virtual void removed( vehicle &veh, int part ) = 0;
130 virtual void spawn_animal_from_part( item &base, const tripoint &loc ) = 0;
131};
132
133class DefaultRemovePartHandler : public RemovePartHandler
134{
135 public:
136 ~DefaultRemovePartHandler() override = default;
137
138 void unboard( const tripoint &loc ) override {
139 g->m.unboard_vehicle( loc );
140 }
141 void add_item_or_charges( const tripoint &loc, item it, bool /*permit_oob*/ ) override {
142 g->m.add_item_or_charges( loc, std::move( it ) );
143 }
144 void set_transparency_cache_dirty( const int z ) override {
145 map &here = get_map();
146 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( z );
147 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );
148 }
149 void set_floor_cache_dirty( const int z ) override {
150 get_map().set_floor_cache_dirty( z );
151 }
152 void removed( vehicle &veh, const int part ) override {
153 avatar &player_character = get_avatar();
154 // If the player is currently working on the removed part, stop them as it's futile now.
155 const player_activity &act = player_character.activity;
156 map &here = get_map();
157 if( act.id() == ACT_VEHICLE && act.moves_left > 0 && act.values.size() > 6 ) {
158 if( veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at( tripoint( act.values[0], act.values[1],
159 player_character.posz() ) ) ) == &veh ) {
160 if( act.values[6] >= part ) {
161 player_character.cancel_activity();
162 add_msg( m_info, _( "The vehicle part you were working on has gone!" ) );
163 }
164 }
165 }
166 // TODO: maybe do this for all the nearby NPCs as well?
167
168 if( g->u.get_grab_type() == OBJECT_VEHICLE && g->u.grab_point == veh.global_part_pos3( part ) ) {
169 if( veh.parts_at_relative( veh.part( part ).mount, false ).empty() ) {
170 add_msg( m_info, _( "The vehicle part you were holding has been destroyed!" ) );
171 g->u.grab( OBJECT_NONE );
172 }
173 }
174
175 here.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( &veh );
176 }
177 void spawn_animal_from_part( item &base, const tripoint &loc ) override {
178 base.release_monster( loc, 1 );
179 }
180};
181
182class MapgenRemovePartHandler : public RemovePartHandler
183{
184 private:
185 map &m;
186
187 public:
188 MapgenRemovePartHandler( map &m ) : m( m ) { }
189
190 ~MapgenRemovePartHandler() override = default;
191
192 void unboard( const tripoint &/*loc*/ ) override {
193 debugmsg( "Tried to unboard during mapgen!" );
194 // Ignored. Will almost certainly not be called anyway, because
195 // there are no creatures that could have been mounted during mapgen.
196 }
197 void add_item_or_charges( const tripoint &loc, item it, bool permit_oob ) override {
198 if( !m.inbounds( loc ) ) {
199 if( !permit_oob ) {
200 debugmsg( "Tried to put item %s on invalid tile %s during mapgen!",
201 it.tname(), loc.to_string() );
202 }
203 tripoint copy = loc;
204 m.clip_to_bounds( copy );
205 assert( m.inbounds( copy ) ); // prevent infinite recursion
206 add_item_or_charges( copy, std::move( it ), false );
207 return;
208 }
209 m.add_item_or_charges( loc, std::move( it ) );
210 }
211 void set_transparency_cache_dirty( const int /*z*/ ) override {
212 // Ignored for now. We don't initialize the transparency cache in mapgen anyway.
213 }
214 void set_floor_cache_dirty( const int /*z*/ ) override {
215 // Ignored for now. We don't initialize the floor cache in mapgen anyway.
216 }
217 void removed( vehicle &veh, const int /*part*/ ) override {
218 // TODO: check if this is necessary, it probably isn't during mapgen
219 m.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( &veh );
220 }
221 void spawn_animal_from_part( item &/*base*/, const tripoint &/*loc*/ ) override {
222 debugmsg( "Tried to spawn animal from vehicle part during mapgen!" );
223 // Ignored. The base item will not be changed and will spawn as is:
224 // still containing the animal.
225 // This should not happend during mapgen anyway.
226 // TODO: *if* this actually happens: create a spawn point for the animal instead.
227 }
228};
229
230// Vehicle stack methods.
231vehicle_stack::iterator vehicle_stack::erase( vehicle_stack::const_iterator it )
232{
233 return myorigin->remove_item( part_num, it );
234}
235
236void vehicle_stack::insert( const item &newitem )
237{
238 myorigin->add_item( part_num, newitem );
239}
240
241units::volume vehicle_stack::max_volume() const
242{
243 if( myorigin->part_flag( part_num, "CARGO" ) && !myorigin->part( part_num ).is_broken() ) {
244 // Set max volume for vehicle cargo to prevent integer overflow
245 return std::min( myorigin->part( part_num ).info().size, 10000_liter );
246 }
247 return 0_ml;
248}
249
250// Vehicle class methods.
251
252vehicle::vehicle( const vproto_id &type_id, int init_veh_fuel,
253 int init_veh_status ): type( type_id )
254{
255 turn_dir = 0_degrees;
256 face.init( 0_degrees );
257 move.init( 0_degrees );
258 of_turn_carry = 0;
259
260 if( !type.str().empty() && type.is_valid() ) {
261 const vehicle_prototype &proto = type.obj();
262 // Copy the already made vehicle. The blueprint is created when the json data is loaded
263 // and is guaranteed to be valid (has valid parts etc.).
264 *this = *proto.blueprint;
265 init_state( init_veh_fuel, init_veh_status );
266 }
267 precalc_mounts( 0, pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0] );
268 refresh();
269}
270
271vehicle::vehicle() : vehicle( vproto_id() )
272{
273 sm_pos = tripoint_zero;
274}
275
276vehicle::~vehicle() = default;
277
278bool vehicle::player_in_control( const Character &p ) const
279{
280 // Debug switch to prevent vehicles from skidding
281 // without having to place the player in them.
282 if( tags.count( "IN_CONTROL_OVERRIDE" ) ) {
283 return true;
284 }
285
286 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( p.pos() );
287 if( vp && &vp->vehicle() == this &&
288 ( ( part_with_feature( vp->part_index(), "CONTROL_ANIMAL", true ) >= 0 &&
289 has_engine_type( fuel_type_animal, false ) && has_harnessed_animal() ) ||
290 ( part_with_feature( vp->part_index(), VPFLAG_CONTROLS, false ) >= 0 ) ) &&
291 p.controlling_vehicle ) {
292 return true;
293 }
294
295 return remote_controlled( p );
296}
297
298bool vehicle::remote_controlled( const Character &p ) const
299{
300 vehicle *veh = g->remoteveh();
301 if( veh != this ) {
302 return false;
303 }
304
305 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "REMOTE_CONTROLS" ) ) {
306 if( rl_dist( p.pos(), vp.pos() ) <= 40 ) {
307 return true;
308 }
309 }
310
311 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Lost connection with the vehicle due to distance!" ) );
312 g->setremoteveh( nullptr );
313 return false;
314}
315
316/** Checks all parts to see if frames are missing (as they might be when
317 * loading from a game saved before the vehicle construction rules overhaul). */
318void vehicle::add_missing_frames()
319{
320 static const vpart_id frame_id( "frame_vertical" );
321 //No need to check the same spot more than once
322 std::set<point> locations_checked;
323 for( auto &i : parts ) {
324 if( locations_checked.count( i.mount ) != 0 ) {
325 continue;
326 }
327 locations_checked.insert( i.mount );
328
329 bool found = false;
330 for( auto &elem : parts_at_relative( i.mount, false ) ) {
331 if( part_info( elem ).location == part_location_structure ) {
332 found = true;
333 break;
334 }
335 }
336 if( !found ) {
337 // Install missing frame
338 parts.emplace_back( frame_id, i.mount, item( frame_id->item ) );
339 }
340 }
341}
342
343// Called when loading a vehicle that predates steerable wheels.
344// Tries to convert some wheels to steerable versions on the front axle.
345void vehicle::add_steerable_wheels()
346{
347 int axle = INT_MIN;
348 std::vector< std::pair<int, vpart_id> > wheels;
349
350 // Find wheels that have steerable versions.
351 // Convert the wheel(s) with the largest x value.
352 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
353 if( vp.has_feature( "STEERABLE" ) || vp.has_feature( "TRACKED" ) ) {
354 // Has a wheel that is inherently steerable
355 // (e.g. unicycle, casters), this vehicle doesn't
356 // need conversion.
357 return;
358 }
359
360 if( vp.mount().x < axle ) {
361 // there is another axle in front of this
362 continue;
363 }
364
365 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_WHEEL ) ) {
366 vpart_id steerable_id( vp.info().get_id().str() + "_steerable" );
367 if( steerable_id.is_valid() ) {
368 // We can convert this.
369 if( vp.mount().x != axle ) {
370 // Found a new axle further forward than the
371 // existing one.
372 wheels.clear();
373 axle = vp.mount().x;
374 }
375
376 wheels.push_back( std::make_pair( static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ), steerable_id ) );
377 }
378 }
379 }
380
381 // Now convert the wheels to their new types.
382 for( auto &wheel : wheels ) {
383 parts[ wheel.first ].id = wheel.second;
384 }
385}
386
387void vehicle::init_state( int init_veh_fuel, int init_veh_status )
388{
389 // vehicle parts excluding engines are by default turned off
390 for( auto &pt : parts ) {
391 pt.enabled = pt.base.is_engine();
392 }
393
394 bool destroySeats = false;
395 bool destroyControls = false;
396 bool destroyTank = false;
397 bool destroyEngine = false;
398 bool destroyTires = false;
399 bool blood_covered = false;
400 bool blood_inside = false;
401 bool has_no_key = false;
402 bool destroyAlarm = false;
403
404 // More realistically it should be -5 days old
405 last_update = calendar::start_of_cataclysm;
406
407 // veh_fuel_multiplier is percentage of fuel
408 // 0 is empty, 100 is full tank, -1 is random 7% to 35%
409 int veh_fuel_mult = init_veh_fuel;
410 if( init_veh_fuel == - 1 ) {
411 veh_fuel_mult = rng( 1, 7 );
412 }
413 if( init_veh_fuel > 100 ) {
414 veh_fuel_mult = 100;
415 }
416
417 // veh_status is initial vehicle damage
418 // -1 = light damage (DEFAULT)
419 // 0 = undamaged
420 // 1 = disabled, destroyed tires OR engine
421 int veh_status = -1;
422 if( init_veh_status == 0 ) {
423 veh_status = 0;
424 }
425 if( init_veh_status == 1 ) {
426 int rand = rng( 1, 100 );
427 veh_status = 1;
428
429 if( rand <= 5 ) { // seats are destroyed 5%
430 destroySeats = true;
431 } else if( rand <= 15 ) { // controls are destroyed 10%
432 destroyControls = true;
433 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 0, 7 ); // add 0-7% more fuel if controls are destroyed
434 } else if( rand <= 23 ) { // battery, minireactor or gasoline tank are destroyed 8%
435 destroyTank = true;
436 } else if( rand <= 29 ) { // engine are destroyed 6%
437 destroyEngine = true;
438 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 3, 12 ); // add 3-12% more fuel if engine is destroyed
439 } else if( rand <= 66 ) { // tires are destroyed 37%
440 destroyTires = true;
441 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 0, 18 ); // add 0-18% more fuel if tires are destroyed
442 } else { // vehicle locked 34%
443 has_no_key = true;
444 }
445 }
446 // if locked, 16% chance something damaged
447 if( one_in( 6 ) && has_no_key ) {
448 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
449 destroyTank = true;
450 } else if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
451 destroyEngine = true;
452 } else {
453 destroyTires = true;
454 }
455 } else if( !one_in( 3 ) ) {
456 //most cars should have a destroyed alarm
457 destroyAlarm = true;
458 }
459
460 //Provide some variety to non-mint vehicles
461 if( veh_status != 0 ) {
462 //Leave engine running in some vehicles, if the engine has not been destroyed
463 //chance decays from 1 in 4 vehicles on day 0 to 1 in (day + 4) in the future.
464 int current_day = std::max( to_days<int>( calendar::turn - calendar::turn_zero ), 0 );
465 if( veh_fuel_mult > 0 && !empty( get_avail_parts( "ENGINE" ) ) &&
466 one_in( current_day + 4 ) && !destroyEngine && !has_no_key &&
467 has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
468 engine_on = true;
469 }
470
471 auto light_head = one_in( 20 );
472 auto light_whead = one_in( 20 ); // wide-angle headlight
473 auto light_dome = one_in( 16 );
474 auto light_aisle = one_in( 8 );
475 auto light_hoverh = one_in( 4 ); // half circle overhead light
476 auto light_overh = one_in( 4 );
477 auto light_atom = one_in( 2 );
478 for( auto &pt : parts ) {
479 if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_CONE_LIGHT ) ) {
480 pt.enabled = light_head;
481 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_WIDE_CONE_LIGHT ) ) {
482 pt.enabled = light_whead;
483 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_DOME_LIGHT ) ) {
484 pt.enabled = light_dome;
485 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_AISLE_LIGHT ) ) {
486 pt.enabled = light_aisle;
487 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_HALF_CIRCLE_LIGHT ) ) {
488 pt.enabled = light_hoverh;
489 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_CIRCLE_LIGHT ) ) {
490 pt.enabled = light_overh;
491 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_ATOMIC_LIGHT ) ) {
492 pt.enabled = light_atom;
493 }
494 }
495
496 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
497 blood_covered = true;
498 }
499
500 if( one_in( 8 ) ) {
501 blood_inside = true;
502 }
503
504 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "FRIDGE" ) ) {
505 vp.part().enabled = true;
506 }
507
508 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "FREEZER" ) ) {
509 vp.part().enabled = true;
510 }
511
512 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "WATER_PURIFIER" ) ) {
513 vp.part().enabled = true;
514 }
515 }
516
517 cata::optional<point> blood_inside_pos;
518 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
519 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
520 vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
521
522 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_REACTOR ) ) {
523 // De-hardcoded reactors. Should always start active
524 pt.enabled = true;
525 }
526
527 if( pt.is_reactor() ) {
528 if( veh_fuel_mult == 100 ) { // Mint condition vehicle
529 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() );
530 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) { // Randomize charge a bit
531 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult + rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
532 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) {
533 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult - rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
534 } else {
535 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100 );
536 }
537 }
538
539 if( pt.is_battery() ) {
540 if( veh_fuel_mult == 100 ) { // Mint condition vehicle
541 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() );
542 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) { // Randomize battery ammo a bit
543 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult + rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
544 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) {
545 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult - rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
546 } else {
547 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100 );
548 }
549 }
550
551 if( pt.is_tank() && !type->parts[p].fuel.is_null() ) {
552 int qty = pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100;
553 qty *= std::max( type->parts[p].fuel->stack_size, 1 );
554 qty /= to_milliliter( units::legacy_volume_factor );
555 pt.ammo_set( type->parts[ p ].fuel, qty );
556 } else if( pt.is_fuel_store() && !type->parts[p].fuel.is_null() ) {
557 int qty = pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100;
558 pt.ammo_set( type->parts[ p ].fuel, qty );
559 }
560
561 if( vp.has_feature( "OPENABLE" ) ) { // doors are closed
562 if( !pt.open && one_in( 4 ) ) {
563 open( p );
564 }
565 }
566 if( vp.has_feature( "BOARDABLE" ) ) { // no passengers
567 pt.remove_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag );
568 }
569
570 // initial vehicle damage
571 if( veh_status == 0 ) {
572 // Completely mint condition vehicle
573 set_hp( pt, vp.info().durability );
574 } else {
575 //a bit of initial damage :)
576 //clamp 4d8 to the range of [8,20]. 8=broken, 20=undamaged.
577 int broken = 8;
578 int unhurt = 20;
579 int roll = dice( 4, 8 );
580 if( roll < unhurt ) {
581 if( roll <= broken ) {
582 set_hp( pt, 0 );
583 pt.ammo_unset(); //empty broken batteries and fuel tanks
584 } else {
585 set_hp( pt, ( roll - broken ) / static_cast<double>( unhurt - broken ) * vp.info().durability );
586 }
587 } else {
588 set_hp( pt, vp.info().durability );
589 }
590
591 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
592 // If possible set an engine fault rather than destroying the engine outright
593 if( destroyEngine && pt.faults_potential().empty() ) {
594 set_hp( pt, 0 );
595 } else if( destroyEngine || one_in( 3 ) ) {
596 do {
597 pt.fault_set( random_entry( pt.faults_potential() ) );
598 } while( one_in( 3 ) );
599 }
600
601 } else if( ( destroySeats && ( vp.has_feature( "SEAT" ) || vp.has_feature( "SEATBELT" ) ) ) ||
602 ( destroyControls && ( vp.has_feature( "CONTROLS" ) || vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) ) ) ||
603 ( destroyAlarm && vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) ) ) {
604 set_hp( pt, 0 );
605 }
606
607 // Fuel tanks should be emptied as well
608 if( destroyTank && pt.is_fuel_store() ) {
609 set_hp( pt, 0 );
610 pt.ammo_unset();
611 }
612
613 //Solar panels have 25% of being destroyed
614 if( vp.has_feature( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) && one_in( 4 ) ) {
615 set_hp( pt, 0 );
616 }
617
618 /* Bloodsplatter the front-end parts. Assume anything with x > 0 is
619 * the "front" of the vehicle (since the driver's seat is at (0, 0).
620 * We'll be generous with the blood, since some may disappear before
621 * the player gets a chance to see the vehicle. */
622 if( blood_covered && vp.mount().x > 0 ) {
623 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
624 //Loads of blood. (200 = completely red vehicle part)
625 pt.blood = rng( 200, 600 );
626 } else {
627 //Some blood
628 pt.blood = rng( 50, 200 );
629 }
630 }
631
632 if( blood_inside ) {
633 // blood is splattered around (blood_inside_pos),
634 // coordinates relative to mount point; the center is always a seat
635 if( blood_inside_pos ) {
636 const int distSq = std::pow( blood_inside_pos->x - vp.mount().x, 2 ) +
637 std::pow( blood_inside_pos->y - vp.mount().y, 2 );
638 if( distSq <= 1 ) {
639 pt.blood = rng( 200, 400 ) - distSq * 100;
640 }
641 } else if( vp.has_feature( "SEAT" ) ) {
642 // Set the center of the bloody mess inside
643 blood_inside_pos.emplace( vp.mount() );
644 }
645 }
646 }
647 //sets the vehicle to locked, if there is no key and an alarm part exists
648 if( vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) && has_no_key && pt.is_available() ) {
649 is_locked = true;
650
651 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
652 // if vehicle has immobilizer 50% chance to add additional fault
653 pt.fault_set( fault_immobiliser );
654 }
655 }
656 }
657 // destroy tires until the vehicle is not drivable
658 if( destroyTires && !wheelcache.empty() ) {
659 int tries = 0;
660 while( valid_wheel_config() && tries < 100 ) {
661 // wheel config is still valid, destroy the tire.
662 set_hp( parts[random_entry( wheelcache )], 0 );
663 tries++;
664 }
665 }
666
667 invalidate_mass();
668}
669
670void vehicle::activate_magical_follow()
671{
672 for( vehicle_part &vp : parts ) {
673 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_mana ) {
674 vp.enabled = true;
675 is_following = true;
676 engine_on = true;
677 } else {
678 vp.enabled = true;
679 }
680 }
681 refresh();
682}
683
684void vehicle::activate_animal_follow()
685{
686 for( size_t e = 0; e < parts.size(); e++ ) {
687 vehicle_part &vp = parts[ e ];
688 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
689 monster *mon = get_pet( e );
690 if( mon && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
691 vp.enabled = true;
692 is_following = true;
693 engine_on = true;
694 }
695 } else {
696 vp.enabled = true;
697 }
698 }
699 refresh();
700}
701
702void vehicle::autopilot_patrol()
703{
704 /** choose one single zone ( multiple zones too complex for now )
705 * choose a point at the far edge of the zone
706 * the edge chosen is the edge that is smaller, therefore the longer side
707 * of the rectangle is the one the vehicle drives mostly parallel too.
708 * if its perfect square then choose a point that is on any edge that the
709 * vehicle is not currently at
710 * drive to that point.
711 * then once arrived, choose a random opposite point of the zone.
712 * this should ( in a simple fashion ) cause a patrolling behavior
713 * in a criss-cross fashion.
714 * in an auto-tractor, this would eventually cover the entire rectangle.
715 */
716 // if we are close to a waypoint, then return to come back to this function next turn.
717 if( autodrive_local_target != tripoint_zero ) {
718 if( rl_dist( global_square_location().raw(), autodrive_local_target ) <= 3 ) {
719 autodrive_local_target = tripoint_zero;
720 return;
721 }
722 if( !g->m.inbounds( g->m.getlocal( autodrive_local_target ) ) ) {
723 autodrive_local_target = tripoint_zero;
724 is_patrolling = false;
725 return;
726 }
727 drive_to_local_target( autodrive_local_target, false );
728 return;
729 }
730 zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
731 const auto &zone_src_set = mgr.get_near( zone_type_id( "VEHICLE_PATROL" ),
732 global_square_location().raw(), 60 );
733 if( zone_src_set.empty() ) {
734 is_patrolling = false;
735 return;
736 }
737 // get corners.
738 tripoint min;
739 tripoint max;
740 for( const tripoint &box : zone_src_set ) {
741 if( min == tripoint_zero ) {
742 min = box;
743 max = box;
744 continue;
745 }
746 min.x = std::min( box.x, min.x );
747 min.y = std::min( box.y, min.y );
748 min.z = std::min( box.z, min.z );
749 max.x = std::max( box.x, max.x );
750 max.y = std::max( box.y, max.y );
751 max.z = std::max( box.z, max.z );
752 }
753 const bool x_side = ( max.x - min.x ) < ( max.y - min.y );
754 const int point_along = x_side ? rng( min.x, max.x ) : rng( min.y, max.y );
755 const tripoint max_tri = x_side ? tripoint( point_along, max.y, min.z ) : tripoint( max.x,
756 point_along,
757 min.z );
758 const tripoint min_tri = x_side ? tripoint( point_along, min.y, min.z ) : tripoint( min.x,
759 point_along,
760 min.z );
761 tripoint chosen_tri = min_tri;
762 if( rl_dist( max_tri, global_square_location().raw() ) >= rl_dist( min_tri,
763 global_square_location().raw() ) ) {
764 chosen_tri = max_tri;
765 }
766 autodrive_local_target = chosen_tri;
767 drive_to_local_target( autodrive_local_target, false );
768}
769
770std::set<point> vehicle::immediate_path( units::angle rotate )
771{
772 std::set<point> points_to_check;
773 const int distance_to_check = 10 + ( velocity / 800 );
774 units::angle adjusted_angle = normalize( face.dir() + rotate );
775 // clamp to multiples of 15.
776 adjusted_angle = round_to_multiple_of( adjusted_angle, 15_degrees );
777 tileray collision_vector;
778 collision_vector.init( adjusted_angle );
779 point top_left_actual = global_pos3().xy() + coord_translate( front_left );
780 point top_right_actual = global_pos3().xy() + coord_translate( front_right );
781 std::vector<point> front_row = line_to( g->m.getabs( top_left_actual ),
782 g->m.getabs( top_right_actual ) );
783 for( const point &elem : front_row ) {
784 for( int i = 0; i < distance_to_check; ++i ) {
785 collision_vector.advance( i );
786 point point_to_add = elem + point( collision_vector.dx(), collision_vector.dy() );
787 points_to_check.emplace( point_to_add );
788 }
789 }
790 collision_check_points = points_to_check;
791 return points_to_check;
792}
793
794static int get_turn_from_angle( const units::angle angle, const tripoint &vehpos,
795 const tripoint &target, bool reverse = false )
796{
797 if( angle > 10.0_degrees && angle <= 45.0_degrees ) {
798 return reverse ? 4 : 1;
799 } else if( angle > 45.0_degrees && angle <= 90.0_degrees ) {
800 return 3;
801 } else if( angle > 90.0_degrees && angle < 180.0_degrees ) {
802 return reverse ? 1 : 4;
803 } else if( angle < -10.0_degrees && angle >= -45.0_degrees ) {
804 return reverse ? -4 : -1;
805 } else if( angle < -45.0_degrees && angle >= -90.0_degrees ) {
806 return -3;
807 } else if( angle < -90.0_degrees && angle > -180.0_degrees ) {
808 return reverse ? -1 : -4;
809 // edge case of being exactly on the button for the target.
810 // just keep driving, the next path point will be picked up.
811 } else if( ( angle == 180_degrees || angle == -180_degrees ) && vehpos == target ) {
812 return 0;
813 }
814 return 0;
815}
816
817void vehicle::drive_to_local_target( const tripoint &target, bool follow_protocol )
818{
819 if( follow_protocol && g->u.in_vehicle ) {
820 stop_autodriving();
821 return;
822 }
823 refresh();
824 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
825 units::angle angle = get_angle_from_targ( target );
826 // now we got the angle to the target, we can work out when we are heading towards disaster.
827 // Check the tileray in the direction we need to head towards.
828 std::set<point> points_to_check = immediate_path( angle );
829 bool stop = false;
830 for( const point &pt_elem : points_to_check ) {
831 point elem = g->m.getlocal( pt_elem );
832 if( stop ) {
833 break;
834 }
835 const optional_vpart_position ovp = g->m.veh_at( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) );
836 if( g->m.impassable_ter_furn( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) ) || ( ovp &&
837 &ovp->vehicle() != this ) ) {
838 stop = true;
839 break;
840 }
841 if( elem == g->u.pos().xy() ) {
842 if( follow_protocol || g->u.in_vehicle ) {
843 continue;
844 } else {
845 stop = true;
846 break;
847 }
848 }
849 bool its_a_pet = false;
850 if( g->critter_at( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) ) ) {
851 npc *guy = g->critter_at<npc>( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) );
852 if( guy && !guy->in_vehicle ) {
853 stop = true;
854 break;
855 }
856 for( const auto &p : parts ) {
857 monster *mon = get_pet( index_of_part( &p ) );
858 if( mon && mon->pos().xy() == elem ) {
859 its_a_pet = true;
860 break;
861 }
862 }
863 if( !its_a_pet ) {
864 stop = true;
865 break;
866 }
867 }
868 }
869 if( stop ) {
870 if( autopilot_on ) {
871 sounds::sound( global_pos3(), 30, sounds::sound_t::alert,
872 string_format( _( "the %s emitting a beep and saying \"Obstacle detected!\"" ),
873 name ) );
874 }
875 stop_autodriving();
876 return;
877 }
878 int turn_x = get_turn_from_angle( angle, vehpos, target );
879 int accel_y = 0;
880 // best to cruise around at a safe velocity or 40mph, whichever is lowest
881 // accelerate when it dosnt need to turn.
882 // when following player, take distance to player into account.
883 // we really want to avoid running the player over.
884 // If its a helicopter, we dont need to worry about airborne obstacles so much
885 // And fuel efficiency is terrible at low speeds.
886 int safe_player_follow_speed = 400;
887 if( g->u.movement_mode_is( CMM_RUN ) ) {
888 safe_player_follow_speed = 800;
889 } else if( g->u.movement_mode_is( CMM_CROUCH ) ) {
890 safe_player_follow_speed = 200;
891 }
892 if( follow_protocol ) {
893 if( ( ( turn_x > 0 || turn_x < 0 ) && velocity > safe_player_follow_speed ) ||
894 rl_dist( vehpos, g->m.getabs( g->u.pos() ) ) < 7 + ( ( mount_max.y * 3 ) + 4 ) ) {
895 accel_y = 1;
896 }
897 if( ( velocity < std::min( safe_velocity(), safe_player_follow_speed ) && turn_x == 0 &&
898 rl_dist( vehpos, g->m.getabs( g->u.pos() ) ) > 8 + ( ( mount_max.y * 3 ) + 4 ) ) ||
899 velocity < 100 ) {
900 accel_y = -1;
901 }
902 } else {
903 if( ( turn_x > 0 || turn_x < 0 ) && velocity > 1000 ) {
904 accel_y = 1;
905 }
906 if( ( velocity < std::min( safe_velocity(), is_rotorcraft() &&
907 is_flying_in_air() ? 12000 : 32 * 100 ) && turn_x == 0 ) || velocity < 500 ) {
908 accel_y = -1;
909 }
910 if( is_patrolling && velocity > 400 ) {
911 accel_y = 1;
912 }
913 }
914 selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
915}
916
917units::angle vehicle::get_angle_from_targ( const tripoint &targ )
918{
919 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
920 rl_vec2d facevec = face_vec();
921 point rel_pos_target = targ.xy() - vehpos.xy();
922 rl_vec2d targetvec = rl_vec2d( rel_pos_target.x, rel_pos_target.y );
923 // cross product
924 double crossy = ( facevec.x * targetvec.y ) - ( targetvec.x * facevec.y );
925 // dot product.
926 double dotx = ( facevec.x * targetvec.x ) + ( facevec.y * targetvec.y );
927
928 return units::atan2( crossy, dotx );
929}
930
931/**
932 * Smashes up a vehicle that has already been placed; used for generating
933 * very damaged vehicles. Additionally, any spot where two vehicles overlapped
934 * (i.e., any spot with multiple frames) will be completely destroyed, as that
935 * was the collision point.
936 */
937void vehicle::smash( map &m, float hp_percent_loss_min, float hp_percent_loss_max,
938 float percent_of_parts_to_affect, point damage_origin, float damage_size )
939{
940 for( auto &part : parts ) {
941 //Skip any parts already mashed up or removed.
942 if( part.is_broken() || part.removed ) {
943 continue;
944 }
945
946 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( part.mount, true );
947 int structures_found = 0;
948 for( auto &square_part_index : parts_in_square ) {
949 if( part_info( square_part_index ).location == part_location_structure ) {
950 structures_found++;
951 }
952 }
953
954 if( structures_found > 1 ) {
955 //Destroy everything in the square
956 for( int idx : parts_in_square ) {
957 mod_hp( parts[ idx ], 0 - parts[ idx ].hp(), DT_BASH );
958 parts[ idx ].ammo_unset();
959 }
960 continue;
961 }
962
963 int roll = dice( 1, 1000 );
964 int pct_af = ( percent_of_parts_to_affect * 1000.0f );
965 if( roll < pct_af ) {
966 double dist = damage_size == 0.0f ? 1.0f :
967 clamp( 1.0f - trig_dist( damage_origin, part.precalc[0].xy() ) /
968 damage_size, 0.0f, 1.0f );
969 //Everywhere else, drop by 10-120% of max HP (anything over 100 = broken)
970 if( mod_hp( part, 0 - ( rng_float( hp_percent_loss_min * dist,
971 hp_percent_loss_max * dist ) *
972 part.info().durability ), DT_BASH ) ) {
973 part.ammo_unset();
974 }
975 }
976 }
977
978 std::unique_ptr<RemovePartHandler> handler_ptr;
979 // clear out any duplicated locations
980 for( int p = static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) - 1; p >= 0; p-- ) {
981 vehicle_part &part = parts[ p ];
982 if( part.removed ) {
983 continue;
984 }
985 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( part.mount, true );
986 for( int other_i = static_cast<int>( parts_here.size() ) - 1; other_i >= 0; other_i -- ) {
987 int other_p = parts_here[ other_i ];
988 if( p == other_p ) {
989 continue;
990 }
991 const vpart_info &p_info = part_info( p );
992 const vpart_info &other_p_info = part_info( other_p );
993
994 if( p_info.get_id() == other_p_info.get_id() ||
995 ( !p_info.location.empty() && p_info.location == other_p_info.location ) ) {
996 // Deferred creation of the handler to here so it is only created when actually needed.
997 if( !handler_ptr ) {
998 // This is a heuristic: we just assume the default handler is good enough when called
999 // on the main game map. And assume that we run from some mapgen code if called on
1000 // another instance.
1001 if( g && &g->m == &m ) {
1002 handler_ptr = std::make_unique<DefaultRemovePartHandler>();
1003 } else {
1004 handler_ptr = std::make_unique<MapgenRemovePartHandler>( m );
1005 }
1006 }
1007 remove_part( other_p, *handler_ptr );
1008 }
1009 }
1010 }
1011}
1012
1013int vehicle::lift_strength() const
1014{
1015 units::mass mass = total_mass();
1016 return std::max<std::int64_t>( mass / 10000_gram, 1 );
1017}
1018
1019void vehicle::toggle_specific_engine( int e, bool on )
1020{
1021 toggle_specific_part( engines[e], on );
1022}
1023void vehicle::toggle_specific_part( int p, bool on )
1024{
1025 parts[p].enabled = on;
1026}
1027bool vehicle::is_engine_type_on( int e, const itype_id &ft ) const
1028{
1029 return is_engine_on( e ) && is_engine_type( e, ft );
1030}
1031
1032bool vehicle::has_engine_type( const itype_id &ft, const bool enabled ) const
1033{
1034 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
1035 if( is_engine_type( e, ft ) && ( !enabled || is_engine_on( e ) ) ) {
1036 return true;
1037 }
1038 }
1039 return false;
1040}
1041bool vehicle::has_engine_type_not( const itype_id &ft, const bool enabled ) const
1042{
1043 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
1044 if( !is_engine_type( e, ft ) && ( !enabled || is_engine_on( e ) ) ) {
1045 return true;
1046 }
1047 }
1048 return false;
1049}
1050
1051bool vehicle::has_engine_conflict( const vpart_info *possible_conflict,
1052 std::string &conflict_type ) const
1053{
1054 std::vector<std::string> new_excludes = possible_conflict->engine_excludes();
1055 // skip expensive string comparisons if there are no exclusions
1056 if( new_excludes.empty() ) {
1057 return false;
1058 }
1059
1060 bool has_conflict = false;
1061
1062 for( int engine : engines ) {
1063 std::vector<std::string> install_excludes = part_info( engine ).engine_excludes();
1064 std::vector<std::string> conflicts;
1065 std::set_intersection( new_excludes.begin(), new_excludes.end(), install_excludes.begin(),
1066 install_excludes.end(), back_inserter( conflicts ) );
1067 if( !conflicts.empty() ) {
1068 has_conflict = true;
1069 conflict_type = conflicts.front();
1070 break;
1071 }
1072 }
1073 return has_conflict;
1074}
1075
1076bool vehicle::is_engine_type( const int e, const itype_id &ft ) const
1077{
1078 return parts[engines[e]].ammo_current().is_null() ? parts[engines[e]].fuel_current() == ft :
1079 parts[engines[e]].ammo_current() == ft;
1080}
1081
1082bool vehicle::is_perpetual_type( const int e ) const
1083{
1084 const itype_id &ft = part_info( engines[e] ).fuel_type;
1085 return item( ft ).has_flag( "PERPETUAL" );
1086}
1087
1088bool vehicle::is_engine_on( const int e ) const
1089{
1090 return parts[ engines[ e ] ].is_available() && is_part_on( engines[ e ] );
1091}
1092
1093bool vehicle::is_part_on( const int p ) const
1094{
1095 return parts[p].enabled;
1096}
1097
1098bool vehicle::is_alternator_on( const int a ) const
1099{
1100 auto alt = parts[ alternators [ a ] ];
1101 if( alt.is_unavailable() ) {
1102 return false;
1103 }
1104
1105 return std::any_of( engines.begin(), engines.end(), [this, &alt]( int idx ) {
1106 const auto &eng = parts [ idx ];
1107 //fuel_left checks that the engine can produce power to be absorbed
1108 return eng.is_available() && eng.enabled && fuel_left( eng.fuel_current() ) &&
1109 eng.mount == alt.mount && !eng.faults().count( fault_belt );
1110 } );
1111}
1112
1113bool vehicle::has_security_working() const
1114{
1115 bool found_security = false;
1116 if( fuel_left( fuel_type_battery ) > 0 ) {
1117 for( int s : speciality ) {
1118 if( part_flag( s, "SECURITY" ) && parts[ s ].is_available() ) {
1119 found_security = true;
1120 break;
1121 }
1122 }
1123 }
1124 return found_security;
1125}
1126
1127void vehicle::backfire( const int e ) const
1128{
1129 const int power = part_vpower_w( engines[e], true );
1130 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( engines[e] );
1131 sounds::sound( pos, 40 + power / 10000, sounds::sound_t::movement,
1132 // single space after the exclaimation mark because it does not end the sentence
1133 //~ backfire sound
1134 string_format( _( "a loud BANG! from the %s" ), // NOLINT(cata-text-style)
1135 parts[ engines[ e ] ].name() ), true, "vehicle", "engine_backfire" );
1136}
1137
1138const vpart_info &vehicle::part_info( int index, bool include_removed ) const
1139{
1140 if( index < static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1141 if( !parts[index].removed || include_removed ) {
1142 return parts[index].info();
1143 }
1144 }
1145 return vpart_id::NULL_ID().obj();
1146}
1147
1148// engines & alternators all have power.
1149// engines provide, whilst alternators consume.
1150int vehicle::part_vpower_w( const int index, const bool at_full_hp ) const
1151{
1152 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ index ];
1153 int pwr = vp.info().power;
1154 if( part_flag( index, VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
1155 if( pwr == 0 ) {
1156 pwr = vhp_to_watts( vp.base.engine_displacement() );
1157 }
1158 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
1159 monster *mon = get_pet( index );
1160 if( mon != nullptr && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
1161 // An animal that can carry twice as much weight, can pull a cart twice as hard.
1162 pwr = mon->get_speed() * mon->get_size() * 3
1163 * ( mon->get_mountable_weight_ratio() * 5 );
1164 } else {
1165 pwr = 0;
1166 }
1167 }
1168 ///\EFFECT_STR increases power produced for MUSCLE_* vehicles
1169 pwr += ( g->u.str_cur - 8 ) * part_info( index ).engine_muscle_power_factor();
1170 /// wind-powered vehicles have differing power depending on wind direction
1171 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_wind ) {
1172 const weather_manager &weather = get_weather();
1173 int windpower = weather.windspeed;
1174 rl_vec2d windvec;
1175 double raddir = ( ( weather.winddirection + 180 ) % 360 ) * ( M_PI / 180 );
1176 windvec = windvec.normalized();
1177 windvec.y = -std::cos( raddir );
1178 windvec.x = std::sin( raddir );
1179 rl_vec2d fv = face_vec();
1180 double dot = windvec.dot_product( fv );
1181 if( dot <= 0 ) {
1182 dot = std::min( -0.1, dot );
1183 } else {
1184 dot = std::max( 0.1, dot );
1185 }
1186 int windeffectint = static_cast<int>( ( windpower * dot ) * 200 );
1187 pwr = std::max( 1, pwr + windeffectint );
1188 }
1189 }
1190
1191 if( pwr < 0 ) {
1192 return pwr; // Consumers always draw full power, even if broken
1193 }
1194 if( at_full_hp ) {
1195 return pwr; // Assume full hp
1196 }
1197 // Damaged engines give less power, but some engines handle it better
1198 double health = parts[index].health_percent();
1199 // dpf is 0 for engines that scale power linearly with damage and
1200 // provides a floor otherwise
1201 float dpf = part_info( index ).engine_damaged_power_factor();
1202 double effective_percent = dpf + ( ( 1 - dpf ) * health );
1203 return static_cast<int>( pwr * effective_percent );
1204}
1205
1206// alternators, solar panels, reactors, and accessories all have epower.
1207// alternators, solar panels, and reactors provide, whilst accessories consume.
1208// for motor consumption see @ref vpart_info::energy_consumption instead
1209int vehicle::part_epower_w( const int index ) const
1210{
1211 int e = part_info( index ).epower;
1212 if( e < 0 ) {
1213 return e; // Consumers always draw full power, even if broken
1214 }
1215 return e * parts[ index ].health_percent();
1216}
1217
1218int vehicle::power_to_energy_bat( const int power_w, const time_duration &d ) const
1219{
1220 // Integrate constant epower (watts) over time to get units of battery energy
1221 // Thousands of watts over millions of seconds can happen, so 32-bit int
1222 // insufficient.
1223 int64_t energy_j = power_w * to_seconds<int64_t>( d );
1224 int energy_bat = energy_j / bat_energy_j;
1225 int sign = power_w >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
1226 // energy_bat remainder results in chance at additional charge/discharge
1227 energy_bat += x_in_y( std::abs( energy_j % bat_energy_j ), bat_energy_j ) ? sign : 0;
1228 return energy_bat;
1229}
1230
1231int vehicle::vhp_to_watts( const int power_vhp )
1232{
1233 // Convert vhp units (0.5 HP ) to watts
1234 // Used primarily for calculating battery charge/discharge
1235 // TODO: convert batteries to use energy units based on watts (watt-ticks?)
1236 constexpr int conversion_factor = 373; // 373 watts == 1 power_vhp == 0.5 HP
1237 return power_vhp * conversion_factor;
1238}
1239
1240bool vehicle::has_structural_part( const point &dp ) const
1241{
1242 for( const int elem : parts_at_relative( dp, false ) ) {
1243 if( part_info( elem ).location == part_location_structure &&
1244 !part_info( elem ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1245 return true;
1246 }
1247 }
1248 return false;
1249}
1250
1251/**
1252 * Returns whether or not the vehicle has a structural part queued for removal,
1253 * @return true if a structural is queue for removal, false if not.
1254 * */
1255bool vehicle::is_structural_part_removed() const
1256{
1257 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
1258 if( vp.part().removed && vp.info().location == part_location_structure ) {
1259 return true;
1260 }
1261 }
1262 return false;
1263}
1264
1265/**
1266 * Returns whether or not the vehicle part with the given id can be mounted in
1267 * the specified square.
1268 * @param dp The local coordinate to mount in.
1269 * @param id The id of the part to install.
1270 * @return true if the part can be mounted, false if not.
1271 */
1272bool vehicle::can_mount( const point &dp, const vpart_id &id ) const
1273{
1274 //The part has to actually exist.
1275 if( !id.is_valid() ) {
1276 return false;
1277 }
1278
1279 //It also has to be a real part, not the null part
1280 const vpart_info &part = id.obj();
1281 if( part.has_flag( "NOINSTALL" ) ) {
1282 return false;
1283 }
1284
1285 const std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( dp, false );
1286
1287 //First part in an empty square MUST be a structural part
1288 if( parts_in_square.empty() && part.location != part_location_structure ) {
1289 return false;
1290 }
1291 // If its a part that harnesses animals that don't allow placing on it.
1292 if( !parts_in_square.empty() && part_info( parts_in_square[0] ).has_flag( "ANIMAL_CTRL" ) ) {
1293 return false;
1294 }
1295 //No other part can be placed on a protrusion
1296 if( !parts_in_square.empty() && part_info( parts_in_square[0] ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1297 return false;
1298 }
1299
1300 //No part type can stack with itself, or any other part in the same slot
1301 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1302 const vpart_info &other_part = parts[elem].info();
1303
1304 //Parts with no location can stack with each other (but not themselves)
1305 if( part.get_id() == other_part.get_id() ||
1306 ( !part.location.empty() && part.location == other_part.location ) ) {
1307 return false;
1308 }
1309 // Until we have an interface for handling multiple components with CARGO space,
1310 // exclude them from being mounted in the same tile.
1311 if( part.has_flag( "CARGO" ) && other_part.has_flag( "CARGO" ) ) {
1312 return false;
1313 }
1314
1315 }
1316
1317 // All parts after the first must be installed on or next to an existing part
1318 // the exception is when a single tile only structural object is being repaired
1319 if( !parts.empty() ) {
1320 if( !is_structural_part_removed() &&
1321 !has_structural_part( dp ) &&
1322 !has_structural_part( dp + point_east ) &&
1323 !has_structural_part( dp + point_south ) &&
1324 !has_structural_part( dp + point_west ) &&
1325 !has_structural_part( dp + point_north ) ) {
1326 return false;
1327 }
1328 }
1329
1330 // only one exclusive engine allowed
1331 std::string empty;
1332 if( has_engine_conflict( &part, empty ) ) {
1333 return false;
1334 }
1335
1336 // Check all the flags of the part to see if they require other flags
1337 // If other flags are required check if those flags are present
1338 for( const std::string &flag : part.get_flags() ) {
1339 if( !json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag().empty() ) {
1340 bool anchor_found = false;
1341 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1342 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag() ) ) {
1343 anchor_found = true;
1344 }
1345 }
1346 if( !anchor_found ) {
1347 return false;
1348 }
1349 }
1350 }
1351
1352 //Mirrors cannot be mounted on OPAQUE parts
1353 if( part.has_flag( "VISION" ) && !part.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
1354 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1355 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "OPAQUE" ) ) {
1356 return false;
1357 }
1358 }
1359 }
1360 //Opaque parts cannot be mounted on mirrors parts
1361 if( part.has_flag( "OPAQUE" ) ) {
1362 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1363 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "VISION" ) &&
1364 !part_info( elem ).has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
1365 return false;
1366 }
1367 }
1368 }
1369
1370 //Turret mounts must NOT be installed on other (modded) turret mounts
1371 if( part.has_flag( "TURRET_MOUNT" ) ) {
1372 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1373 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "TURRET_MOUNT" ) ) {
1374 return false;
1375 }
1376 }
1377 }
1378
1379 //Anything not explicitly denied is permitted
1380 return true;
1381}
1382
1383bool vehicle::can_unmount( const int p ) const
1384{
1385 std::string no_reason;
1386 return can_unmount( p, no_reason );
1387}
1388
1389bool vehicle::can_unmount( const int p, std::string &reason ) const
1390{
1391 if( p < 0 || p > static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1392 return false;
1393 }
1394
1395 // Find all the flags on parts in this tile that require other flags
1396 const point pt = parts[p].mount;
1397 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( pt, false );
1398
1399 for( auto &elem : parts_here ) {
1400 for( const std::string &flag : part_info( elem ).get_flags() ) {
1401 if( part_info( p ).has_flag( json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag() ) ) {
1402 reason = string_format( _( "Remove the attached %s first." ), part_info( elem ).name() );
1403 return false;
1404 }
1405 }
1406 }
1407
1408 //Can't remove an animal part if the animal is still contained
1409 if( parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag ) ) {
1410 reason = _( "Remove carried animal first." );
1411 return false;
1412 }
1413
1414 //Structural parts have extra requirements
1415 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
1416
1417 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, false );
1418 /* To remove a structural part, there can be only structural parts left
1419 * in that square (might be more than one in the case of wreckage) */
1420 for( auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1421 if( part_info( elem ).location != part_location_structure ) {
1422 reason = _( "Remove all other attached parts first." );
1423 return false;
1424 }
1425 }
1426
1427 //If it's the last part in the square...
1428 if( parts_in_square.size() == 1 ) {
1429
1430 /* This is the tricky part: We can't remove a part that would cause
1431 * the vehicle to 'break into two' (like removing the middle section
1432 * of a quad bike, for instance). This basically requires doing some
1433 * breadth-first searches to ensure previously connected parts are
1434 * still connected. */
1435
1436 //First, find all the squares connected to the one we're removing
1437 std::vector<vehicle_part> connected_parts;
1438
1439 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
1440 const point next = parts[p].mount + point( i < 2 ? ( i == 0 ? -1 : 1 ) : 0,
1441 i < 2 ? 0 : ( i == 2 ? -1 : 1 ) );
1442 std::vector<int> parts_over_there = parts_at_relative( next, false );
1443 //Ignore empty squares
1444 if( !parts_over_there.empty() ) {
1445 //Just need one part from the square to track the x/y
1446 connected_parts.push_back( parts[parts_over_there[0]] );
1447 }
1448 }
1449
1450 /* If size = 0, it's the last part of the whole vehicle, so we're OK
1451 * If size = 1, it's one protruding part (i.e., bicycle wheel), so OK
1452 * Otherwise, it gets complicated... */
1453 if( connected_parts.size() > 1 ) {
1454
1455 /* We'll take connected_parts[0] to be the target part.
1456 * Every other part must have some path (that doesn't involve
1457 * the part about to be removed) to the target part, in order
1458 * for the part to be legally removable. */
1459 for( const auto &next_part : connected_parts ) {
1460 if( !is_connected( connected_parts[0], next_part, parts[p] ) ) {
1461 //Removing that part would break the vehicle in two
1462 reason = _( "Removing this part would split the vehicle." );
1463 return false;
1464 }
1465 }
1466
1467 }
1468
1469 }
1470 }
1471 //Anything not explicitly denied is permitted
1472 return true;
1473}
1474
1475/**
1476 * Performs a breadth-first search from one part to another, to see if a path
1477 * exists between the two without going through the excluded part. Used to see
1478 * if a part can be legally removed.
1479 * @param to The part to reach.
1480 * @param from The part to start the search from.
1481 * @param excluded_part The part that is being removed and, therefore, should not
1482 * be included in the path.
1483 * @return true if a path exists without the excluded part, false otherwise.
1484 */
1485bool vehicle::is_connected( const vehicle_part &to, const vehicle_part &from,
1486 const vehicle_part &excluded_part ) const
1487{
1488 const auto target = to.mount;
1489 const auto excluded = excluded_part.mount;
1490
1491 //Breadth-first-search components
1492 std::list<vehicle_part> discovered;
1493 std::list<vehicle_part> searched;
1494
1495 //We begin with just the start point
1496 discovered.push_back( from );
1497
1498 while( !discovered.empty() ) {
1499 vehicle_part current_part = discovered.front();
1500 discovered.pop_front();
1501 auto current = current_part.mount;
1502
1503 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
1504 point next = current + offset;
1505
1506 if( next == target ) {
1507 //Success!
1508 return true;
1509 } else if( next == excluded ) {
1510 //There might be a path, but we're not allowed to go that way
1511 continue;
1512 }
1513
1514 std::vector<int> parts_there = parts_at_relative( next, true );
1515
1516 if( !parts_there.empty() && !parts[ parts_there[ 0 ] ].removed &&
1517 part_info( parts_there[ 0 ] ).location == "structure" &&
1518 !part_info( parts_there[ 0 ] ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1519 //Only add the part if we haven't been here before
1520 bool found = false;
1521 for( auto &elem : discovered ) {
1522 if( elem.mount == next ) {
1523 found = true;
1524 break;
1525 }
1526 }
1527 if( !found ) {
1528 for( auto &elem : searched ) {
1529 if( elem.mount == next ) {
1530 found = true;
1531 break;
1532 }
1533 }
1534 }
1535 if( !found ) {
1536 vehicle_part next_part = parts[parts_there[0]];
1537 discovered.push_back( next_part );
1538 }
1539 }
1540 }
1541 //Now that that's done, we've finished exploring here
1542 searched.push_back( current_part );
1543 }
1544 //If we completely exhaust the discovered list, there's no path
1545 return false;
1546}
1547
1548/**
1549 * Installs a part into this vehicle.
1550 * @param dp The coordinate of where to install the part.
1551 * @param id The string ID of the part to install. (see vehicle_parts.json)
1552 * @param force Skip check of whether we can mount the part here.
1553 * @return false if the part could not be installed, true otherwise.
1554 */
1555int vehicle::install_part( const point &dp, const vpart_id &id, bool force )
1556{
1557 if( !( force || can_mount( dp, id ) ) ) {
1558 return -1;
1559 }
1560 return install_part( dp, vehicle_part( id, dp, item( id.obj().item ) ) );
1561}
1562
1563int vehicle::install_part( const point &dp, const vpart_id &id, item &&obj, bool force )
1564{
1565 if( !( force || can_mount( dp, id ) ) ) {
1566 return -1;
1567 }
1568 return install_part( dp, vehicle_part( id, dp, std::move( obj ) ) );
1569}
1570
1571int vehicle::install_part( const point &dp, const vehicle_part &new_part )
1572{
1573 // Should be checked before installing the part
1574 bool enable = false;
1575 if( new_part.is_engine() ) {
1576 enable = true;
1577 } else {
1578 // TODO: read toggle groups from JSON
1579 static const std::vector<std::string> enable_like = {{
1580 "CONE_LIGHT",
1581 "CIRCLE_LIGHT",
1582 "AISLE_LIGHT",
1583 "AUTOPILOT",
1584 "DOME_LIGHT",
1585 "ATOMIC_LIGHT",
1586 "STEREO",
1587 "CHIMES",
1588 "FRIDGE",
1589 "FREEZER",
1590 "RECHARGE",
1591 "PLOW",
1592 "REAPER",
1593 "PLANTER",
1594 "SCOOP",
1595 "SPACE_HEATER",
1596 "COOLER",
1597 "WATER_PURIFIER",
1598 "ROCKWHEEL",
1599 "ROADHEAD"
1600 }
1601 };
1602
1603 for( const std::string &flag : enable_like ) {
1604 if( new_part.info().has_flag( flag ) ) {
1605 enable = has_part( flag, true );
1606 break;
1607 }
1608 }
1609 }
1610
1611 parts.push_back( new_part );
1612 auto &pt = parts.back();
1613
1614 pt.enabled = enable;
1615
1616 pt.mount = dp;
1617
1618 refresh();
1619 coeff_air_changed = true;
1620 return parts.size() - 1;
1621}
1622
1623bool vehicle::try_to_rack_nearby_vehicle( const std::vector<std::vector<int>> &list_of_racks )
1624{
1625 for( const auto &this_bike_rack : list_of_racks ) {
1626 std::vector<vehicle *> carry_vehs;
1627 carry_vehs.assign( 4, nullptr );
1628 vehicle *test_veh = nullptr;
1629 std::set<tripoint> veh_partial_match;
1630 std::vector<std::set<tripoint>> partial_matches;
1631 partial_matches.assign( 4, veh_partial_match );
1632 for( auto rack_part : this_bike_rack ) {
1633 tripoint rack_pos = global_part_pos3( rack_part );
1634 int i = 0;
1635 for( const point &offset : four_cardinal_directions ) {
1636 tripoint search_pos( rack_pos + offset );
1637 test_veh = veh_pointer_or_null( g->m.veh_at( search_pos ) );
1638 if( test_veh == nullptr || test_veh == this ) {
1639 continue;
1640 } else if( test_veh != carry_vehs[ i ] ) {
1641 carry_vehs[ i ] = test_veh;
1642 partial_matches[ i ].clear();
1643 }
1644 partial_matches[ i ].insert( search_pos );
1645 if( partial_matches[ i ] == test_veh->get_points() ) {
1646 return merge_rackable_vehicle( test_veh, this_bike_rack );
1647 }
1648 ++i;
1649 }
1650 }
1651 }
1652 return false;
1653}
1654
1655bool vehicle::merge_rackable_vehicle( vehicle *carry_veh, const std::vector<int> &rack_parts )
1656{
1657 // Mapping between the old vehicle and new vehicle mounting points
1658 struct mapping {
1659 // All the parts attached to this mounting point
1660 std::vector<int> carry_parts_here;
1661
1662 // the index where the racking part is on the vehicle with the rack
1663 int rack_part;
1664
1665 // the mount point we are going to add to the vehicle with the rack
1666 point carry_mount;
1667
1668 // the mount point on the old vehicle (carry_veh) that will be destroyed
1669 point old_mount;
1670 };
1671 invalidate_towing( true );
1672 // By structs, we mean all the parts of the carry vehicle that are at the structure location
1673 // of the vehicle (i.e. frames)
1674 std::vector<int> carry_veh_structs = carry_veh->all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
1675 std::vector<mapping> carry_data;
1676 carry_data.reserve( carry_veh_structs.size() );
1677
1678 //X is forward/backward, Y is left/right
1679 std::string axis;
1680 if( carry_veh_structs.size() == 1 ) {
1681 axis = "X";
1682 } else {
1683 for( auto carry_part : carry_veh_structs ) {
1684 if( carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.x || carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.y ) {
1685 axis = carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.x ? "X" : "Y";
1686 }
1687 }
1688 }
1689
1690 units::angle relative_dir = normalize( carry_veh->face.dir() - face.dir() );
1691 units::angle relative_180 = units::fmod( relative_dir, 180_degrees );
1692 units::angle face_dir_180 = normalize( face.dir(), 180_degrees );
1693
1694 // if the carrier is skewed N/S and the carried vehicle isn't aligned with
1695 // the carrier, force the carried vehicle to be at a right angle
1696 if( face_dir_180 >= 45_degrees && face_dir_180 <= 135_degrees ) {
1697 if( relative_180 >= 45_degrees && relative_180 <= 135_degrees ) {
1698 if( relative_dir < 180_degrees ) {
1699 relative_dir = 90_degrees;
1700 } else {
1701 relative_dir = 270_degrees;
1702 }
1703 }
1704 }
1705
1706 // We look at each of the structure parts (mount points, i.e. frames) for the
1707 // carry vehicle and then find a rack part adjacent to it. If we don't find a rack part,
1708 // then we can't merge.
1709 bool found_all_parts = true;
1710 for( auto carry_part : carry_veh_structs ) {
1711
1712 // The current position on the original vehicle for this part
1713 tripoint carry_pos = carry_veh->global_part_pos3( carry_part );
1714
1715 bool merged_part = false;
1716 for( int rack_part : rack_parts ) {
1717 size_t j = 0;
1718 // There's no mathematical transform from global pos3 to vehicle mount, so search for the
1719 // carry part in global pos3 after translating
1720 point carry_mount;
1721 for( const point &offset : four_cardinal_directions ) {
1722 carry_mount = parts[ rack_part ].mount + offset;
1723 tripoint possible_pos = mount_to_tripoint( carry_mount );
1724 if( possible_pos == carry_pos ) {
1725 break;
1726 }
1727 ++j;
1728 }
1729
1730 // We checked the adjacent points from the mounting rack and managed
1731 // to find the current structure part were looking for nearby. If the part was not
1732 // near this particular rack, we would look at each in the list of rack_parts
1733 const bool carry_part_next_to_this_rack = j < four_adjacent_offsets.size();
1734 if( carry_part_next_to_this_rack ) {
1735 mapping carry_map;
1736 point old_mount = carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount;
1737 carry_map.carry_parts_here = carry_veh->parts_at_relative( old_mount, true );
1738 carry_map.rack_part = rack_part;
1739 carry_map.carry_mount = carry_mount;
1740 carry_map.old_mount = old_mount;
1741 carry_data.push_back( carry_map );
1742 merged_part = true;
1743 break;
1744 }
1745 }
1746
1747 // We checked all the racks and could not find a place for this structure part.
1748 if( !merged_part ) {
1749 found_all_parts = false;
1750 break;
1751 }
1752 }
1753
1754 // Now that we have mapped all the parts of the carry vehicle to the vehicle with the rack
1755 // we can go ahead and merge
1756 const point mount_zero{};
1757 if( found_all_parts ) {
1758 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
1759 for( auto carry_map : carry_data ) {
1760 std::string offset = string_format( "%s%3d", carry_map.old_mount == mount_zero ? axis : " ",
1761 axis == "X" ? carry_map.old_mount.x : carry_map.old_mount.y );
1762 std::string unique_id = string_format( "%s%3d%s", offset,
1763 static_cast<int>( to_degrees( relative_dir ) ),
1764 carry_veh->name );
1765 for( int carry_part : carry_map.carry_parts_here ) {
1766 parts.push_back( carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ] );
1767 vehicle_part &carried_part = parts.back();
1768 carried_part.mount = carry_map.carry_mount;
1769 carried_part.carry_names.push( unique_id );
1770 carried_part.enabled = false;
1771 carried_part.set_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag );
1772 //give each carried part a tracked_flag so that we can re-enable overmap tracking on unloading if necessary
1773 if( carry_veh->tracking_on ) {
1774 carried_part.set_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
1775 }
1776 parts[ carry_map.rack_part ].set_flag( vehicle_part::carrying_flag );
1777 }
1778
1779 const std::pair<std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator, std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator>
1780 zones_on_point = carry_veh->loot_zones.equal_range( carry_map.old_mount );
1781 for( std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::const_iterator it = zones_on_point.first;
1782 it != zones_on_point.second; ++it ) {
1783 new_zones.emplace( carry_map.carry_mount, it->second );
1784 }
1785 }
1786
1787 for( auto &new_zone : new_zones ) {
1788 zone_manager::get_manager().create_vehicle_loot_zone(
1789 *this, new_zone.first, new_zone.second );
1790 }
1791
1792 // Now that we've added zones to this vehicle, we need to make sure their positions
1793 // update when we next interact with them
1794 zones_dirty = true;
1795
1796 //~ %1$s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
1797 add_msg( _( "You load the %1$s on the rack" ), carry_veh->name );
1798 map &here = get_map();
1799 here.destroy_vehicle( carry_veh );
1800 here.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( this );
1801 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
1802 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );
1803 refresh();
1804 } else {
1805 //~ %1$s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
1806 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You can't get the %1$s on the rack" ), carry_veh->name );
1807 }
1808 return found_all_parts;
1809}
1810
1811/**
1812 * Mark a part as removed from the vehicle.
1813 * @return bool true if the vehicle's 0,0 point shifted.
1814 */
1815bool vehicle::remove_part( const int p )
1816{
1817 DefaultRemovePartHandler handler;
1818 return remove_part( p, handler );
1819}
1820
1821bool vehicle::remove_part( const int p, RemovePartHandler &handler )
1822{
1823 // NOTE: Don't access g or g->m or anything from it directly here.
1824 // Forward all access to the handler.
1825 // There are currently two implementations of it:
1826 // - one for normal game play (vehicle is on the main map g->m),
1827 // - one for mapgen (vehicle is on a temporary map used only during mapgen).
1828 if( p >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1829 debugmsg( "Tried to remove part %d but only %d parts!", p, parts.size() );
1830 return false;
1831 }
1832 if( parts[p].removed ) {
1833 /* This happens only when we had to remove part, because it was depending on
1834 * other part (using recursive remove_part() call) - currently curtain
1835 * depending on presence of window and seatbelt depending on presence of seat.
1836 */
1837 return false;
1838 }
1839
1840 const tripoint part_loc = global_part_pos3( p );
1841
1842 // Unboard any entities standing on removed boardable parts
1843 if( part_flag( p, "BOARDABLE" ) && parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
1844 handler.unboard( part_loc );
1845 }
1846
1847 // If `p` has flag `parent_flag`, remove child with flag `child_flag`
1848 // Returns true if removal occurs
1849 const auto remove_dependent_part = [&]( const std::string & parent_flag,
1850 const std::string & child_flag ) {
1851 if( part_flag( p, parent_flag ) ) {
1852 int dep = part_with_feature( p, child_flag, false );
1853 if( dep >= 0 && !magic ) {
1854 handler.add_item_or_charges( part_loc, parts[dep].properties_to_item(), false );
1855 remove_part( dep, handler );
1856 return true;
1857 }
1858 }
1859 return false;
1860 };
1861
1862 // if a windshield is removed (usually destroyed) also remove curtains
1863 // attached to it.
1864 if( remove_dependent_part( "WINDOW", "CURTAIN" ) || part_flag( p, VPFLAG_OPAQUE ) ) {
1865 handler.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
1866 }
1867
1868 if( part_flag( p, VPFLAG_ROOF ) || part_flag( p, VPFLAG_OPAQUE ) ) {
1869 handler.set_floor_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z + 1 );
1870 }
1871
1872 remove_dependent_part( "SEAT", "SEATBELT" );
1873 remove_dependent_part( "BATTERY_MOUNT", "NEEDS_BATTERY_MOUNT" );
1874
1875 // Release any animal held by the part
1876 if( parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag ) ) {
1877 item base = parts[p].get_base();
1878 handler.spawn_animal_from_part( base, part_loc );
1879 parts[p].set_base( base );
1880 parts[p].remove_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag );
1881 }
1882
1883 // Update current engine configuration if needed
1884 if( part_flag( p, "ENGINE" ) && engines.size() > 1 ) {
1885 bool any_engine_on = false;
1886
1887 for( auto &e : engines ) {
1888 if( e != p && is_part_on( e ) ) {
1889 any_engine_on = true;
1890 break;
1891 }
1892 }
1893
1894 if( !any_engine_on ) {
1895 engine_on = false;
1896 for( auto &e : engines ) {
1897 toggle_specific_part( e, true );
1898 }
1899 }
1900 }
1901
1902 //Remove loot zone if Cargo was removed.
1903 const auto lz_iter = loot_zones.find( parts[p].mount );
1904 const bool no_zone = lz_iter != loot_zones.end();
1905
1906 if( no_zone && part_flag( p, "CARGO" ) ) {
1907 // Using the key here (instead of the iterator) will remove all zones on
1908 // this mount points regardless of how many there are
1909 loot_zones.erase( parts[p].mount );
1910 zones_dirty = true;
1911 }
1912 parts[p].removed = true;
1913 removed_part_count++;
1914
1915 handler.removed( *this, p );
1916
1917 const point &vp_mount = parts[p].mount;
1918 const auto iter = labels.find( label( vp_mount ) );
1919 if( iter != labels.end() && parts_at_relative( vp_mount, false ).empty() ) {
1920 labels.erase( iter );
1921 }
1922
1923 for( auto &i : get_items( p ) ) {
1924 // Note: this can spawn items on the other side of the wall!
1925 // TODO: fix this ^^
1926 tripoint dest( part_loc + point( rng( -3, 3 ), rng( -3, 3 ) ) );
1927 if( !magic ) {
1928 // This new point might be out of the map bounds. It's not
1929 // reasonable to try to spawn it outside the currently valid map,
1930 // so we pass true here to cause such points to be clamped to the
1931 // valid bounds without printing an error (as would normally
1932 // occur).
1933 handler.add_item_or_charges( dest, i, true );
1934 }
1935 }
1936 refresh();
1937 coeff_air_changed = true;
1938 return shift_if_needed();
1939}
1940
1941void vehicle::part_removal_cleanup()
1942{
1943 bool changed = false;
1944 map &here = get_map();
1945 for( std::vector<vehicle_part>::iterator it = parts.begin(); it != parts.end(); /* noop */ ) {
1946 if( it->removed ) {
1947 auto items = get_items( std::distance( parts.begin(), it ) );
1948 while( !items.empty() ) {
1949 items.erase( items.begin() );
1950 }
1951 const tripoint &pt = global_part_pos3( *it );
1952 here.clear_vehicle_point_from_cache( this, pt );
1953 it = parts.erase( it );
1954 changed = true;
1955 } else {
1956 ++it;
1957 }
1958 }
1959 removed_part_count = 0;
1960 if( changed || parts.empty() ) {
1961 refresh();
1962 if( parts.empty() ) {
1963 here.destroy_vehicle( this );
1964 return;
1965 } else {
1966 here.add_vehicle_to_cache( this );
1967 }
1968 }
1969 shift_if_needed();
1970 refresh(); // Rebuild cached indices
1971 coeff_air_dirty = coeff_air_changed;
1972 coeff_air_changed = false;
1973}
1974
1975void vehicle::remove_carried_flag()
1976{
1977 for( vehicle_part &part : parts ) {
1978 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1979 // note: we get here if the part was added while the vehicle was carried / mounted. This is not expected.
1980 // still try to remove the carried flag, if any.
1981 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag );
1982 } else {
1983 part.carry_names.pop();
1984 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1985 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag );
1986 }
1987 }
1988 }
1989}
1990
1991void vehicle::remove_tracked_flag()
1992{
1993 for( vehicle_part &part : parts ) {
1994 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1995 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
1996 } else {
1997 part.carry_names.pop();
1998 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1999 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
2000 }
2001 }
2002 }
2003}
2004
2005bool vehicle::remove_carried_vehicle( const std::vector<int> &carried_parts )
2006{
2007 if( carried_parts.empty() ) {
2008 return false;
2009 }
2010 std::string veh_record;
2011 tripoint new_pos3;
2012 bool x_aligned = false;
2013 bool tracked_parts =
2014 false; // we will set this to true if any of the vehicle parts carry a tracked_flag
2015 for( int carried_part : carried_parts ) {
2016 //check if selected part carries tracking flag
2017 if( parts[carried_part].has_flag(
2018 vehicle_part::tracked_flag ) ) { //this should only need to run once
2019 tracked_parts = true;
2020 }
2021 const auto &carry_names = parts[carried_part].carry_names;
2022 if( !carry_names.empty() ) {
2023 std::string id_string = carry_names.top().substr( 0, 1 );
2024 if( id_string == "X" || id_string == "Y" ) {
2025 veh_record = carry_names.top();
2026 new_pos3 = global_part_pos3( carried_part );
2027 x_aligned = id_string == "X";
2028 break;
2029 }
2030 }
2031 }
2032 if( veh_record.empty() ) {
2033 return false;
2034 }
2035 units::angle new_dir =
2036 normalize( units::from_degrees( std::stoi( veh_record.substr( 4, 3 ) ) ) + face.dir() );
2037 units::angle host_dir = normalize( face.dir(), 180_degrees );
2038 // if the host is skewed N/S, and the carried vehicle is going to come at an angle,
2039 // force it to east/west instead
2040 if( host_dir >= 45_degrees && host_dir <= 135_degrees ) {
2041 if( new_dir <= 45_degrees || new_dir >= 315_degrees ) {
2042 new_dir = 0_degrees;
2043 } else if( new_dir >= 135_degrees && new_dir <= 225_degrees ) {
2044 new_dir = 180_degrees;
2045 }
2046 }
2047 vehicle *new_vehicle = g->m.add_vehicle( vproto_id( "none" ), new_pos3, new_dir );
2048 if( new_vehicle == nullptr ) {
2049 add_msg( m_debug, "Unable to unload bike rack, host face %d, new_dir %d!",
2050 to_degrees( face.dir() ), to_degrees( new_dir ) );
2051 return false;
2052 }
2053
2054 std::vector<point> new_mounts;
2055 new_vehicle->name = veh_record.substr( vehicle_part::name_offset );
2056 for( auto carried_part : carried_parts ) {
2057 point new_mount;
2058 std::string mount_str;
2059 if( !parts[carried_part].carry_names.empty() ) {
2060 // the mount string should be something like "X 0 0" for ex. We get the first number out of it.
2061 mount_str = parts[carried_part].carry_names.top().substr( 1, 3 );
2062 } else {
2063 // FIX #28712; if we get here it means that a part was added to the bike while the latter was a carried vehicle.
2064 // This part didn't get a carry_names because those are assigned when the carried vehicle is loaded.
2065 // We can't be sure to which vehicle it really belongs to, so it will be detached from the vehicle.
2066 // We can at least inform the player that there's something wrong.
2067 add_msg( m_warning,
2068 _( "A part of the vehicle ('%s') has no containing vehicle's name. It will be detached from the %s vehicle." ),
2069 parts[carried_part].name(), new_vehicle->name );
2070
2071 // check if any other parts at the same location have a valid carry name so we can still have a valid mount location.
2072 for( auto &local_part : parts_at_relative( parts[carried_part].mount, true ) ) {
2073 if( !parts[local_part].carry_names.empty() ) {
2074 mount_str = parts[local_part].carry_names.top().substr( 1, 3 );
2075 break;
2076 }
2077 }
2078 }
2079 if( mount_str.empty() ) {
2080 add_msg( m_bad,
2081 _( "There's not viable mount location on this vehicle: %s. It can't be unloaded from the rack." ),
2082 new_vehicle->name );
2083 return false;
2084 }
2085 if( x_aligned ) {
2086 new_mount.x = std::stoi( mount_str );
2087 } else {
2088 new_mount.y = std::stoi( mount_str );
2089 }
2090 new_mounts.push_back( new_mount );
2091 }
2092
2093 std::vector<vehicle *> new_vehicles;
2094 new_vehicles.push_back( new_vehicle );
2095 std::vector<std::vector<int>> carried_vehicles;
2096 carried_vehicles.push_back( carried_parts );
2097 std::vector<std::vector<point>> carried_mounts;
2098 carried_mounts.push_back( new_mounts );
2099 const bool success = split_vehicles( carried_vehicles, new_vehicles, carried_mounts );
2100 if( success ) {
2101 //~ %s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
2102 add_msg( _( "You unload the %s from the bike rack." ), new_vehicle->name );
2103 new_vehicle->remove_carried_flag();
2104 if( tracked_parts ) {
2105 new_vehicle->toggle_tracking(); //turn on tracking for our newly created vehicle
2106 new_vehicle->remove_tracked_flag(); //remove our tracking flags now that the vehicle isn't carried
2107 }
2108 g->m.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( this );
2109 part_removal_cleanup();
2110 } else {
2111 //~ %s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
2112 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You can't unload the %s from the bike rack." ), new_vehicle->name );
2113 }
2114 return success;
2115}
2116
2117// split the current vehicle into up to 3 new vehicles that do not connect to each other
2118bool vehicle::find_and_split_vehicles( int exclude )
2119{
2120 std::vector<int> valid_parts = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
2121 std::set<int> checked_parts;
2122 checked_parts.insert( exclude );
2123
2124 std::vector<std::vector <int>> all_vehicles;
2125
2126 for( size_t cnt = 0 ; cnt < 4 ; cnt++ ) {
2127 int test_part = -1;
2128 for( auto p : valid_parts ) {
2129 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
2130 continue;
2131 }
2132 if( checked_parts.find( p ) == checked_parts.end() ) {
2133 test_part = p;
2134 break;
2135 }
2136 }
2137 if( test_part == -1 || static_cast<size_t>( test_part ) > parts.size() ) {
2138 break;
2139 }
2140
2141 std::queue<std::pair<int, std::vector<int>>> search_queue;
2142
2143 const auto push_neighbor = [&]( int p, const std::vector<int> &with_p ) {
2144 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> data( p, with_p );
2145 search_queue.push( data );
2146 };
2147 auto pop_neighbor = [&]() {
2148 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> result = search_queue.front();
2149 search_queue.pop();
2150 return result;
2151 };
2152
2153 std::vector<int> veh_parts;
2154 push_neighbor( test_part, parts_at_relative( parts[ test_part ].mount, true ) );
2155 while( !search_queue.empty() ) {
2156 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> test_set = pop_neighbor();
2157 test_part = test_set.first;
2158 if( checked_parts.find( test_part ) != checked_parts.end() ) {
2159 continue;
2160 }
2161 for( auto p : test_set.second ) {
2162 veh_parts.push_back( p );
2163 }
2164 checked_parts.insert( test_part );
2165 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
2166 const point dp = parts[test_part].mount + offset;
2167 std::vector<int> all_neighbor_parts = parts_at_relative( dp, true );
2168 int neighbor_struct_part = -1;
2169 for( int p : all_neighbor_parts ) {
2170 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
2171 continue;
2172 }
2173 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
2174 neighbor_struct_part = p;
2175 break;
2176 }
2177 }
2178 if( neighbor_struct_part != -1 ) {
2179 push_neighbor( neighbor_struct_part, all_neighbor_parts );
2180 }
2181 }
2182 }
2183 // don't include the first vehicle's worth of parts
2184 if( cnt > 0 ) {
2185 all_vehicles.push_back( veh_parts );
2186 }
2187 }
2188
2189 if( !all_vehicles.empty() ) {
2190 bool success = split_vehicles( all_vehicles );
2191 if( success ) {
2192 // update the active cache
2193 shift_parts( point_zero );
2194 return true;
2195 }
2196 }
2197 return false;
2198}
2199
2200void vehicle::relocate_passengers( const std::vector<player *> &passengers )
2201{
2202 const auto boardables = get_avail_parts( "BOARDABLE" );
2203 for( player *passenger : passengers ) {
2204 for( const vpart_reference &vp : boardables ) {
2205 if( vp.part().passenger_id == passenger->getID() ) {
2206 passenger->setpos( vp.pos() );
2207 }
2208 }
2209 }
2210}
2211
2212// Split a vehicle into an old vehicle and one or more new vehicles by moving vehicle_parts
2213// from one the old vehicle to the new vehicles.
2214// some of the logic borrowed from remove_part
2215// skipped the grab, curtain, player activity, and engine checks because they deal
2216// with pos, not a vehicle pointer
2217// @param new_vehs vector of vectors of part indexes to move to new vehicles
2218// @param new_vehicles vector of vehicle pointers containing the new vehicles; if empty, new
2219// vehicles will be created
2220// @param new_mounts vector of vector of mount points. must have one vector for every vehicle*
2221// in new_vehicles, and forces the part indices in new_vehs to be mounted on the new vehicle
2222// at those mount points
2223bool vehicle::split_vehicles( const std::vector<std::vector <int>> &new_vehs,
2224 const std::vector<vehicle *> &new_vehicles,
2225 const std::vector<std::vector <point>> &new_mounts )
2226{
2227 bool did_split = false;
2228 size_t i = 0;
2229 for( i = 0; i < new_vehs.size(); i ++ ) {
2230 std::vector<int> split_parts = new_vehs[ i ];
2231 if( split_parts.empty() ) {
2232 continue;
2233 }
2234 std::vector<point> split_mounts = new_mounts[ i ];
2235 did_split = true;
2236
2237 vehicle *new_vehicle = nullptr;
2238 if( i < new_vehicles.size() ) {
2239 new_vehicle = new_vehicles[ i ];
2240 }
2241 int split_part0 = split_parts.front();
2242 tripoint new_v_pos3;
2243 point mnt_offset;
2244
2245 decltype( labels ) new_labels;
2246 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
2247 if( new_vehicle == nullptr ) {
2248 // make sure the split_part0 is a legal 0,0 part
2249 if( split_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2250 for( size_t sp = 0; sp < split_parts.size(); sp++ ) {
2251 int p = split_parts[ sp ];
2252 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure &&
2253 !part_info( p ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
2254 split_part0 = sp;
2255 break;
2256 }
2257 }
2258 }
2259 new_v_pos3 = global_part_pos3( parts[ split_part0 ] );
2260 mnt_offset = parts[ split_part0 ].mount;
2261 new_vehicle = g->m.add_vehicle( vproto_id( "none" ), new_v_pos3, face.dir() );
2262 if( new_vehicle == nullptr ) {
2263 // the split part was out of the map bounds.
2264 continue;
2265 }
2266 new_vehicle->name = name;
2267 new_vehicle->move = move;
2268 new_vehicle->turn_dir = turn_dir;
2269 new_vehicle->velocity = velocity;
2270 new_vehicle->vertical_velocity = vertical_velocity;
2271 new_vehicle->cruise_velocity = cruise_velocity;
2272 new_vehicle->cruise_on = cruise_on;
2273 new_vehicle->engine_on = engine_on;
2274 new_vehicle->tracking_on = tracking_on;
2275 new_vehicle->camera_on = camera_on;
2276 }
2277 new_vehicle->last_fluid_check = last_fluid_check;
2278
2279 std::vector<player *> passengers;
2280 for( size_t new_part = 0; new_part < split_parts.size(); new_part++ ) {
2281 int mov_part = split_parts[ new_part ];
2282 point cur_mount = parts[ mov_part ].mount;
2283 point new_mount = cur_mount;
2284 if( !split_mounts.empty() ) {
2285 new_mount = split_mounts[ new_part ];
2286 } else {
2287 new_mount -= mnt_offset;
2288 }
2289
2290 player *passenger = nullptr;
2291 // Unboard any entities standing on any transferred part
2292 if( part_flag( mov_part, "BOARDABLE" ) ) {
2293 passenger = get_passenger( mov_part );
2294 if( passenger ) {
2295 passengers.push_back( passenger );
2296 }
2297 }
2298 // if this part is a towing part, transfer the tow_data to the new vehicle.
2299 if( part_flag( mov_part, "TOW_CABLE" ) ) {
2300 if( is_towed() ) {
2301 tow_data.get_towed_by()->tow_data.set_towing( tow_data.get_towed_by(), new_vehicle );
2302 tow_data.clear_towing();
2303 } else if( is_towing() ) {
2304 tow_data.get_towed()->tow_data.set_towing( new_vehicle, tow_data.get_towed() );
2305 tow_data.clear_towing();
2306 }
2307 }
2308 // transfer the vehicle_part to the new vehicle
2309 new_vehicle->parts.emplace_back( parts[ mov_part ] );
2310 new_vehicle->parts.back().mount = new_mount;
2311
2312 // remove labels associated with the mov_part
2313 const auto iter = labels.find( label( cur_mount ) );
2314 if( iter != labels.end() ) {
2315 std::string label_str = iter->text;
2316 labels.erase( iter );
2317 new_labels.insert( label( new_mount, label_str ) );
2318 }
2319 // Prepare the zones to be moved to the new vehicle
2320 const std::pair<std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator, std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator>
2321 zones_on_point = loot_zones.equal_range( cur_mount );
2322 for( std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::const_iterator lz_iter = zones_on_point.first;
2323 lz_iter != zones_on_point.second; ++lz_iter ) {
2324 new_zones.emplace( new_mount, lz_iter->second );
2325 }
2326
2327 // Erasing on the key removes all the zones from the point at once
2328 loot_zones.erase( cur_mount );
2329
2330 // The zone manager will be updated when we next interact with it through get_vehicle_zones
2331 zones_dirty = true;
2332
2333 // remove the passenger from the old vehicle
