2334 if( passenger ) {
2335 parts[ mov_part ].remove_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag );
2336 parts[ mov_part ].passenger_id = character_id();
2337 }
2338 // indicate the part needs to be removed from the old vehicle
2339 parts[ mov_part].removed = true;
2340 removed_part_count++;
2341 }
2342
2343 // We want to create the vehicle zones after we've setup the parts
2344 // because we need only to move the zone once per mount, not per part. If we move per
2345 // part, we will end up with duplicates of the zone per part on the same mount
2346 for( std::pair<point, zone_data> zone : new_zones ) {
2347 zone_manager::get_manager().create_vehicle_loot_zone( *new_vehicle, zone.first, zone.second );
2348 }
2349
2350 // create_vehicle_loot_zone marks the vehicle as not dirty but since we got these zones
2351 // in an unknown state from the previous vehicle, we need to let the cache rebuild next
2352 // time we interact with them
2353 new_vehicle->zones_dirty = true;
2354
2355 map &here = get_map();
2356 here.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( new_vehicle );
2357 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
2358 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );
2359 if( !new_labels.empty() ) {
2360 new_vehicle->labels = new_labels;
2361 }
2362
2363 if( split_mounts.empty() ) {
2364 new_vehicle->refresh();
2365 } else {
2366 // include refresh
2367 new_vehicle->shift_parts( point_zero - mnt_offset );
2368 }
2369
2370 // update the precalc points
2371 new_vehicle->precalc_mounts( 1, new_vehicle->skidding ?
2372 new_vehicle->turn_dir : new_vehicle->face.dir(),
2373 new_vehicle->pivot_point() );
2374 new_vehicle->adjust_zlevel( 1, tripoint_zero );
2375 new_vehicle->shift_zlevel();
2376 if( !passengers.empty() ) {
2377 new_vehicle->relocate_passengers( passengers );
2378 }
2379 }
2380 return did_split;
2381}
2382
2383bool vehicle::split_vehicles( const std::vector<std::vector <int>> &new_vehs )
2384{
2385 std::vector<vehicle *> null_vehicles;
2386 std::vector<std::vector <point>> null_mounts;
2387 std::vector<point> nothing;
2388 null_vehicles.assign( new_vehs.size(), nullptr );
2389 null_mounts.assign( new_vehs.size(), nothing );
2390 return split_vehicles( new_vehs, null_vehicles, null_mounts );
2391}
2392
2393item_location vehicle::part_base( int p )
2394{
2395 return item_location( vehicle_cursor( *this, p ), &parts[ p ].base );
2396}
2397
2398int vehicle::find_part( const item &it ) const
2399{
2400 auto idx = std::find_if( parts.begin(), parts.end(), [&it]( const vehicle_part & e ) {
2401 return &e.base == &it;
2402 } );
2403 return idx != parts.end() ? std::distance( parts.begin(), idx ) : INT_MIN;
2404}
2405
2406item_group::ItemList vehicle_part::pieces_for_broken_part() const
2407{
2408 const item_group_id &group = info().breaks_into_group;
2409 // TODO: make it optional? Or use id of empty item group?
2410 if( !group ) {
2411 return {};
2412 }
2413
2414 return item_group::items_from( group, calendar::turn );
2415}
2416
2417std::vector<int> vehicle::parts_at_relative( const point &dp,
2418 const bool use_cache ) const
2419{
2420 if( !use_cache ) {
2421 std::vector<int> res;
2422 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
2423 if( vp.mount() == dp && !vp.part().removed ) {
2424 res.push_back( static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ) );
2425 }
2426 }
2427 return res;
2428 } else {
2429 const auto &iter = relative_parts.find( dp );
2430 if( iter != relative_parts.end() ) {
2431 return iter->second;
2432 } else {
2433 std::vector<int> res;
2434 return res;
2435 }
2436 }
2437}
2438
2439cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::obstacle_at_part() const
2440{
2441 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> part = part_with_feature( VPFLAG_OBSTACLE, true );
2442 if( !part ) {
2443 return cata::nullopt; // No obstacle here
2444 }
2445
2446 if( part->has_feature( VPFLAG_OPENABLE ) && part->part().open ) {
2447 return cata::nullopt; // Open door here
2448 }
2449
2450 return part;
2451}
2452
2453cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::part_displayed() const
2454{
2455 int part_id = vehicle().part_displayed_at( mount() );
2456 if( part_id == -1 ) {
2457 return cata::nullopt;
2458 }
2459 return vpart_reference( vehicle(), part_id );
2460}
2461
2462cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::part_with_feature( const std::string &f,
2463 const bool unbroken ) const
2464{
2465 const int i = vehicle().part_with_feature( part_index(), f, unbroken );
2466 if( i < 0 ) {
2467 return cata::nullopt;
2468 }
2469 return vpart_reference( vehicle(), i );
2470}
2471
2472cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::part_with_feature( const vpart_bitflags f,
2473 const bool unbroken ) const
2474{
2475 const int i = vehicle().part_with_feature( part_index(), f, unbroken );
2476 if( i < 0 ) {
2477 return cata::nullopt;
2478 }
2479 return vpart_reference( vehicle(), i );
2480}
2481
2482cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::part_with_feature( const std::string &f,
2483 const bool unbroken ) const
2484{
2485 return has_value() ? value().part_with_feature( f, unbroken ) : cata::nullopt;
2486}
2487
2488cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::part_with_feature( const vpart_bitflags f,
2489 const bool unbroken ) const
2490{
2491 return has_value() ? value().part_with_feature( f, unbroken ) : cata::nullopt;
2492}
2493
2494cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::obstacle_at_part() const
2495{
2496 return has_value() ? value().obstacle_at_part() : cata::nullopt;
2497}
2498
2499cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::part_displayed() const
2500{
2501 return has_value() ? value().part_displayed() : cata::nullopt;
2502}
2503
2504int vehicle::part_with_feature( int part, vpart_bitflags const flag, bool unbroken ) const
2505{
2506 if( part_flag( part, flag ) && ( !unbroken || !parts[part].is_broken() ) ) {
2507 return part;
2508 }
2509 const auto it = relative_parts.find( parts[part].mount );
2510 if( it != relative_parts.end() ) {
2511 const std::vector<int> &parts_here = it->second;
2512 for( auto &i : parts_here ) {
2513 if( part_flag( i, flag ) && ( !unbroken || !parts[i].is_broken() ) ) {
2514 return i;
2515 }
2516 }
2517 }
2518 return -1;
2519}
2520
2521int vehicle::part_with_feature( int part, const std::string &flag, bool unbroken ) const
2522{
2523 return part_with_feature( parts[part].mount, flag, unbroken );
2524}
2525
2526int vehicle::part_with_feature( const point &pt, const std::string &flag, bool unbroken ) const
2527{
2528 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( pt, false );
2529 for( auto &elem : parts_here ) {
2530 if( part_flag( elem, flag ) && ( !unbroken || !parts[ elem ].is_broken() ) ) {
2531 return elem;
2532 }
2533 }
2534 return -1;
2535}
2536
2537int vehicle::avail_part_with_feature( int part, vpart_bitflags const flag, bool unbroken ) const
2538{
2539 int part_a = part_with_feature( part, flag, unbroken );
2540 if( ( part_a >= 0 ) && parts[ part_a ].is_available() ) {
2541 return part_a;
2542 }
2543 return -1;
2544}
2545
2546int vehicle::avail_part_with_feature( int part, const std::string &flag, bool unbroken ) const
2547{
2548 return avail_part_with_feature( parts[ part ].mount, flag, unbroken );
2549}
2550
2551int vehicle::avail_part_with_feature( const point &pt, const std::string &flag,
2552 bool unbroken ) const
2553{
2554 int part_a = part_with_feature( pt, flag, unbroken );
2555 if( ( part_a >= 0 ) && parts[ part_a ].is_available() ) {
2556 return part_a;
2557 }
2558 return -1;
2559}
2560
2561bool vehicle::has_part( const std::string &flag, bool enabled ) const
2562{
2563 return std::any_of( parts.begin(), parts.end(), [&flag, &enabled]( const vehicle_part & e ) {
2564 return !e.removed && ( !enabled || e.enabled ) && !e.is_broken() && e.info().has_flag( flag );
2565 } );
2566}
2567
2568bool vehicle::has_part( const tripoint &pos, const std::string &flag, bool enabled ) const
2569{
2570 const tripoint relative_pos = pos - global_pos3();
2571
2572 for( const auto &e : parts ) {
2573 if( e.precalc[0] != relative_pos ) {
2574 continue;
2575 }
2576 if( !e.removed && ( !enabled || e.enabled ) && !e.is_broken() && e.info().has_flag( flag ) ) {
2577 return true;
2578 }
2579 }
2580 return false;
2581}
2582
2583int vehicle::obstacle_at_position( const point &pos ) const
2584{
2585 int i = part_with_feature( pos, "OBSTACLE", true );
2586
2587 if( i == -1 ) {
2588 return -1;
2589 }
2590
2591 auto ref = parts[i];
2592
2593 if( ref.info().has_flag( VPFLAG_OPENABLE ) && ref.open ) {
2594 return -1;
2595 }
2596
2597 return i;
2598}
2599
2600int vehicle::opaque_at_position( const point &pos ) const
2601{
2602 int i = part_with_feature( pos, "OPAQUE", true );
2603
2604 if( i == -1 ) {
2605 return -1;
2606 }
2607
2608 auto ref = parts[i];
2609
2610 if( ref.info().has_flag( VPFLAG_OPENABLE ) && ref.open ) {
2611 return -1;
2612 }
2613
2614 return i;
2615}
2616
2617std::vector<vehicle_part *> vehicle::get_parts_at( const tripoint &pos, const std::string &flag,
2618 const part_status_flag condition )
2619{
2620 const tripoint relative_pos = pos - global_pos3();
2621 std::vector<vehicle_part *> res;
2622 for( auto &e : parts ) {
2623 if( e.precalc[ 0 ] != relative_pos ) {
2624 continue;
2625 }
2626 if( !e.removed &&
2627 ( flag.empty() || e.info().has_flag( flag ) ) &&
2628 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::enabled ) || e.enabled ) &&
2629 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::working ) || !e.is_broken() ) ) {
2630 res.push_back( &e );
2631 }
2632 }
2633 return res;
2634}
2635
2636std::vector<const vehicle_part *> vehicle::get_parts_at( const tripoint &pos,
2637 const std::string &flag,
2638 const part_status_flag condition ) const
2639{
2640 const tripoint relative_pos = pos - global_pos3();
2641 std::vector<const vehicle_part *> res;
2642 for( const auto &e : parts ) {
2643 if( e.precalc[ 0 ] != relative_pos ) {
2644 continue;
2645 }
2646 if( !e.removed &&
2647 ( flag.empty() || e.info().has_flag( flag ) ) &&
2648 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::enabled ) || e.enabled ) &&
2649 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::working ) || !e.is_broken() ) ) {
2650 res.push_back( &e );
2651 }
2652 }
2653 return res;
2654}
2655
2656cata::optional<std::string> vpart_position::get_label() const
2657{
2658 const auto it = vehicle().labels.find( label( mount() ) );
2659 if( it == vehicle().labels.end() ) {
2660 return cata::nullopt;
2661 }
2662 if( it->text.empty() ) {
2663 // legacy support TODO: change labels into a map and keep track of deleted labels
2664 return cata::nullopt;
2665 }
2666 return it->text;
2667}
2668
2669void vpart_position::set_label( const std::string &text ) const
2670{
2671 auto &labels = vehicle().labels;
2672 const auto it = labels.find( label( mount() ) );
2673 // TODO: empty text should remove the label instead of just storing an empty string, see get_label
2674 if( it == labels.end() ) {
2675 labels.insert( label( mount(), text ) );
2676 } else {
2677 // labels should really be a map
2678 labels.insert( labels.erase( it ), label( mount(), text ) );
2679 }
2680}
2681
2682int vehicle::next_part_to_close( int p, bool outside ) const
2683{
2684 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
2685
2686 // We want reverse, since we close the outermost thing first (curtains), and then the innermost thing (door)
2687 for( std::vector<int>::reverse_iterator part_it = parts_here.rbegin();
2688 part_it != parts_here.rend();
2689 ++part_it ) {
2690
2691 if( part_flag( *part_it, VPFLAG_OPENABLE )
2692 && parts[ *part_it ].is_available()
2693 && parts[*part_it].open == 1
2694 && ( !outside || !part_flag( *part_it, "OPENCLOSE_INSIDE" ) ) ) {
2695 return *part_it;
2696 }
2697 }
2698 return -1;
2699}
2700
2701int vehicle::next_part_to_open( int p, bool outside ) const
2702{
2703 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
2704
2705 // We want forwards, since we open the innermost thing first (curtains), and then the innermost thing (door)
2706 for( auto &elem : parts_here ) {
2707 if( part_flag( elem, VPFLAG_OPENABLE ) && parts[ elem ].is_available() && parts[elem].open == 0 &&
2708 ( !outside || !part_flag( elem, "OPENCLOSE_INSIDE" ) ) ) {
2709 return elem;
2710 }
2711 }
2712 return -1;
2713}
2714
2715vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_avail_parts( std::string feature ) const
2716{
2717 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2718 std::move( feature ),
2719 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::working |
2720 part_status_flag::available ) );
2721}
2722
2723vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_avail_parts(
2724 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2725{
2726 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2727 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::working |
2728 part_status_flag::available ) );
2729}
2730
2731vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_parts_including_carried(
2732 std::string feature ) const
2733{
2734 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2735 std::move( feature ), part_status_flag::working );
2736}
2737
2738vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_parts_including_carried(
2739 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2740{
2741 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2742 part_status_flag::working );
2743}
2744
2745vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_any_parts( std::string feature ) const
2746{
2747 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2748 std::move( feature ), part_status_flag::any );
2749}
2750
2751vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_any_parts(
2752 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2753{
2754 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2755 part_status_flag::any );
2756}
2757
2758vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_enabled_parts( std::string feature ) const
2759{
2760 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2761 std::move( feature ),
2762 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::enabled |
2763 part_status_flag::working |
2764 part_status_flag::available ) );
2765}
2766
2767vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_enabled_parts(
2768 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2769{
2770 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2771 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::enabled |
2772 part_status_flag::working |
2773 part_status_flag::available ) );
2774}
2775
2776/**
2777 * Returns all parts in the vehicle that exist in the given location slot. If
2778 * the empty string is passed in, returns all parts with no slot.
2779 * @param location The location slot to get parts for.
2780 * @return A list of indices to all parts with the specified location.
2781 */
2782std::vector<int> vehicle::all_parts_at_location( const std::string &location ) const
2783{
2784 std::vector<int> parts_found;
2785 for( size_t part_index = 0; part_index < parts.size(); ++part_index ) {
2786 if( part_info( part_index ).location == location && !parts[part_index].removed ) {
2787 parts_found.push_back( part_index );
2788 }
2789 }
2790 return parts_found;
2791}
2792
2793// another NPC probably removed a part in the time it took to walk here and start the activity.
2794// as the part index was first "chosen" before the NPC started traveling here.
2795// therefore the part index is now invalid shifted by one or two ( depending on how many other NPCs working on this vehicle )
2796// so loop over the part indexes in reverse order to get the next one down that matches the part type we wanted to remove
2797int vehicle::get_next_shifted_index( int original_index, player &p )
2798{
2799 int ret_index = original_index;
2800 bool found_shifted_index = false;
2801 for( std::vector<vehicle_part>::reverse_iterator it = parts.rbegin(); it != parts.rend(); ++it ) {
2802 if( p.get_value( "veh_index_type" ) == it->info().name() ) {
2803 ret_index = index_of_part( &*it );
2804 found_shifted_index = true;
2805 break;
2806 }
2807 }
2808 if( !found_shifted_index ) {
2809 // we are probably down to a few parts left, and things get messy here, so an alternative index maybe can't be found
2810 // if loads of npcs are all removing parts at the same time.
2811 // if that's the case, just bail out and give up, somebody else is probably doing the job right now anyway.
2812 return -1;
2813 } else {
2814 return ret_index;
2815 }
2816}
2817
2818/**
2819 * Returns all parts in the vehicle that have the specified flag in their vpinfo and
2820 * are on the same X-axis or Y-axis as the input part and are contiguous with each other.
2821 * @param part The part to find adjacent parts to
2822 * @param flag The flag to match
2823 * @return A list of lists of indices of all parts sharing the flag and contiguous with the part
2824 * on the X or Y axis. Returns 0, 1, or 2 lists of indices.
2825 */
2826std::vector<std::vector<int>> vehicle::find_lines_of_parts( int part, const std::string &flag )
2827{
2828 const auto possible_parts = get_avail_parts( flag );
2829 std::vector<std::vector<int>> ret_parts;
2830 if( empty( possible_parts ) ) {
2831 return ret_parts;
2832 }
2833
2834 std::vector<int> x_parts;
2835 std::vector<int> y_parts;
2836 vpart_id part_id = part_info( part ).get_id();
2837 // create vectors of parts on the same X or Y axis
2838 point target = parts[ part ].mount;
2839 for( const vpart_reference &vp : possible_parts ) {
2840 if( vp.part().is_unavailable() ||
2841 !vp.has_feature( "MULTISQUARE" ) ||
2842 vp.info().get_id() != part_id ) {
2843 continue;
2844 }
2845 if( vp.mount().x == target.x ) {
2846 x_parts.push_back( vp.part_index() );
2847 }
2848 if( vp.mount().y == target.y ) {
2849 y_parts.push_back( vp.part_index() );
2850 }
2851 }
2852
2853 if( x_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2854 std::vector<int> x_ret;
2855 // sort by Y-axis, since they're all on the same X-axis
2856 const auto x_sorter = [&]( const int lhs, const int rhs ) {
2857 return( parts[lhs].mount.y > parts[rhs].mount.y );
2858 };
2859 std::sort( x_parts.begin(), x_parts.end(), x_sorter );
2860 int first_part = 0;
2861 int prev_y = parts[ x_parts[ 0 ] ].mount.y;
2862 int i;
2863 bool found_part = x_parts[ 0 ] == part;
2864 for( i = 1; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < x_parts.size(); i++ ) {
2865 // if the Y difference is > 1, there's a break in the run
2866 if( std::abs( parts[ x_parts[ i ] ].mount.y - prev_y ) > 1 ) {
2867 // if we found the part, this is the run we wanted
2868 if( found_part ) {
2869 break;
2870 }
2871 first_part = i;
2872 }
2873 found_part |= x_parts[ i ] == part;
2874 prev_y = parts[ x_parts[ i ] ].mount.y;
2875 }
2876 for( size_t j = first_part; j < static_cast<size_t>( i ); j++ ) {
2877 x_ret.push_back( x_parts[ j ] );
2878 }
2879 ret_parts.push_back( x_ret );
2880 }
2881 if( y_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2882 std::vector<int> y_ret;
2883 const auto y_sorter = [&]( const int lhs, const int rhs ) {
2884 return( parts[lhs].mount.x > parts[rhs].mount.x );
2885 };
2886 std::sort( y_parts.begin(), y_parts.end(), y_sorter );
2887 int first_part = 0;
2888 int prev_x = parts[ y_parts[ 0 ] ].mount.x;
2889 int i;
2890 bool found_part = y_parts[ 0 ] == part;
2891 for( i = 1; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < y_parts.size(); i++ ) {
2892 if( std::abs( parts[ y_parts[ i ] ].mount.x - prev_x ) > 1 ) {
2893 if( found_part ) {
2894 break;
2895 }
2896 first_part = i;
2897 }
2898 found_part |= y_parts[ i ] == part;
2899 prev_x = parts[ y_parts[ i ] ].mount.x;
2900 }
2901 for( size_t j = first_part; j < static_cast<size_t>( i ); j++ ) {
2902 y_ret.push_back( y_parts[ j ] );
2903 }
2904 ret_parts.push_back( y_ret );
2905 }
2906 if( y_parts.size() == 1 && x_parts.size() == 1 ) {
2907 ret_parts.push_back( x_parts );
2908 }
2909 return ret_parts;
2910}
2911
2912bool vehicle::part_flag( int part, const std::string &flag ) const
2913{
2914 if( part < 0 || part >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) || parts[part].removed ) {
2915 return false;
2916 } else {
2917 return part_info( part ).has_flag( flag );
2918 }
2919}
2920
2921bool vehicle::part_flag( int part, const vpart_bitflags flag ) const
2922{
2923 if( part < 0 || part >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) || parts[part].removed ) {
2924 return false;
2925 } else {
2926 return part_info( part ).has_flag( flag );
2927 }
2928}
2929
2930int vehicle::part_at( const point &dp ) const
2931{
2932 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
2933 if( vp.part().precalc[0].xy() == dp && !vp.part().removed ) {
2934 return static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() );
2935 }
2936 }
2937 return -1;
2938}
2939
2940/**
2941 * Given a vehicle part which is inside of this vehicle, returns the index of
2942 * that part. This exists solely because activities relating to vehicle editing
2943 * require the index of the vehicle part to be passed around.
2944 * @param part The part to find.
2945 * @param check_removed Check whether this part can be removed
2946 * @return The part index, -1 if it is not part of this vehicle.
2947 */
2948int vehicle::index_of_part( const vehicle_part *const part, const bool check_removed ) const
2949{
2950 if( part != nullptr ) {
2951 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
2952 const vehicle_part &next_part = vp.part();
2953 if( !check_removed && next_part.removed ) {
2954 continue;
2955 }
2956 if( part->id == next_part.id && part->mount == vp.mount() ) {
2957 return vp.part_index();
2958 }
2959 }
2960 }
2961 return -1;
2962}
2963
2964/**
2965 * Returns which part (as an index into the parts list) is the one that will be
2966 * displayed for the given square. Returns -1 if there are no parts in that
2967 * square.
2968 * @param dp The local coordinate.
2969 * @return The index of the part that will be displayed.
2970 */
2971int vehicle::part_displayed_at( const point &dp ) const
2972{
2973 // Z-order is implicitly defined in game::load_vehiclepart, but as
2974 // numbers directly set on parts rather than constants that can be
2975 // used elsewhere. A future refactor might be nice but this way
2976 // it's clear where the magic number comes from.
2977 const int ON_ROOF_Z = 9;
2978
2979 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( dp, true );
2980
2981 if( parts_in_square.empty() ) {
2982 return -1;
2983 }
2984
2985 bool in_vehicle = g->u.in_vehicle;
2986 if( in_vehicle ) {
2987 // They're in a vehicle, but are they in /this/ vehicle?
2988 std::vector<int> psg_parts = boarded_parts();
2989 in_vehicle = false;
2990 for( auto &psg_part : psg_parts ) {
2991 if( get_passenger( psg_part ) == &g->u ) {
2992 in_vehicle = true;
2993 break;
2994 }
2995 }
2996 }
2997
2998 int hide_z_at_or_above = ( in_vehicle ) ? ( ON_ROOF_Z ) : INT_MAX;
2999
3000 int top_part = 0;
3001 for( size_t index = 1; index < parts_in_square.size(); index++ ) {
3002 if( ( part_info( parts_in_square[top_part] ).z_order <
3003 part_info( parts_in_square[index] ).z_order ) &&
3004 ( part_info( parts_in_square[index] ).z_order <
3005 hide_z_at_or_above ) ) {
3006 top_part = index;
3007 }
3008 }
3009
3010 return parts_in_square[top_part];
3011}
3012
3013int vehicle::roof_at_part( const int part ) const
3014{
3015 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[part].mount, true );
3016 for( const int p : parts_in_square ) {
3017 if( part_info( p ).location == "on_roof" || part_flag( p, "ROOF" ) ) {
3018 return p;
3019 }
3020 }
3021
3022 return -1;
3023}
3024
3025point vehicle::coord_translate( const point &p ) const
3026{
3027 tripoint q;
3028 coord_translate( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0], p, q );
3029 return q.xy();
3030}
3031
3032const struct {
3033 float gradient;
3034 bool flipH;
3035 bool flipV;
3036 bool swapXY;
3037} rotation_info[24] = {
3038 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 0_degrees ) ) ), false, false, false}, //0 degrees
3039 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), false, false, false},
3040 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), false, false, false},
3041 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 45_degrees ) ) ), true, false, true}, //45 degrees
3042 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), true, false, true},
3043 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), true, false, true},
3044 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 0_degrees ) ) ), true, false, true}, //90 degrees
3045 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), true, false, true},
3046 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), true, false, true},
3047 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 45_degrees ) ) ), true, false, true}, //135 degrees
3048 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), true, true, false},
3049 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), true, true, false},
3050 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 0_degrees ) ) ), true, true, false}, //180 degrees
3051 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), true, true, false},
3052 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), true, true, false},
3053 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 45_degrees ) ) ), false, true, true}, //225 degrees
3054 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), false, true, true},
3055 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), false, true, true},
3056 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 0_degrees ) ) ), false, true, true}, //270 degrees
3057 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), false, true, true},
3058 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), false, true, true},
3059 {static_cast<float>( tan( units::to_radians( 45_degrees ) ) ), false, true, true}, //315 degrees
3060 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 30_degrees ) ) ), false, false, false},
3061 {static_cast<float>( -tan( units::to_radians( 15_degrees ) ) ), false, false, false},
3062};
3063
3064void vehicle::coord_translate( units::angle dir, const point &pivot, const point &p,
3065 tripoint &q ) const
3066{
3067
3068 int increment = angle_to_increment( dir );
3069 point relative = p - pivot;
3070 float skew = std::trunc( relative.x * rotation_info[increment].gradient );
3071
3072 q.x = relative.x;
3073 q.y = relative.y + skew;
3074
3075 if( rotation_info[increment].swapXY ) {
3076 auto swap = q.x;
3077 q.x = q.y;
3078 q.y = swap;
3079 }
3080 if( rotation_info[increment].flipH ) {
3081 q.x = -q.x;
3082 }
3083 if( rotation_info[increment].flipV ) {
3084 q.y = -q.y;
3085 }
3086}
3087
3088void vehicle::coord_translate_reverse( units::angle dir, const point &pivot, const tripoint &p,
3089 point &q ) const
3090{
3091 int increment = angle_to_increment( dir );
3092
3093 q.x = p.x;
3094 q.y = p.y;
3095
3096
3097 if( rotation_info[increment].flipV ) {
3098 q.y = -q.y;
3099 }
3100
3101 if( rotation_info[increment].flipH ) {
3102 q.x = -q.x;
3103 }
3104
3105 if( rotation_info[increment].swapXY ) {
3106 auto swap = q.x;
3107 q.x = q.y;
3108 q.y = swap;
3109 }
3110
3111 float skew = std::trunc( q.x * rotation_info[increment].gradient );
3112
3113 q.y -= skew;
3114
3115 q += pivot;
3116
3117}
3118
3119tripoint vehicle::mount_to_tripoint( const point &mount ) const
3120{
3121 return mount_to_tripoint( mount, point_zero );
3122}
3123
3124tripoint vehicle::mount_to_tripoint( const point &mount, const point &offset ) const
3125{
3126 tripoint mnt_translated;
3127 coord_translate( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[ 0 ], mount + offset, mnt_translated );
3128 return global_pos3() + mnt_translated;
3129}
3130
3131point vehicle::tripoint_to_mount( const tripoint &p ) const
3132{
3133 tripoint translated = p - global_pos3();
3134
3135 point result;
3136 coord_translate_reverse( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0], translated, result );
3137
3138 return result;
3139}
3140
3141int vehicle::angle_to_increment( units::angle dir )
3142{
3143 int increment = ( std::lround( to_degrees( dir ) ) % 360 ) / 15;
3144 if( increment < 0 ) {
3145 increment += 360 / 15;
3146 }
3147 return increment;
3148}
3149
3150
3151void vehicle::precalc_mounts( int idir, units::angle dir, const point &pivot )
3152{
3153 if( idir < 0 || idir > 1 ) {
3154 idir = 0;
3155 }
3156 std::unordered_map<point, point> mount_to_precalc;
3157 for( auto &p : parts ) {
3158 if( p.removed ) {
3159 continue;
3160 }
3161 auto q = mount_to_precalc.find( p.mount );
3162 if( q == mount_to_precalc.end() ) {
3163 coord_translate( dir, pivot, p.mount, p.precalc[idir] );
3164 p.precalc[idir].z = 0;
3165 mount_to_precalc.insert( { p.mount, p.precalc[idir].xy() } );
3166 } else {
3167 p.precalc[idir] = {q->second, 0};
3168 }
3169 }
3170 pivot_anchor[idir] = pivot;
3171 pivot_rotation[idir] = dir;
3172}
3173
3174bool vehicle::check_rotated_intervening( const point &from, const point &to,
3175 bool( *check )( const vehicle *, const point & ) ) const
3176{
3177 point delta = to - from;
3178 if( abs( delta.x ) <= 1 && abs( delta.y ) <= 1 ) { //Just a normal move
3179 return true;
3180 }
3181
3182 if( !( ( abs( delta.x ) == 2 && abs( delta.y ) == 1 ) || ( abs( delta.x ) == 1 &&
3183 abs( delta.y ) == 2 ) ) ) { //Check that we're moving like a knight
3184 debugmsg( "Unexpected movement in rotated vehicle vector:%d,%d", delta.x, delta.y );
3185 return false;
3186 }
3187
3188 if( abs( delta.x ) == 2 ) { //Mostly horizontal move
3189 point t1 = from + point( delta.x / 2, delta.y );
3190 if( check( this, t1 ) ) {
3191 return true;
3192 }
3193
3194 point t2 = from + point( delta.x / 2, 0 );
3195 if( check( this, t2 ) ) {
3196 return true;
3197 }
3198
3199 } else { //Mostly vertical move
3200 point t1 = from + point( delta.x, delta.y / 2 );
3201 if( check( this, t1 ) ) {
3202 return true;
3203 }
3204
3205 point t2 = from + point( 0, delta.y / 2 );
3206 if( check( this, t2 ) ) {
3207 return true;
3208 }
3209 }
3210
3211 return false;
3212}
3213
3214bool vehicle::allowed_light( const point &from, const point &to ) const
3215{
3216 return check_rotated_intervening( from, to, []( const vehicle * veh, const point & p ) {
3217 return ( veh->opaque_at_position( p ) == -1 );
3218 } );
3219}
3220
3221bool vehicle::allowed_move( const point &from, const point &to ) const
3222{
3223 return check_rotated_intervening( from, to, []( const vehicle * veh, const point & p ) {
3224 return ( veh->obstacle_at_position( p ) == -1 );
3225 } );
3226}
3227
3228std::vector<int> vehicle::boarded_parts() const
3229{
3230 std::vector<int> res;
3231 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) ) {
3232 if( vp.part().has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
3233 res.push_back( static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ) );
3234 }
3235 }
3236 return res;
3237}
3238
3239std::vector<rider_data> vehicle::get_riders() const
3240{
3241 std::vector<rider_data> res;
3242 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) ) {
3243 Creature *rider = g->critter_at( vp.pos() );
3244 if( rider ) {
3245 rider_data r;
3246 r.prt = vp.part_index();
3247 r.psg = rider;
3248 res.emplace_back( r );
3249 }
3250 }
3251 return res;
3252}
3253
3254player *vehicle::get_passenger( int p ) const
3255{
3256 p = part_with_feature( p, VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, false );
3257 if( p >= 0 && parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
3258 return g->critter_by_id<player>( parts[p].passenger_id );
3259 }
3260 return nullptr;
3261}
3262
3263monster *vehicle::get_pet( int p ) const
3264{
3265 p = part_with_feature( p, VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, false );
3266 if( p >= 0 ) {
3267 return g->critter_at<monster>( global_part_pos3( p ), true );
3268 }
3269 return nullptr;
3270}
3271
3272tripoint_abs_ms vehicle::global_square_location() const
3273{
3274 return tripoint_abs_ms( get_map().getabs( global_pos3() ) );
3275}
3276
3277tripoint_abs_omt vehicle::global_omt_location() const
3278{
3279 return project_to<coords::omt>( global_square_location() );
3280}
3281
3282tripoint vehicle::global_pos3() const
3283{
3284 return sm_to_ms_copy( sm_pos ) + pos;
3285}
3286
3287tripoint vehicle::global_part_pos3( const int &index ) const
3288{
3289 return global_part_pos3( parts[ index ] );
3290}
3291
3292tripoint vehicle::global_part_pos3( const vehicle_part &pt ) const
3293{
3294 return global_pos3() + pt.precalc[ 0 ];
3295}
3296
3297void vehicle::set_submap_moved( const tripoint &p )
3298{
3299 const point_abs_ms old_msp = global_square_location().xy();
3300 sm_pos = p;
3301 if( !tracking_on ) {
3302 return;
3303 }
3304 overmap_buffer.move_vehicle( this, old_msp );
3305}
3306
3307units::mass vehicle::total_mass() const
3308{
3309 if( mass_dirty ) {
3310 refresh_mass();
3311 }
3312
3313 return mass_cache;
3314}
3315
3316units::volume vehicle::total_folded_volume() const
3317{
3318 units::volume m = 0_ml;
3319 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
3320 if( vp.part().removed ) {
3321 continue;
3322 }
3323 m += vp.info().folded_volume;
3324 }
3325 return m;
3326}
3327
3328const point &vehicle::rotated_center_of_mass() const
3329{
3330 // TODO: Bring back caching of this point
3331 calc_mass_center( true );
3332
3333 return mass_center_precalc;
3334}
3335
3336const point &vehicle::local_center_of_mass() const
3337{
3338 if( mass_center_no_precalc_dirty ) {
3339 calc_mass_center( false );
3340 }
3341
3342 return mass_center_no_precalc;
3343}
3344
3345point vehicle::pivot_displacement() const
3346{
3347 // precalc_mounts always produces a result that puts the pivot point at (0,0).
3348 // If the pivot point changes, this artificially moves the vehicle, as the position
3349 // of the old pivot point will appear to move from (posx+0, posy+0) to some other point
3350 // (posx+dx,posy+dy) even if there is no change in vehicle position or rotation.
3351 // This method finds that movement so it can be canceled out when actually moving
3352 // the vehicle.
3353
3354 // rotate the old pivot point around the new pivot point with the old rotation angle
3355 tripoint dp;
3356 coord_translate( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[1], pivot_anchor[0], dp );
3357 return dp.xy();
3358}
3359
3360int vehicle::fuel_left( const itype_id &ftype, bool recurse ) const
3361{
3362 int fl = std::accumulate( parts.begin(), parts.end(), 0, [&ftype]( const int &lhs,
3363 const vehicle_part & rhs ) {
3364 return lhs + ( rhs.ammo_current() == ftype ? rhs.ammo_remaining() : 0 );
3365 } );
3366
3367 if( recurse && ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
3368 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
3369 auto fuel_counting_visitor = [&fl, &ftype]( vehicle const & veh ) {
3370 fl += veh.fuel_left( ftype, false );
3371 return tvr::continue_further;
3372 };
3373 auto power_counting_visitor = [&fl]( distribution_grid const & grid ) {
3374 fl += grid.get_resource( false );
3375 return tvr::continue_further;
3376 };
3377
3378 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, fuel_counting_visitor, power_counting_visitor );
3379 }
3380
3381 //muscle engines have infinite fuel
3382 if( ftype == fuel_type_muscle ) {
3383 // TODO: Allow NPCs to power those
3384 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( g->u.pos() );
3385 bool player_controlling = player_in_control( g->u );
3386
3387 //if the engine in the player tile is a muscle engine, and player is controlling vehicle
3388 if( vp && &vp->vehicle() == this && player_controlling ) {
3389 const int p = avail_part_with_feature( vp->part_index(), VPFLAG_ENGINE, true );
3390 if( p >= 0 && is_part_on( p ) && part_info( p ).fuel_type == fuel_type_muscle ) {
3391 //Broken limbs prevent muscle engines from working
3392 if( ( part_info( p ).has_flag( "MUSCLE_LEGS" ) && ( g->u.get_working_leg_count() >= 2 ) ) ||
3393 ( part_info( p ).has_flag( "MUSCLE_ARMS" ) &&
3394 ( g->u.get_working_arm_count() >= 2 ) ) ) {
3395 fl += 10;
3396 }
3397 }
3398 }
3399 // As do any other engine flagged as perpetual
3400 } else if( item( ftype ).has_flag( "PERPETUAL" ) ) {
3401 fl += 10;
3402 }
3403
3404 return fl;
3405}
3406int vehicle::fuel_left( const int p, bool recurse ) const
3407{
3408 return fuel_left( parts[ p ].fuel_current(), recurse );
3409}
3410
3411int vehicle::engine_fuel_left( const int e, bool recurse ) const
3412{
3413 if( static_cast<size_t>( e ) < engines.size() ) {
3414 return fuel_left( parts[ engines[ e ] ].fuel_current(), recurse );
3415 }
3416 return 0;
3417}
3418
3419int vehicle::fuel_capacity( const itype_id &ftype ) const
3420{
3421 return std::accumulate( parts.begin(), parts.end(), 0, [&ftype]( const int &lhs,
3422 const vehicle_part & rhs ) {
3423 return lhs + ( rhs.ammo_current() == ftype ? rhs.ammo_capacity() : 0 );
3424 } );
3425}
3426
3427int vehicle::drain( const itype_id &ftype, int amount )
3428{
3429 if( ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
3430 // Batteries get special handling to take advantage of jumper
3431 // cables -- discharge_battery knows how to recurse properly
3432 // (including taking cable power loss into account).
3433 int remnant = discharge_battery( amount, true );
3434
3435 // discharge_battery returns amount of charges that were not
3436 // found anywhere in the power network, whereas this function
3437 // returns amount of charges consumed; simple subtraction.
3438 return amount - remnant;
3439 }
3440
3441 int drained = 0;
3442 for( auto &p : parts ) {
3443 if( amount <= 0 ) {
3444 break;
3445 }
3446 if( p.ammo_current() == ftype ) {
3447 int qty = p.ammo_consume( amount, global_part_pos3( p ) );
3448 drained += qty;
3449 amount -= qty;
3450 }
3451 }
3452
3453 invalidate_mass();
3454 return drained;
3455}
3456
3457int vehicle::drain( const int index, int amount )
3458{
3459 if( index < 0 || index >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
3460 debugmsg( "Tried to drain an invalid part index: %d", index );
3461 return 0;
3462 }
3463 vehicle_part &pt = parts[index];
3464 if( pt.ammo_current() == fuel_type_battery ) {
3465 return drain( fuel_type_battery, amount );
3466 }
3467 if( !pt.is_tank() || !pt.ammo_remaining() ) {
3468 debugmsg( "Tried to drain something without any liquid: %s amount: %d ammo: %d",
3469 pt.name(), amount, pt.ammo_remaining() );
3470 return 0;
3471 }
3472
3473 const int drained = pt.ammo_consume( amount, global_part_pos3( pt ) );
3474 invalidate_mass();
3475 return drained;
3476}
3477
3478int vehicle::basic_consumption( const itype_id &ftype ) const
3479{
3480 int fcon = 0;
3481 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
3482 if( is_engine_type_on( e, ftype ) ) {
3483 if( parts[ engines[e] ].ammo_current() == fuel_type_battery &&
3484 part_epower_w( engines[e] ) >= 0 ) {
3485 // Electric engine - use epower instead
3486 fcon -= part_epower_w( engines[e] );
3487
3488 } else if( !is_perpetual_type( e ) ) {
3489 fcon += part_vpower_w( engines[e] );
3490 if( parts[ e ].faults().count( fault_filter_air ) ) {
3491 fcon *= 2;
3492 }
3493 }
3494 }
3495 }
3496 return fcon;
3497}
3498
3499int vehicle::consumption_per_hour( const itype_id &ftype, int fuel_rate_w ) const
3500{
3501 item fuel = item( ftype );
3502 if( fuel_rate_w == 0 || fuel.has_flag( "PERPETUAL" ) || !engine_on ) {
3503 return 0;
3504 }
3505
3506 float j_per_turn = fuel_rate_w;
3507 float j_per_second = j_per_turn / to_seconds<float>( time_duration::from_turns( 1 ) );
3508 float kj_per_hour = j_per_second * 3.6f;
3509 float kj_per_mL = fuel.fuel_energy();
3510
3511 return kj_per_hour / kj_per_mL;
3512}
3513
3514int vehicle::total_power_w( const bool fueled, const bool safe ) const
3515{
3516 int pwr = 0;
3517 int cnt = 0;
3518
3519 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); e++ ) {
3520 int p = engines[e];
3521 if( is_engine_on( e ) && ( !fueled || engine_fuel_left( e ) ) ) {
3522 int m2c = safe ? part_info( engines[e] ).engine_m2c() : 100;
3523 if( parts[ engines[e] ].faults().count( fault_filter_fuel ) ) {
3524 m2c *= 0.6;
3525 }
3526 pwr += part_vpower_w( p ) * m2c / 100;
3527 cnt++;
3528 }
3529 }
3530
3531 for( size_t a = 0; a < alternators.size(); a++ ) {
3532 int p = alternators[a];
3533 if( is_alternator_on( a ) ) {
3534 pwr += part_vpower_w( p ); // alternators have negative power
3535 }
3536 }
3537 pwr = std::max( 0, pwr );
3538
3539 if( cnt > 1 ) {
3540 pwr = pwr * 4 / ( 4 + cnt - 1 );
3541 }
3542 return pwr;
3543}
3544
3545bool vehicle::is_moving() const
3546{
3547 return velocity != 0;
3548}
3549
3550bool vehicle::can_use_rails() const
3551{
3552 // Do not allow vehicles without rail wheels or with mixed wheels
3553 return !rail_wheelcache.empty() && wheelcache.size() == rail_wheelcache.size();
3554}
3555
3556int vehicle::ground_acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3557{
3558 if( !( engine_on || skidding ) ) {
3559 return 0;
3560 }
3561 int target_vmiph = std::max( at_vel_in_vmi, std::max( 1000, max_velocity( fueled ) / 4 ) );
3562 int cmps = vmiph_to_cmps( target_vmiph );
3563 double weight = to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3564 if( is_towing() ) {
3565 vehicle *other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
3566 if( other_veh ) {
3567 weight = weight + to_kilogram( other_veh->total_mass() );
3568 }
3569 }
3570 int engine_power_ratio = total_power_w( fueled ) / weight;
3571 int accel_at_vel = 100 * 100 * engine_power_ratio / cmps;
3572 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: accel at %d vimph is %d", name, target_vmiph,
3573 cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel ) );
3574 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );
3575}
3576
3577int vehicle::rotor_acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3578{
3579 ( void )at_vel_in_vmi;
3580 if( !( engine_on || is_flying ) ) {
3581 return 0;
3582 }
3583 const int accel_at_vel = 100 * lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( fueled ) / to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3584 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );
3585}
3586
3587int vehicle::water_acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3588{
3589 if( !( engine_on || skidding ) ) {
3590 return 0;
3591 }
3592 int target_vmiph = std::max( at_vel_in_vmi, std::max( 1000,
3593 max_water_velocity( fueled ) / 4 ) );
3594 int cmps = vmiph_to_cmps( target_vmiph );
3595 double weight = to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3596 if( is_towing() ) {
3597 vehicle *other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
3598 if( other_veh ) {
3599 weight = weight + to_kilogram( other_veh->total_mass() );
3600 }
3601 }
3602 int engine_power_ratio = total_power_w( fueled ) / weight;
3603 int accel_at_vel = 100 * 100 * engine_power_ratio / cmps;
3604 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: water accel at %d vimph is %d", name, target_vmiph,
3605 cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel ) );
3606 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );
3607}
3608
3609// cubic equation solution
3610// don't use complex numbers unless necessary and it's usually not
3611// see https://math.vanderbilt.edu/schectex/courses/cubic/ for the gory details
3612static double simple_cubic_solution( double a, double b, double c, double d )
3613{
3614 double p = -b / ( 3 * a );
3615 double q = p * p * p + ( b * c - 3 * a * d ) / ( 6 * a * a );
3616 double r = c / ( 3 * a );
3617 double t = r - p * p;
3618 double tricky_bit = q * q + t * t * t;
3619 if( tricky_bit < 0 ) {
3620 double cr = 1.0 / 3.0; // approximate the cube root of a complex number
3621 std::complex<double> q_complex( q );
3622 std::complex<double> tricky_complex( std::sqrt( std::complex<double>( tricky_bit ) ) );
3623 std::complex<double> term1( std::pow( q_complex + tricky_complex, cr ) );
3624 std::complex<double> term2( std::pow( q_complex - tricky_complex, cr ) );
3625 std::complex<double> term_sum( term1 + term2 );
3626
3627 if( imag( term_sum ) < 2 ) {
3628 return p + real( term_sum );
3629 } else {
3630 debugmsg( "cubic solution returned imaginary values" );
3631 return 0;
3632 }
3633 } else {
3634 double tricky_final = std::sqrt( tricky_bit );
3635 double term1_part = q + tricky_final;
3636 double term2_part = q - tricky_final;
3637 double term1 = std::cbrt( term1_part );
3638 double term2 = std::cbrt( term2_part );
3639 return p + term1 + term2;
3640 }
3641}
3642
3643int vehicle::acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3644{
3645 if( is_watercraft() ) {
3646 return water_acceleration( fueled, at_vel_in_vmi );
3647 } else if( is_rotorcraft() && is_flying ) {
3648 return rotor_acceleration( fueled, at_vel_in_vmi );
3649 }
3650 return ground_acceleration( fueled, at_vel_in_vmi );
3651}
3652
3653int vehicle::current_acceleration( const bool fueled ) const
3654{
3655 return acceleration( fueled, std::abs( velocity ) );
3656}
3657
3658// Ugly physics below:
3659// maximum speed occurs when all available thrust is used to overcome air/rolling resistance
3660// sigma F = 0 as we were taught in Engineering Mechanics 301
3661// engine power is torque * rotation rate (in rads for simplicity)
3662// torque / wheel radius = drive force at where the wheel meets the road
3663// velocity is wheel radius * rotation rate (in rads for simplicity)
3664// air resistance is -1/2 * air density * drag coeff * cross area * v^2
3665// and c_air_drag is -1/2 * air density * drag coeff * cross area
3666// rolling resistance is mass * GRAVITY_OF_EARTH * rolling coeff * 0.000225 * ( 33.3 + v )
3667// and c_rolling_drag is mass * GRAVITY_OF_EARTH * rolling coeff * 0.000225
3668// and rolling_constant_to_variable is 33.3
3669// or by formula:
3670// max velocity occurs when F_drag = F_wheel
3671// F_wheel = engine_power / rotation_rate / wheel_radius
3672// velocity = rotation_rate * wheel_radius
3673// F_wheel * velocity = engine_power * rotation_rate * wheel_radius / rotation_rate / wheel_radius
3674// F_wheel * velocity = engine_power
3675// F_wheel = engine_power / velocity
3676// F_drag = F_air_drag + F_rolling_drag
3677// F_air_drag = c_air_drag * velocity^2
3678// F_rolling_drag = c_rolling_drag * velocity + rolling_constant_to_variable * c_rolling_drag
3679// engine_power / v = c_air_drag * v^2 + c_rolling_drag * v + 33 * c_rolling_drag
3680// c_air_drag * v^3 + c_rolling_drag * v^2 + c_rolling_drag * 33.3 * v - engine power = 0
3681// solve for v with the simplified cubic equation solver
3682// got it? quiz on Wednesday.
3683int vehicle::max_ground_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3684{
3685 int total_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled );
3686 double c_rolling_drag = coeff_rolling_drag();
3687 double max_in_mps = simple_cubic_solution( coeff_air_drag(), c_rolling_drag,
3688 c_rolling_drag * vehicles::rolling_constant_to_variable,
3689 -total_engine_w );
3690 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: power %d, c_air %3.2f, c_rolling %3.2f, max_in_mps %3.2f",
3691 name, total_engine_w, coeff_air_drag(), c_rolling_drag, max_in_mps );
3692 return mps_to_vmiph( max_in_mps );
3693}
3694
3695// the same physics as ground velocity, but there's no rolling resistance so the math is easy
3696// F_drag = F_water_drag + F_air_drag
3697// F_drag = c_water_drag * velocity^2 + c_air_drag * velocity^2
3698// F_drag = ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) * velocity^2
3699// F_prop = engine_power / velocity
3700// F_prop = F_drag
3701// engine_power / velocity = ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) * velocity^2
3702// engine_power = ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) * velocity^3
3703// velocity^3 = engine_power / ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag )
3704// velocity = cube root( engine_power / ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) )
3705int vehicle::max_water_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3706{
3707 int total_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled );
3708 double total_drag = coeff_water_drag() + coeff_air_drag();
3709 double max_in_mps = std::cbrt( total_engine_w / total_drag );
3710 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: power %d, c_air %3.2f, c_water %3.2f, water max_in_mps %3.2f",
3711 name, total_engine_w, coeff_air_drag(), coeff_water_drag(), max_in_mps );
3712 return mps_to_vmiph( max_in_mps );
3713}
3714
3715int vehicle::max_rotor_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3716{
3717 const double max_air_mps = std::sqrt( lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( fueled ) / coeff_air_drag() );
3718 // helicopters just cannot go over 250mph at very maximum
3719 // weird things start happening to their rotors if they do.
3720 // due to the rotor tips going supersonic.
3721 return std::min( 25501, mps_to_vmiph( max_air_mps ) );
3722}
3723
3724int vehicle::max_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3725{
3726 if( is_flying && is_rotorcraft() ) {
3727 return max_rotor_velocity( fueled );
3728 } else if( is_watercraft() ) {
3729 return max_water_velocity( fueled );
3730 } else {
3731 return max_ground_velocity( fueled );
3732 }
3733}
3734
3735int vehicle::max_reverse_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3736{
3737 int max_vel = max_velocity( fueled );
3738 if( has_engine_type( fuel_type_battery, true ) ) {
3739 // Electric motors can go in reverse as well as forward
3740 return -max_vel;
3741 } else {
3742 // All other motive powers do poorly in reverse
3743 return -max_vel / 4;
3744 }
3745}
3746
3747// the same physics as max_ground_velocity, but with a smaller engine power
3748int vehicle::safe_ground_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3749{
3750 int effective_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled, true );
3751 double c_rolling_drag = coeff_rolling_drag();
3752 double safe_in_mps = simple_cubic_solution( coeff_air_drag(), c_rolling_drag,
3753 c_rolling_drag * vehicles::rolling_constant_to_variable,
3754 -effective_engine_w );
3755 return mps_to_vmiph( safe_in_mps );
3756}
3757
3758int vehicle::safe_rotor_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3759{
3760 const double max_air_mps = std::sqrt( lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( fueled,
3761 true ) / coeff_air_drag() );
3762 return std::min( 22501, mps_to_vmiph( max_air_mps ) );
3763}
3764
3765// the same physics as max_water_velocity, but with a smaller engine power
3766int vehicle::safe_water_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3767{
3768 int total_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled, true );
3769 double total_drag = coeff_water_drag() + coeff_air_drag();
3770 double safe_in_mps = std::cbrt( total_engine_w / total_drag );
3771 return mps_to_vmiph( safe_in_mps );
3772}
3773
3774int vehicle::safe_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3775{
3776 if( is_flying && is_rotorcraft() ) {
3777 return safe_rotor_velocity( fueled );
3778 } else if( is_watercraft() ) {
3779 return safe_water_velocity( fueled );
3780 } else {
3781 return safe_ground_velocity( fueled );
3782 }
3783}
3784
3785bool vehicle::do_environmental_effects()
3786{
3787 bool needed = false;
3788 // check for smoking parts
3789 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
3790 /* Only lower blood level if:
3791 * - The part is outside.
3792 * - The weather is any effect that would cause the player to be wet. */
3793 if( vp.part().blood > 0 && g->m.is_outside( vp.pos() ) ) {
3794 needed = true;
3795 if( get_weather().weather_id->rains &&
3796 get_weather().weather_id->precip != precip_class::very_light ) {
3797 vp.part().blood--;
3798 }
3799 }
3800 }
3801 return needed;
3802}
3803
3804void vehicle::spew_field( double joules, int part, field_type_id type, int intensity )
3805{
3806 if( rng( 1, 10000 ) > joules ) {
3807 return;
3808 }
3809 point p = parts[part].mount;
3810 intensity = std::max( joules / 10000, static_cast<double>( intensity ) );
3811 // Move back from engine/muffler until we find an open space
3812 while( relative_parts.find( p ) != relative_parts.end() ) {
3813 p.x += ( velocity < 0 ? 1 : -1 );
3814 }
3815 point q = coord_translate( p );
3816 const tripoint dest = global_pos3() + tripoint( q, 0 );
3817 g->m.mod_field_intensity( dest, type, intensity );
3818}
3819
3820/**
3821 * Generate noise or smoke from a vehicle with engines turned on
3822 * load = how hard the engines are working, from 0.0 until 1.0
3823 * time = how many seconds to generated smoke for
3824 */
3825void vehicle::noise_and_smoke( int load, time_duration time )
3826{
3827 static const std::array<std::pair<std::string, int>, 8> sounds = { {
3828 { translate_marker( "hmm" ), 0 }, { translate_marker( "hummm!" ), 15 },
3829 { translate_marker( "whirrr!" ), 30 }, { translate_marker( "vroom!" ), 60 },
3830 { translate_marker( "roarrr!" ), 100 }, { translate_marker( "ROARRR!" ), 140 },
3831 { translate_marker( "BRRROARRR!" ), 180 }, { translate_marker( "BRUMBRUMBRUMBRUM!" ), INT_MAX }
3832 }
3833 };
3834 const std::string heli_noise = translate_marker( "WUMPWUMPWUMP!" );
3835 double noise = 0.0;
3836 double mufflesmoke = 0.0;
3837 double muffle = 1.0;
3838 double m = 0.0;
3839 int exhaust_part = -1;
3840 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "MUFFLER" ) ) {
3841 m = 1.0 - ( 1.0 - vp.info().bonus / 100.0 ) * vp.part().health_percent();
3842 if( m < muffle ) {
3843 muffle = m;
3844 exhaust_part = static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() );
3845 }
3846 }
3847
3848 bool bad_filter = false;
3849 bool combustion = false;
3850
3851 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); e++ ) {
3852 int p = engines[e];
3853 if( is_engine_on( e ) && engine_fuel_left( e ) ) {
3854 // convert current engine load to units of watts/40K
3855 // then spew more smoke and make more noise as the engine load increases
3856 int part_watts = part_vpower_w( p, true );
3857 double max_stress = static_cast<double>( part_watts / 40000.0 );
3858 double cur_stress = load / 1000.0 * max_stress;
3859 // idle stress = 1.0 resulting in nominal working engine noise = engine_noise_factor()
3860 // and preventing noise = 0
3861 cur_stress = std::max( cur_stress, 1.0 );
3862 double part_noise = cur_stress * part_info( p ).engine_noise_factor();
3863
3864 if( part_info( p ).has_flag( "E_COMBUSTION" ) ) {
3865 combustion = true;
3866 double health = parts[p].health_percent();
3867 if( parts[ p ].base.faults.count( fault_filter_fuel ) ) {
3868 health = 0.0;
3869 }
3870 if( health < part_info( p ).engine_backfire_threshold() && one_in( 50 + 150 * health ) ) {
3871 backfire( e );
3872 }
3873 double j = cur_stress * to_turns<int>( time ) * muffle * 1000;
3874
3875 if( parts[ p ].base.faults.count( fault_filter_air ) ) {
3876 bad_filter = true;
3877 j *= j;
3878 }
3879
3880 if( ( exhaust_part == -1 ) && engine_on ) {
3881 spew_field( j, p, fd_smoke, bad_filter ? fd_smoke.obj().get_max_intensity() : 1 );
3882 } else {
3883 mufflesmoke += j;
3884 }
3885 part_noise = ( part_noise + max_stress * 3 + 5 ) * muffle;
3886 }
3887 noise = std::max( noise, part_noise ); // Only the loudest engine counts.
3888 }
3889 }
3890 if( !combustion ) {
3891 return;
3892 }
3893 /// TODO: handle other engine types: muscle / animal / wind / coal / ...
3894
3895 if( exhaust_part != -1 && engine_on ) {
3896 spew_field( mufflesmoke, exhaust_part, fd_smoke,
3897 bad_filter ? fd_smoke.obj().get_max_intensity() : 1 );
3898 }
3899 if( is_rotorcraft() ) {
3900 noise *= 2;
3901 }
3902 // Cap engine noise to avoid deafening.
3903 noise = std::min( noise, 100.0 );
3904 // Even a vehicle with engines off will make noise traveling at high speeds
3905 noise = std::max( noise, static_cast<double>( std::fabs( velocity / 500.0 ) ) );
3906 int lvl = 0;
3907 if( one_in( 4 ) && rng( 0, 30 ) < noise ) {
3908 while( noise > sounds[lvl].second ) {
3909 lvl++;
3910 }
3911 }
3912 add_msg( m_debug, "VEH NOISE final: %d", static_cast<int>( noise ) );
3913 vehicle_noise = static_cast<unsigned char>( noise );
3914 sounds::sound( global_pos3(), noise, sounds::sound_t::movement,
3915 _( is_rotorcraft() ? heli_noise : sounds[lvl].first ), true );
3916}
3917
3918int vehicle::wheel_area() const
3919{
3920 int total_area = 0;
3921 for( const int &wheel_index : wheelcache ) {
3922 total_area += parts[ wheel_index ].wheel_area();
3923 }
3924
3925 return total_area;
3926}
3927
3928float vehicle::average_or_rating() const
3929{
3930 if( wheelcache.empty() ) {
3931 return 0.0f;
3932 }
3933 float total_rating = 0;
3934 for( const int &wheel_index : wheelcache ) {
3935 total_rating += part_info( wheel_index ).wheel_or_rating();
3936 }
3937 return total_rating / wheelcache.size();
3938}
3939
3940static double tile_to_width( int tiles )
3941{
3942 if( tiles < 1 ) {
3943 return 0.1;
3944 } else if( tiles < 6 ) {
3945 return 0.5 + 0.4 * tiles;
3946 } else {
3947 return 2.5 + 0.15 * ( tiles - 5 );
3948 }
3949}
3950
3951static constexpr int minrow = -122;
3952static constexpr int maxrow = 122;
3953struct drag_column {
3954 int pro = minrow;
3955 int hboard = minrow;
3956 int fboard = minrow;
3957 int aisle = minrow;
3958 int seat = minrow;
3959 int exposed = minrow;
3960 int roof = minrow;
3961 int shield = minrow;
3962 int turret = minrow;
3963 int panel = minrow;
3964 int windmill = minrow;
3965 int sail = minrow;
3966 int rotor = minrow;
3967 int last = maxrow;
3968};
3969
3970double vehicle::coeff_air_drag() const
3971{
3972 if( !coeff_air_dirty ) {
3973 return coefficient_air_resistance;
3974 }
3975 constexpr double c_air_base = 0.25;
3976 constexpr double c_air_mod = 0.1;
3977 constexpr double base_height = 1.4;
3978 constexpr double aisle_height = 0.6;
3979 constexpr double fullboard_height = 0.5;
3980 constexpr double roof_height = 0.1;
3981 constexpr double windmill_height = 0.7;
3982 constexpr double sail_height = 0.8;
3983 constexpr double rotor_height = 0.6;
3984
3985 std::vector<int> structure_indices = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
3986 int width = mount_max.y - mount_min.y + 1;
3987
3988 // a mess of lambdas to make the next bit slightly easier to read
3989 const auto d_exposed = [&]( const vehicle_part & p ) {
3990 // if it's not inside, it's a center location, and it doesn't need a roof, it's exposed
3991 if( p.info().location != part_location_center ) {
3992 return false;
3993 }
3994 return !( p.inside || p.info().has_flag( "NO_ROOF_NEEDED" ) ||
3995 p.info().has_flag( "WINDSHIELD" ) ||
3996 p.info().has_flag( "OPENABLE" ) );
3997 };
3998
3999 const auto d_protrusion = [&]( std::vector<int> parts_at ) {
4000 if( parts_at.size() > 1 ) {
4001 return false;
4002 } else {
4003 return parts[ parts_at.front() ].info().has_flag( "PROTRUSION" );
4004 }
4005 };
4006 const auto d_check_min = [&]( int &value, const vehicle_part & p, bool test ) {
4007 value = std::min( value, test ? p.mount.x - mount_min.x : maxrow );
4008 };
4009 const auto d_check_max = [&]( int &value, const vehicle_part & p, bool test ) {
4010 value = std::max( value, test ? p.mount.x - mount_min.x : minrow );
4011 };
4012
4013 // raycast down each column. the least drag vehicle has halfboard, windshield, seat with roof,
4014 // windshield, halfboard and is twice as long as it is wide.
4015 // find the first instance of each item and compare against the ideal configuration.
4016 std::vector<drag_column> drag( width );
4017 for( int p : structure_indices ) {
4018 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
4019 continue;
4020 }
4021 int col = parts[ p ].mount.y - mount_min.y;
4022 std::vector<int> parts_at = parts_at_relative( parts[ p ].mount, true );
4023 d_check_min( drag[ col ].pro, parts[ p ], d_protrusion( parts_at ) );
4024 for( int pa_index : parts_at ) {
4025 const vehicle_part &pa = parts[ pa_index ];
4026 d_check_max( drag[ col ].hboard, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "HALF_BOARD" ) );
4027 d_check_max( drag[ col ].fboard, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "FULL_BOARD" ) );
4028 d_check_max( drag[ col ].aisle, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "AISLE" ) );
4029 d_check_max( drag[ col ].shield, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WINDSHIELD" ) &&
4030 pa.is_available() );
4031 d_check_max( drag[ col ].seat, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "SEAT" ) ||
4032 pa.info().has_flag( "BED" ) );
4033 d_check_max( drag[ col ].turret, pa, pa.info().location == part_location_onroof &&
4034 !pa.info().has_flag( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) );
4035 d_check_max( drag[ col ].roof, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "ROOF" ) );
4036 d_check_max( drag[ col ].panel, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) );
4037 d_check_max( drag[ col ].windmill, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) );
4038 d_check_max( drag[ col ].rotor, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "ROTOR" ) );
4039 d_check_max( drag[ col ].sail, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WIND_POWERED" ) );
4040 d_check_max( drag[ col ].exposed, pa, d_exposed( pa ) );
4041 d_check_min( drag[ col ].last, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "LOW_FINAL_AIR_DRAG" ) ||
4042 pa.info().has_flag( "HALF_BOARD" ) );
4043 }
4044 }
4045 double height = 0;
4046 double c_air_drag = 0;
4047 // tally the results of each row and prorate them relative to vehicle width
4048 for( drag_column &dc : drag ) {
4049 // even as m_debug you rarely want to see this
4050 // add_msg( m_debug, "veh %: pro %d, hboard %d, fboard %d, shield %d, seat %d, roof %d, aisle %d, turret %d, panel %d, exposed %d, last %d\n", name, dc.pro, dc.hboard, dc.fboard, dc.shield, dc.seat, dc.roof, dc.aisle, dc.turret, dc.panel, dc.exposed, dc.last );
4051
4052 double c_air_drag_c = c_air_base;
4053 // rams in front of the vehicle mildly worsens air drag
4054 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.pro > dc.hboard ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
4055 // not having halfboards in front of any windshields or fullboards moderately worsens
4056 // air drag
4057 c_air_drag_c += ( std::max( std::max( dc.hboard, dc.fboard ),
4058 dc.shield ) != dc.hboard ) ? 2 * c_air_mod : 0;
4059 // not having windshields in front of seats severely worsens air drag
4060 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.shield < dc.seat ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
4061 // missing roofs and open doors severely worsen air drag
4062 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.exposed > minrow ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
4063 // being twice as long as wide mildly reduces air drag
4064 c_air_drag_c -= ( 2 * ( mount_max.x - mount_min.x ) > width ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
4065 // trunk doors and halfboards at the tail mildly reduce air drag
4066 c_air_drag_c -= ( dc.last == mount_min.x ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
4067 // turrets severely worsen air drag
4068 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.turret > minrow ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
4069 // having a windmill is terrible for your drag
4070 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.windmill > minrow ) ? 5 * c_air_mod : 0;
4071 // rotors are not great for drag!
4072 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.rotor > minrow ) ? 6 * c_air_mod : 0;
4073 // having a sail is terrible for your drag
4074 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.sail > minrow ) ? 7 * c_air_mod : 0;
4075 c_air_drag += c_air_drag_c;
4076 // vehicles are 1.4m tall
4077 double c_height = base_height;
4078 // plus a bit for a roof
4079 c_height += ( dc.roof > minrow ) ? roof_height : 0;
4080 // plus a lot for an aisle
4081 c_height += ( dc.aisle > minrow ) ? aisle_height : 0;
4082 // or fullboards
4083 c_height += ( dc.fboard > minrow ) ? fullboard_height : 0;
4084 // and a little for anything on the roof
4085 c_height += ( dc.turret > minrow ) ? 2 * roof_height : 0;
4086 // solar panels are better than turrets or floodlights, though
4087 c_height += ( dc.panel > minrow ) ? roof_height : 0;
4088 // windmills are tall, too
4089 c_height += ( dc.windmill > minrow ) ? windmill_height : 0;
4090 c_height += ( dc.rotor > minrow ) ? rotor_height : 0;
4091 // sails are tall, too
4092 c_height += ( dc.sail > minrow ) ? sail_height : 0;
4093 height += c_height;
4094 }
4095 constexpr double air_density = 1.29; // kg/m^3
4096 // prorate per row height and c_air_drag
4097 height /= width;
4098 c_air_drag /= width;
4099 double cross_area = height * tile_to_width( width );
4100 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: height %3.2fm, width %3.2fm (%d tiles), c_air %3.2f\n", name, height,
4101 tile_to_width( width ), width, c_air_drag );
4102 // F_air_drag = c_air_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * air_density * v^2
4103 // coeff_air_resistance = c_air_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * air_density
4104 coefficient_air_resistance = std::max( 0.1, c_air_drag * cross_area * 0.5 * air_density );
4105 coeff_air_dirty = false;
4106 return coefficient_air_resistance;
4107}
4108
4109double vehicle::coeff_rolling_drag() const
4110{
4111 if( !coeff_rolling_dirty ) {
4112 return coefficient_rolling_resistance;
4113 }
4114 constexpr double wheel_ratio = 1.25;
4115 constexpr double base_wheels = 4.0;
4116 // SAE J2452 measurements are in F_rr = N * C_rr * 0.000225 * ( v + 33.33 )
4117 // Don't ask me why, but it's the numbers we have. We want N * C_rr * 0.000225 here,
4118 // and N is mass * accel from gravity (aka weight)
4119 constexpr double sae_ratio = 0.000225;
4120 constexpr double newton_ratio = GRAVITY_OF_EARTH * sae_ratio;
4121 double wheel_factor = 0;
4122 if( wheelcache.empty() ) {
4123 wheel_factor = 50;
4124 } else {
4125 // should really sum the each wheel's c_rolling_resistance * it's share of vehicle mass
4126 for( auto wheel : wheelcache ) {
4127 wheel_factor += parts[ wheel ].info().wheel_rolling_resistance();
4128 }
4129 // mildly increasing rolling resistance for vehicles with more than 4 wheels and mildly
4130 // decrease it for vehicles with less
4131 wheel_factor *= wheel_ratio /
4132 ( base_wheels * wheel_ratio - base_wheels + wheelcache.size() );
4133 }
4134 coefficient_rolling_resistance = newton_ratio * wheel_factor * to_kilogram( total_mass() );
4135 coeff_rolling_dirty = false;
4136 return coefficient_rolling_resistance;
4137}
4138
4139double vehicle::water_hull_height() const
4140{
4141 if( coeff_water_dirty ) {
4142 coeff_water_drag();
4143 }
4144 return hull_height;
4145}
4146
4147double vehicle::water_draft() const
4148{
4149 if( coeff_water_dirty ) {
4150 coeff_water_drag();
4151 }
4152 return draft_m;
4153}
4154
4155bool vehicle::can_float() const
4156{
4157 if( coeff_water_dirty ) {
4158 coeff_water_drag();
4159 }
4160 // Someday I'll deal with submarines, but now, you can only float if you have freeboard
4161 return draft_m < hull_height;
4162}
4163
4164
4165double vehicle::total_rotor_area() const
4166{
4167 return std::accumulate( rotors.begin(), rotors.end(), double{0.0},
4168 [&]( double acc, int rotor ) {
4169 const double radius{ parts[ rotor ].info().rotor_diameter() / 2.0 };
4170 return acc + M_PI * std::pow( radius, 2 );
4171 } );
4172}
4173
4174// constants were converted from imperial to SI goodness
4175// returns as newton
4176double vehicle::lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( const bool fuelled, const bool safe ) const
4177{
4178 constexpr double coefficient = 0.8642;
4179 constexpr double exponentiation = -0.3107;
4180
4181 const double rotor_area = total_rotor_area();
4182 // take off 15 % due to the imaginary tail rotor power?
4183 const int engine_power = total_power_w( fuelled, safe );
4184
4185 const double power_load = engine_power / rotor_area;
4186 const double lift_thrust = coefficient * engine_power * std::pow( power_load, exponentiation );
4187 add_msg( m_debug, "lift thrust(N) of %s: %f, rotor area (m^2): %f, engine power (w): %i",
4188 name, lift_thrust, rotor_area, engine_power );
4189 return lift_thrust;
4190}
4191
4192bool vehicle::has_sufficient_rotorlift() const
4193{
4194 return lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( true ) > to_newton( total_mass() );
4195}
4196
4197// requires vehicle to have sufficient rotor lift, not suitable for checking if it has rotor.
4198bool vehicle::is_rotorcraft() const
4199{
4200 return has_part( "ROTOR" ) && has_sufficient_rotorlift() && player_in_control( g->u );
4201}
4202
4203int vehicle::get_z_change() const
4204{
4205 return requested_z_change;
4206}
4207
4208bool vehicle::is_flying_in_air() const
4209{
4210 return is_flying;
4211}
4212
4213void vehicle::set_flying( bool new_flying_value )
4214{
4215 is_flying = new_flying_value;
4216}
4217
4218bool vehicle::is_watercraft() const
4219{
4220 return is_floating || ( in_water && wheelcache.empty() );
4221}
4222
4223bool vehicle::is_in_water( bool deep_water ) const
4224{
4225 return deep_water ? is_floating : in_water;
4226}
4227
4228double vehicle::coeff_water_drag() const
4229{
4230 if( !coeff_water_dirty ) {
4231 return coefficient_water_resistance;
4232 }
4233 std::vector<int> structure_indices = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
4234 if( structure_indices.empty() ) {
4235 // huh?
4236 coeff_water_dirty = false;
4237 hull_height = 0.3;
4238 draft_m = 1.0;
4239 return 1250.0;
4240 }
4241 double hull_coverage = static_cast<double>( floating.size() ) / structure_indices.size();
4242
4243 int tile_width = mount_max.y - mount_min.y + 1;
4244 double width_m = tile_to_width( tile_width );
4245
4246 // actual area of the hull in m^2 (handles non-rectangular shapes)
4247 // footprint area in tiles = tile width * tile length
4248 // effective footprint percent = # of structure tiles / footprint area in tiles
4249 // actual hull area in m^2 = footprint percent * length in meters * width in meters
4250 // length in meters = length in tiles
4251 // actual area in m = # of structure tiles * length in tiles * width in meters /
4252 // ( length in tiles * width in tiles )
4253 // actual area in m = # of structure tiles * width in meters / width in tiles
4254 double actual_area_m = width_m * structure_indices.size() / tile_width;
4255
4256 // effective hull area is actual hull area * hull coverage
4257 double hull_area_m = actual_area_m * std::max( 0.1, hull_coverage );
4258 // Treat the hullform as a simple cuboid to calculate displaced depth of
4259 // water.
4260 // Apply Archimedes' principle (mass of water displaced is mass of vehicle).
4261 // area * depth = hull_volume = water_mass / water density
4262 // water_mass = vehicle_mass
4263 // area * depth = vehicle_mass / water_density
4264 // depth = vehicle_mass / water_density / area
4265 constexpr double water_density = 1000.0; // kg/m^3
4266 draft_m = to_kilogram( total_mass() ) / water_density / hull_area_m;
4267 // increase the streamlining as more of the boat is covered in boat boards
4268 double c_water_drag = 1.25 - hull_coverage;
4269 // hull height starts at 0.3m and goes up as you add more boat boards
4270 hull_height = 0.3 + 0.5 * hull_coverage;
4271 // F_water_drag = c_water_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * water_density * v^2
4272 // coeff_water_resistance = c_water_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * water_density
4273 coefficient_water_resistance = c_water_drag * width_m * draft_m * 0.5 * water_density;
4274 coeff_water_dirty = false;
4275 return coefficient_water_resistance;
4276}
4277
4278float vehicle::k_traction( float wheel_traction_area ) const
4279{
4280 if( is_floating ) {
4281 return can_float() ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
4282 }
4283 if( is_flying ) {
4284 return is_rotorcraft() ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
4285 }
4286 if( is_watercraft() && can_float() ) {
4287 return 1.0f;
4288 }
4289
4290 const float fraction_without_traction = 1.0f - wheel_traction_area / wheel_area();
4291 if( fraction_without_traction == 0 ) {
4292 return 1.0f;
4293 }
4294 const float mass_penalty = fraction_without_traction * to_kilogram( total_mass() );
4295 float traction = std::min( 1.0f, wheel_traction_area / mass_penalty );
4296 add_msg( m_debug, "%s has traction %.2f", name, traction );
4297
4298 // For now make it easy until it gets properly balanced: add a low cap of 0.1
4299 return std::max( 0.1f, traction );
4300}
4301
4302int vehicle::static_drag( bool actual ) const
4303{
4304 return extra_drag + ( actual && !engine_on && !is_towed() ? -1500 : 0 );
4305}
4306
4307float vehicle::strain() const
4308{
4309 int mv = max_velocity();
4310 int sv = safe_velocity();
4311 if( mv <= sv ) {
4312 mv = sv + 1;
4313 }
4314 if( velocity < sv && velocity > -sv ) {
4315 return 0;
4316 } else {
4317 return static_cast<float>( std::abs( velocity ) - sv ) / static_cast<float>( mv - sv );
4318 }
4319}
4320
4321bool vehicle::sufficient_wheel_config() const
4322{
4323 if( wheelcache.empty() ) {
4324 // No wheels!
4325 return false;
4326 } else if( wheelcache.size() == 1 ) {
4327 //Has to be a stable wheel, and one wheel can only support a 1-3 tile vehicle
4328 if( !part_info( wheelcache.front() ).has_flag( "STABLE" ) ||
4329 all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure ).size() > 3 ) {
4330 return false;
4331 }
4332 }
4333 return true;
4334}
4335
4336bool vehicle::is_owned_by( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
4337{
4338 if( owner.is_null() ) {
4339 return available_to_take;
4340 }
4341 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
4342 debugmsg( "vehicle::is_owned_by() player %s has no faction", c.disp_name() );
4343 return false;
4344 }
4345 return c.get_faction()->id == get_owner();
4346}
4347
4348bool vehicle::is_old_owner( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
4349{
4350 if( old_owner.is_null() ) {
4351 return available_to_take;
4352 }
4353 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
4354 debugmsg( "vehicle::is_old_owner() player %s has no faction", c.disp_name() );
4355 return false;
4356 }
4357 return c.get_faction()->id == get_old_owner();
4358}
4359
4360std::string vehicle::get_owner_name() const
4361{
4362 if( !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( owner ) ) {
4363 debugmsg( "vehicle::get_owner_name() vehicle %s has no valid nor null faction id ", disp_name() );
4364 return _( "no owner" );
4365 }
4366 return _( g->faction_manager_ptr->get( owner )->name );
4367}
4368
4369void vehicle::set_owner( const Character &c )
4370{
4371 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
4372 debugmsg( "vehicle::set_owner() player %s has no valid faction", c.disp_name() );
4373 return;
4374 }
4375 owner = c.get_faction()->id;
4376}
4377
4378bool vehicle::handle_potential_theft( avatar &you, bool check_only, bool prompt )
4379{
4380 const bool is_owned_by_player = is_owned_by( you );
4381 bool has_witnesses;
4382 if( has_owner() && !is_owned_by_player ) {
4383 has_witnesses = !avatar_funcs::list_potential_theft_witnesses( you, get_owner() ).empty();
4384 } else {
4385 has_witnesses = false;
4386 }
4387 // the vehicle is yours, that's fine.
4388 if( is_owned_by_player ) {
4389 return true;
4390 // if There is no owner
4391 // handle transfer of ownership
4392 } else if( !has_owner() ) {
4393 set_owner( you.get_faction()->id );
4394 remove_old_owner();
4395 return true;
4396 // if there is a marker for having been stolen, but 15 minutes have passed, then officially transfer ownership
4397 } else if( has_witnesses && has_old_owner() && !is_old_owner( you ) && theft_time &&
4398 calendar::turn - *theft_time > 15_minutes ) {
4399 set_owner( you.get_faction()->id );
4400 remove_old_owner();
4401 return true;
4402 // No witnesses? then don't need to prompt, we assume the player is in process of stealing it.
4403 // Ownership transfer checking is handled above, and warnings handled below.
4404 // This is just to perform interaction with the vehicle without a prompt.
4405 // It will prompt first-time, even with no witnesses, to inform player it is owned by someone else
4406 // subsequently, no further prompts, the player should know by then.
4407 } else if( has_witnesses && old_owner ) {
4408 return true;
4409 }
4410 // if we are just checking if we could continue without problems, then the rest is assumed false
4411 if( check_only ) {
4412 return false;
4413 }
4414 // if we got here, there's some theft occurring
4415 if( prompt ) {
4416 if( !query_yn(
4417 _( "This vehicle belongs to: %s, there may be consequences if you are observed interacting with it, continue?" ),
4418 _( get_owner_name() ) ) ) {
4419 return false;
4420 }
4421 }
4422 // set old owner so that we can restore ownership if there are witnesses.
4423 set_old_owner( get_owner() );
4424 if( avatar_funcs::handle_theft_witnesses( you, get_owner() ) ) {
4425 // remove the temporary marker for a successful theft, as it was witnessed.
4426 remove_old_owner();
4427 }
4428 // if we got here, then the action will proceed after the previous warning
4429 return true;
4430}
4431
4432bool vehicle::balanced_wheel_config() const
4433{
4434 point min = point_max;
4435 point max = point_min;
4436 // find the bounding box of the wheels
4437 for( auto &w : wheelcache ) {
4438 const auto &pt = parts[ w ].mount;
4439 min.x = std::min( min.x, pt.x );
4440 min.y = std::min( min.y, pt.y );
4441 max.x = std::max( max.x, pt.x );
4442 max.y = std::max( max.y, pt.y );
4443 }
4444
4445 // Check center of mass inside support of wheels (roughly)
4446 const point &com = local_center_of_mass();
4447 const inclusive_rectangle<point> support( min, max );
4448 return support.contains( com );
4449}
4450
4451bool vehicle::valid_wheel_config() const
4452{
4453 return sufficient_wheel_config() && balanced_wheel_config();
4454}
4455
4456float vehicle::steering_effectiveness() const
4457{
4458 if( is_floating ) {
4459 // I'M ON A BOAT
4460 return can_float() ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
4461 }
4462 if( is_flying ) {
4463 // I'M IN THE AIR
4464 return is_rotorcraft() ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
4465 }
4466 // irksome special case for boats in shallow water
4467 if( is_watercraft() && can_float() ) {
4468 return 1.0f;
4469 }
4470
4471 if( steering.empty() ) {
4472 return -1.0f; // No steering installed
4473 }
4474 // If the only steering part is an animal harness, with no animal in, it
4475 // is not steerable.
4476 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ steering[0] ];
4477 if( steering.size() == 1 && vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
4478 monster *mon = get_pet( steering[0] );
4479 if( mon == nullptr || !mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
4480 return -2.0f;
4481 }
4482 }
4483 // For now, you just need one wheel working for 100% effective steering.
4484 // TODO: return something less than 1.0 if the steering isn't so good
4485 // (unbalanced, long wheelbase, back-heavy vehicle with front wheel steering,
4486 // etc)
4487 for( int p : steering ) {
4488 if( parts[ p ].is_available() ) {
4489 return 1.0f;
4490 }
4491 }
4492
4493 // We have steering, but it's all broken.
4494 return 0.0f;
4495}
4496
4497float vehicle::handling_difficulty() const
4498{
4499 const float steer = std::max( 0.0f, steering_effectiveness() );
4500 const float ktraction = k_traction( g->m.vehicle_wheel_traction( *this ) );
4501 const float aligned = std::max( 0.0f, 1.0f - ( face_vec() - dir_vec() ).magnitude() );
4502
4503 // TestVehicle: perfect steering, moving on road at 100 mph (25 tiles per turn) = 0.0
4504 // TestVehicle but on grass (0.75 friction) = 2.5
4505 // TestVehicle but with bad steering (0.5 steer) = 5
4506 // TestVehicle but on fungal bed (0.5 friction) and bad steering = 10
4507 // TestVehicle but turned 90 degrees during this turn (0 align) = 10
4508 const float diff_mod = ( ( 1.0f - steer ) + ( 1.0f - ktraction ) + ( 1.0f - aligned ) );
4509 return velocity * diff_mod / vehicles::vmiph_per_tile;
4510}
4511
4512std::map<itype_id, int> vehicle::fuel_usage() const
4513{
4514 std::map<itype_id, int> ret;
4515 for( size_t i = 0; i < engines.size(); i++ ) {
4516 // Note: functions with "engine" in name do NOT take part indices
4517 // TODO: Use part indices and not engine vector indices
4518 if( !is_engine_on( i ) ) {
4519 continue;
4520 }
4521
4522 const size_t e = engines[ i ];
4523 const auto &info = part_info( e );
4524 static const itype_id null_fuel_type( "null" );
4525 const itype_id &cur_fuel = parts[ e ].fuel_current();
4526 if( cur_fuel == null_fuel_type ) {
4527 continue;
4528 }
4529
4530 if( !is_perpetual_type( i ) ) {
4531 int usage = info.energy_consumption;
4532 if( parts[ e ].faults().count( fault_filter_air ) ) {
4533 usage *= 2;
4534 }
4535
4536 ret[ cur_fuel ] += usage;
4537 }
4538 }
4539
4540 return ret;
4541}
4542
4543double vehicle::drain_energy( const itype_id &ftype, double energy_j )
4544{
4545 // Consumption of battery power is done differently.
4546 // From all batteries at once and doesn't change mass.
4547 if( ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
4548 // Batteries stored in kilojoules
4549 const int total_kj_to_drain = static_cast<int>( energy_j / 1000.0 );
4550 if( total_kj_to_drain <= 0 ) {
4551 return 0.0;
4552 }
4553 const int not_fulfilled = discharge_battery( total_kj_to_drain );
4554 return static_cast<double>( total_kj_to_drain - not_fulfilled ) * 1000.0;
4555 }
4556
4557 double drained = 0.0f;
4558 for( auto &p : parts ) {
4559 if( energy_j <= 0.0f ) {
4560 break;
4561 }
4562
4563 const double consumed = p.consume_energy( ftype, energy_j );
4564 drained += consumed;
4565 energy_j -= consumed;
4566 }
4567
4568 invalidate_mass();
4569 return drained;
4570}
4571
4572void vehicle::consume_fuel( int load, const int t_seconds, bool skip_electric )
4573{
4574 double st = strain();
4575 for( auto &fuel_pr : fuel_usage() ) {
4576 auto &ft = fuel_pr.first;
4577 if( skip_electric && ft == fuel_type_battery ) {
4578 continue;
4579 }
4580
