4581 double amnt_precise_j = static_cast<double>( fuel_pr.second ) * t_seconds;
4582 amnt_precise_j *= load / 1000.0 * ( 1.0 + st * st * 100.0 );
4583 auto inserted = fuel_used_last_turn.insert( { ft, 0.0f } );
4584 inserted.first->second += amnt_precise_j;
4585 double remainder = fuel_remainder[ ft ];
4586 amnt_precise_j -= remainder;
4587
4588 if( amnt_precise_j > 0.0f ) {
4589 fuel_remainder[ ft ] = drain_energy( ft, amnt_precise_j ) - amnt_precise_j;
4590 } else {
4591 fuel_remainder[ ft ] = -amnt_precise_j;
4592 }
4593 }
4594 // we want this to update the activity level whenever the engine is running
4595 if( load > 0 && fuel_left( fuel_type_muscle ) > 0 ) {
4596 //do this as a function of current load
4597 // But only if the player is actually there!
4598 int eff_load = load / 10;
4599 int mod = 4 * st; // strain
4600 int base_burn = static_cast<int>( get_option<float>( "PLAYER_BASE_STAMINA_REGEN_RATE" ) ) -
4601 3;
4602 base_burn = std::max( eff_load / 3, base_burn );
4603 //charge bionics when using muscle engine
4604 const item muscle( "muscle" );
4605 for( const bionic_id &bid : g->u.get_bionic_fueled_with( muscle ) ) {
4606 if( g->u.has_active_bionic( bid ) ) { // active power gen
4607 // more pedaling = more power
4608 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( muscle.fuel_energy() ) * bid->fuel_efficiency *
4609 ( load / 1000 ) );
4610 mod += eff_load / 5;
4611 } else { // passive power gen
4612 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( muscle.fuel_energy() ) * bid->passive_fuel_efficiency *
4613 ( load / 1000 ) );
4614 mod += eff_load / 10;
4615 }
4616 }
4617 // decreased stamina burn scalable with load
4618 if( g->u.has_active_bionic( bio_jointservo ) ) {
4619 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( -std::max( eff_load / 20, 1 ) ) );
4620 mod -= std::max( eff_load / 5, 5 );
4621 }
4622 if( one_in( 1000 / load ) && one_in( 10 ) ) {
4623 g->u.mod_stored_kcal( -10 );
4624 g->u.mod_thirst( 1 );
4625 g->u.mod_fatigue( 1 );
4626 }
4627 g->u.mod_stamina( -( base_burn + mod ) );
4628 add_msg( m_debug, "Load: %d", load );
4629 add_msg( m_debug, "Mod: %d", mod );
4630 add_msg( m_debug, "Burn: %d", -( base_burn + mod ) );
4631 }
4632}
4633
4634std::vector<vehicle_part *> vehicle::lights( bool active )
4635{
4636 std::vector<vehicle_part *> res;
4637 for( auto &e : parts ) {
4638 if( ( !active || e.enabled ) && e.is_available() && e.is_light() ) {
4639 res.push_back( &e );
4640 }
4641 }
4642 return res;
4643}
4644
4645int vehicle::total_accessory_epower_w() const
4646{
4647 int epower = 0;
4648 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( VPFLAG_ENABLED_DRAINS_EPOWER ) ) {
4649 epower += vp.info().epower;
4650 }
4651 return epower;
4652}
4653
4654int vehicle::total_alternator_epower_w() const
4655{
4656 int epower = 0;
4657 if( engine_on ) {
4658 // If the engine is on, the alternators are working.
4659 for( size_t p = 0; p < alternators.size(); ++p ) {
4660 if( is_alternator_on( p ) ) {
4661 epower += part_epower_w( alternators[p] );
4662 }
4663 }
4664 }
4665 return epower;
4666}
4667
4668int vehicle::total_engine_epower_w() const
4669{
4670 int epower = 0;
4671
4672 // Engines: can both produce (plasma) or consume (gas, diesel) epower.
4673 // Gas engines require epower to run for ignition system, ECU, etc.
4674 // Electric motor consumption not included, see @ref vpart_info::energy_consumption
4675 if( engine_on ) {
4676 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
4677 if( is_engine_on( e ) ) {
4678 epower += part_epower_w( engines[e] );
4679 }
4680 }
4681 }
4682
4683 return epower;
4684}
4685
4686int vehicle::total_solar_epower_w() const
4687{
4688 int epower_w = 0;
4689 for( int part : solar_panels ) {
4690 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
4691 continue;
4692 }
4693
4694 if( !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
4695 continue;
4696 }
4697
4698 epower_w += part_epower_w( part );
4699 }
4700 // Weather doesn't change much across the area of the vehicle, so just
4701 // sample it once.
4702 const weather_type_id &wtype = current_weather( global_pos3() );
4703 const float tick_sunlight = incident_sunlight( wtype, calendar::turn );
4704 double intensity = tick_sunlight / default_daylight_level();
4705 return epower_w * intensity;
4706}
4707
4708int vehicle::total_wind_epower_w() const
4709{
4710 map &here = get_map();
4711 const oter_id &cur_om_ter = overmap_buffer.ter( global_omt_location() );
4712 const weather_manager &weather = get_weather();
4713 int epower_w = 0;
4714 for( int part : wind_turbines ) {
4715 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
4716 continue;
4717 }
4718
4719 if( !is_sm_tile_outside( here.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
4720 continue;
4721 }
4722
4723 double windpower = get_local_windpower( weather.windspeed, cur_om_ter, global_part_pos3( part ),
4724 weather.winddirection, false );
4725 if( windpower <= ( weather.windspeed / 10.0 ) ) {
4726 continue;
4727 }
4728 epower_w += part_epower_w( part ) * windpower;
4729 }
4730 return epower_w;
4731}
4732
4733int vehicle::total_water_wheel_epower_w() const
4734{
4735 int epower_w = 0;
4736 for( int part : water_wheels ) {
4737 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
4738 continue;
4739 }
4740
4741 if( !is_sm_tile_over_water( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
4742 continue;
4743 }
4744
4745 epower_w += part_epower_w( part );
4746 }
4747 // TODO: river current intensity changes power - flat for now.
4748 return epower_w;
4749}
4750
4751int vehicle::net_battery_charge_rate_w() const
4752{
4753 return total_engine_epower_w() + total_alternator_epower_w() + total_accessory_epower_w() +
4754 total_solar_epower_w() + total_wind_epower_w() + total_water_wheel_epower_w();
4755}
4756
4757int vehicle::max_reactor_epower_w() const
4758{
4759 int epower_w = 0;
4760 for( int elem : reactors ) {
4761 epower_w += is_part_on( elem ) ? part_epower_w( elem ) : 0;
4762 }
4763 return epower_w;
4764}
4765
4766void vehicle::update_alternator_load()
4767{
4768 // Update alternator load
4769 if( engine_on ) {
4770 int engine_vpower = 0;
4771 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
4772 if( is_engine_on( e ) && parts[engines[e]].info().has_flag( "E_ALTERNATOR" ) ) {
4773 engine_vpower += part_vpower_w( engines[e] );
4774 }
4775 }
4776 int alternators_power = 0;
4777 for( size_t p = 0; p < alternators.size(); ++p ) {
4778 if( is_alternator_on( p ) ) {
4779 alternators_power += part_vpower_w( alternators[p] );
4780 }
4781 }
4782 alternator_load =
4783 engine_vpower
4784 ? 1000 * ( std::abs( alternators_power ) + std::abs( extra_drag ) ) / engine_vpower
4785 : 0;
4786 } else {
4787 alternator_load = 0;
4788 }
4789}
4790
4791void vehicle::power_parts()
4792{
4793 update_alternator_load();
4794 // Things that drain energy: engines and accessories.
4795 int engine_epower = total_engine_epower_w();
4796 int epower = engine_epower + total_accessory_epower_w() + total_alternator_epower_w();
4797
4798 int delta_energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower, 1_turns );
4799 int storage_deficit_bat = std::max( 0, fuel_capacity( fuel_type_battery ) -
4800 fuel_left( fuel_type_battery ) - delta_energy_bat );
4801 // Reactors trigger only on demand. If we'd otherwise run out of power, see
4802 // if we can spin up the reactors.
4803 if( !reactors.empty() && storage_deficit_bat > 0 ) {
4804 // Still not enough surplus epower to fully charge battery
4805 // Produce additional epower from any reactors
4806 bool reactor_working = false;
4807 bool reactor_online = false;
4808 for( auto &elem : reactors ) {
4809 // Check whether the reactor is on. If not, move on.
4810 if( !is_part_on( elem ) ) {
4811 continue;
4812 }
4813 // Keep track whether or not the vehicle has any reactors activated
4814 reactor_online = true;
4815 // the amount of energy the reactor generates each turn
4816 const int gen_energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( part_epower_w( elem ), 1_turns );
4817 if( parts[ elem ].is_unavailable() ) {
4818 continue;
4819 } else if( parts[ elem ].info().has_flag( flag_PERPETUAL ) ) {
4820 reactor_working = true;
4821 delta_energy_bat += std::min( storage_deficit_bat, gen_energy_bat );
4822 } else if( parts[elem].ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
4823 // Efficiency: one unit of fuel is this many units of battery
4824 // Note: One battery is 1 kJ
4825 const int efficiency = part_info( elem ).power;
4826 const int avail_fuel = parts[elem].ammo_remaining() * efficiency;
4827 const int elem_energy_bat = std::min( gen_energy_bat, avail_fuel );
4828 // Cap output at what we can achieve and utilize
4829 const int reactors_output_bat = std::min( elem_energy_bat, storage_deficit_bat );
4830 // Fuel consumed in actual units of the resource
4831 int fuel_consumed = reactors_output_bat / efficiency;
4832 // Remainder has a chance of resulting in more fuel consumption
4833 fuel_consumed += x_in_y( reactors_output_bat % efficiency, efficiency ) ? 1 : 0;
4834 parts[ elem ].ammo_consume( fuel_consumed, global_part_pos3( elem ) );
4835 reactor_working = true;
4836 delta_energy_bat += reactors_output_bat;
4837 }
4838 }
4839
4840 if( !reactor_working && reactor_online ) {
4841 // All reactors out of fuel or destroyed
4842 for( auto &elem : reactors ) {
4843 parts[ elem ].enabled = false;
4844 }
4845 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4846 add_msg( _( "The %s's reactor dies!" ), name );
4847 }
4848 }
4849 }
4850
4851 int battery_deficit = 0;
4852 if( delta_energy_bat > 0 ) {
4853 // store epower surplus in battery
4854 charge_battery( delta_energy_bat );
4855 } else if( epower < 0 ) {
4856 // draw epower deficit from battery
4857 battery_deficit = discharge_battery( std::abs( delta_energy_bat ) );
4858 }
4859
4860 if( battery_deficit != 0 ) {
4861 // Scoops need a special case since they consume power during actual use
4862 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "SCOOP" ) ) {
4863 vp.part().enabled = false;
4864 }
4865 // Rechargers need special case since they consume power on demand
4866 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "RECHARGE" ) ) {
4867 vp.part().enabled = false;
4868 }
4869
4870 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( VPFLAG_ENABLED_DRAINS_EPOWER ) ) {
4871 vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
4872 if( pt.info().epower < 0 ) {
4873 pt.enabled = false;
4874 }
4875 }
4876
4877 is_alarm_on = false;
4878 camera_on = false;
4879 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4880 add_msg( _( "The %s's battery dies!" ), name );
4881 }
4882 if( engine_epower < 0 ) {
4883 // Not enough epower to run gas engine ignition system
4884 engine_on = false;
4885 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4886 add_msg( _( "The %s's engine dies!" ), name );
4887 }
4888 }
4889 }
4890}
4891
4892vehicle *vehicle::find_vehicle( const tripoint &where )
4893{
4894 // Is it in the reality bubble?
4895 tripoint veh_local = g->m.getlocal( where );
4896 if( const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( veh_local ) ) {
4897 return &vp->vehicle();
4898 }
4899
4900 // Nope. Load up its submap...
4901 tripoint veh_in_sm = where;
4902 tripoint veh_sm = ms_to_sm_remain( veh_in_sm );
4903
4904 auto sm = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( veh_sm );
4905 if( sm == nullptr ) {
4906 return nullptr;
4907 }
4908
4909 for( auto &elem : sm->vehicles ) {
4910 vehicle *found_veh = elem.get();
4911 if( veh_in_sm.xy() == found_veh->pos ) {
4912 return found_veh;
4913 }
4914 }
4915
4916 return nullptr;
4917}
4918
4919void vehicle::enumerate_vehicles( std::map<vehicle *, bool> &connected_vehicles,
4920 const std::set<vehicle *> &vehicle_list )
4921{
4922 auto enumerate_visitor = [&connected_vehicles]( vehicle & veh ) {
4923 // Only emplaces if element is not present already.
4924 connected_vehicles.emplace( &veh, false );
4925 return distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result::continue_further;
4926 };
4927 for( vehicle *veh : vehicle_list ) {
4928 // This autovivifies, and also overwrites the value if already present.
4929 connected_vehicles[veh] = true;
4930 distribution_graph::traverse( *veh, enumerate_visitor, distribution_graph::noop_visitor_grid );
4931 }
4932}
4933
4934// TODO: It looks out of place in vehicle.cpp
4935namespace distribution_graph
4936{
4937
4938template <bool IsConst,
4939 typename Vehicle = typename std::conditional<IsConst, const vehicle, vehicle>::type,
4940 typename Grid = typename std::conditional<IsConst, const distribution_grid, distribution_grid>::type>
4941struct vehicle_or_grid {
4942 enum class type_t : char {
4943 vehicle,
4944 grid
4945 } type;
4946
4947 Vehicle *veh = nullptr;
4948 Grid *grid = nullptr;
4949
4950 vehicle_or_grid( Vehicle *veh )
4951 : type( type_t::vehicle )
4952 , veh( veh )
4953 {}
4954
4955 vehicle_or_grid( Grid *grid )
4956 : type( type_t::grid )
4957 , grid( grid )
4958 {}
4959
4960 bool operator==( const vehicle_or_grid &other ) const {
4961 return veh == other.veh && grid == other.grid;
4962 }
4963
4964 bool operator==( const vehicle *veh ) const {
4965 return this->veh == veh;
4966 }
4967
4968 bool operator==( const distribution_grid *grid ) const {
4969 return this->grid == grid;
4970 }
4971};
4972
4973template <typename VehFunc, typename GridFunc, typename StartPoint>
4974void traverse( StartPoint &start,
4975 VehFunc veh_action, GridFunc grid_action )
4976{
4977 using tvr = traverse_visitor_result;
4978 constexpr bool IsConst = std::is_const<StartPoint>::value;
4979 struct hash {
4980 const std::hash<char> char_hash = std::hash<char>();
4981 const std::hash<size_t> ptr_hash = std::hash<size_t>();
4982 auto operator()( const vehicle_or_grid<IsConst> &elem ) const {
4983 return char_hash( static_cast<char>( elem.type ) ) ^
4984 ptr_hash(
4985 // Because only one of pointers is not nullptr, binary OR would get value of set pointer.
4986 reinterpret_cast<size_t>( elem.veh ) | reinterpret_cast<size_t>( elem.grid )
4987 );
4988 }
4989 };
4990
4991 // Actually, they are visited elements with unvisited neighbours.
4992 // Not all connected elements are here.
4993 std::queue<vehicle_or_grid<IsConst>> connected_elements;
4994 // For fast checking if we should visit some neighbour.
4995 std::unordered_set<vehicle_or_grid<IsConst>, hash> visited_elements;
4996 connected_elements.emplace( &start );
4997 visited_elements.insert( &start );
4998 auto &grid_tracker = get_distribution_grid_tracker();
4999
5000 auto enqueue = [&connected_elements, &visited_elements]( vehicle_or_grid<IsConst> newly_visited ) {
5001 connected_elements.push( newly_visited );
5002 visited_elements.insert( newly_visited );
5003 };
5004 auto was_already_visited = [&visited_elements]( vehicle_or_grid<IsConst> to_visit ) {
5005 return visited_elements.count( to_visit ) != 0;
5006 };
5007
5008 auto process_vehicle = [&]( const tripoint_abs_ms & target_pos ) {
5009 auto *veh = vehicle::find_vehicle( target_pos );
5010 if( veh == nullptr ) {
5011 debugmsg( "lost vehicle at %s", target_pos.to_string() );
5012 return tvr::continue_further;
5013 }
5014
5015 if( was_already_visited( veh ) ) {
5016 return tvr::continue_further;
5017 }
5018
5019 const tvr result = veh_action( *veh );
5020 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "After remote veh %p",
5021 static_cast<void *>( veh ) );
5022
5023 // We do not need to check neighbours if we stop.
5024 if( result == tvr::continue_further ) {
5025 enqueue( veh );
5026 }
5027
5028 return result;
5029 };
5030
5031 auto process_grid = [&]( const tripoint_abs_ms & target_pos ) {
5032 auto &grid = grid_tracker.grid_at( target_pos );
5033 if( !grid ) {
5034 debugmsg( "lost grid at %s", target_pos.to_string() );
5035 return tvr::continue_further;
5036 }
5037
5038 if( was_already_visited( &grid ) ) {
5039 return tvr::continue_further;
5040 }
5041
5042 const tvr result = grid_action( grid );
5043 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "After remote grid %p",
5044 static_cast<void *>( &grid ) );
5045
5046 // We do not need to check neighbours if we stop.
5047 if( result == tvr::continue_further ) {
5048 enqueue( &grid );
5049 }
5050
5051 return result;
5052 };
5053
5054 while( !connected_elements.empty() ) {
5055 auto current = connected_elements.front();
5056 connected_elements.pop();
5057
5058 if( current.type == vehicle_or_grid<IsConst>::type_t::vehicle ) {
5059 const vehicle &current_veh = *current.veh;
5060 for( auto &p : current_veh.loose_parts ) {
5061 if( !current_veh.part_info( p ).has_flag( "POWER_TRANSFER" ) ) {
5062 // Ignore loose parts that aren't power transfer cables
5063 continue;
5064 }
5065
5066 const tripoint_abs_ms target_pos( current_veh.cpart( p ).target.second );
5067 if( current_veh.cpart( p ).has_flag( vehicle_part::targets_grid ) ) {
5068 if( process_grid( target_pos ) == tvr::stop ) {
5069 return;
5070 }
5071 } else {
5072 if( process_vehicle( target_pos ) == tvr::stop ) {
5073 return;
5074 }
5075 }
5076 }
5077 } else {
5078 // Grids can only be connected to vehicles at the moment
5079 auto &current_grid = *current.grid;
5080 for( auto &p : current_grid.get_contents() ) {
5081 const vehicle_connector_tile *connector = active_tiles::furn_at<vehicle_connector_tile>( p );
5082 if( connector == nullptr ) {
5083 continue;
5084 }
5085
5086 for( const tripoint_abs_ms &target_pos : connector->connected_vehicles ) {
5087 if( process_vehicle( target_pos ) == tvr::stop ) {
5088 return;
5089 }
5090 }
5091 }
5092 }
5093 }
5094}
5095
5096} // namespace distribution_graph
5097
5098int vehicle::charge_battery( int amount, bool include_other_vehicles )
5099{
5100 // Key parts by percentage charge level.
5101 std::multimap<int, vehicle_part *> chargeable_parts;
5102 for( vehicle_part &p : parts ) {
5103 if( p.is_available() && p.is_battery() && p.ammo_capacity() > p.ammo_remaining() ) {
5104 chargeable_parts.insert( { ( p.ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p.ammo_capacity(), &p } );
5105 }
5106 }
5107 while( amount > 0 && !chargeable_parts.empty() ) {
5108 // Grab first part, charge until it reaches the next %, then re-insert with new % key.
5109 auto iter = chargeable_parts.begin();
5110 int charge_level = iter->first;
5111 vehicle_part *p = iter->second;
5112 chargeable_parts.erase( iter );
5113 // Calculate number of charges to reach the next %, but insure it's at least
5114 // one more than current charge.
5115 int next_charge_level = ( ( charge_level + 1 ) * p->ammo_capacity() ) / 100;
5116 next_charge_level = std::max( next_charge_level, p->ammo_remaining() + 1 );
5117 int qty = std::min( amount, next_charge_level - p->ammo_remaining() );
5118 p->ammo_set( fuel_type_battery, p->ammo_remaining() + qty );
5119 amount -= qty;
5120 if( p->ammo_capacity() > p->ammo_remaining() ) {
5121 chargeable_parts.insert( { ( p->ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p->ammo_capacity(), p } );
5122 }
5123 }
5124
5125 if( amount > 0 && include_other_vehicles ) {
5126 // still a bit of charge we could send out...
5127 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
5128 auto charge_veh = [&amount]( vehicle & veh ) {
5129 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHv: %d", amount );
5130 amount = veh.charge_battery( amount, false );
5131 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5132 };
5133 auto charge_grid = [&amount]( distribution_grid & grid ) {
5134 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHg: %d", amount );
5135 amount = grid.mod_resource( amount, false );
5136 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5137 };
5138 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, charge_veh, charge_grid );
5139 }
5140
5141
5142 return amount;
5143}
5144
5145int vehicle::discharge_battery( int amount, bool recurse )
5146{
5147 // Key parts by percentage charge level.
5148 std::multimap<int, vehicle_part *> dischargeable_parts;
5149 for( vehicle_part &p : parts ) {
5150 if( p.is_available() && p.is_battery() && p.ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
5151 dischargeable_parts.insert( { ( p.ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p.ammo_capacity(), &p } );
5152 }
5153 }
5154 while( amount > 0 && !dischargeable_parts.empty() ) {
5155 // Grab first part, discharge until it reaches the next %, then re-insert with new % key.
5156 auto iter = std::prev( dischargeable_parts.end() );
5157 int charge_level = iter->first;
5158 vehicle_part *p = iter->second;
5159 dischargeable_parts.erase( iter );
5160 // Calculate number of charges to reach the previous %.
5161 int prev_charge_level = ( ( charge_level - 1 ) * p->ammo_capacity() ) / 100;
5162 prev_charge_level = std::max( 0, prev_charge_level );
5163 int amount_to_discharge = std::min( p->ammo_remaining() - prev_charge_level, amount );
5164 p->ammo_consume( amount_to_discharge, global_part_pos3( *p ) );
5165 amount -= amount_to_discharge;
5166 if( p->ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
5167 dischargeable_parts.insert( { ( p->ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p->ammo_capacity(), p } );
5168 }
5169 }
5170
5171 if( amount > 0 && recurse ) {
5172 // need more power!
5173 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
5174 auto discharge_vehicle = [&amount]( vehicle & veh ) {
5175 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHv: %d", amount );
5176 amount = veh.discharge_battery( amount, false );
5177 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5178 };
5179 auto discharge_grid = [&amount]( distribution_grid & grid ) {
5180 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHg: %d", amount );
5181 amount = -grid.mod_resource( -amount, false );
5182 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5183 };
5184 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, discharge_vehicle, discharge_grid );
5185 }
5186
5187 return amount; // non-zero if we weren't able to fulfill demand.
5188}
5189
5190void vehicle::do_engine_damage( size_t e, int strain )
5191{
5192 strain = std::min( 25, strain );
5193 if( is_engine_on( e ) && !is_perpetual_type( e ) &&
5194 engine_fuel_left( e ) && rng( 1, 100 ) < strain ) {
5195 int dmg = rng( 0, strain * 4 );
5196 damage_direct( engines[e], dmg );
5197 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
5198 add_msg( _( "Your engine emits a high pitched whine." ) );
5199 } else {
5200 add_msg( _( "Your engine emits a loud grinding sound." ) );
5201 }
5202 }
5203}
5204
5205void vehicle::idle( bool on_map )
5206{
5207 power_parts();
5208 if( engine_on && total_power_w() > 0 ) {
5209 int idle_rate = alternator_load;
5210 if( idle_rate < 10 ) {
5211 idle_rate = 10; // minimum idle is 1% of full throttle
5212 }
5213 // Helicopters use extra power just to stay in the air
5214 // 100 means 10% of power
5215 if( is_rotorcraft() && is_flying_in_air() ) {
5216 idle_rate = 100;
5217 }
5218 if( has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
5219 consume_fuel( idle_rate, to_turns<int>( 1_turns ), true );
5220 }
5221
5222 if( on_map ) {
5223 noise_and_smoke( idle_rate, 1_turns );
5224 }
5225 } else {
5226 if( engine_on && g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) &&
5227 ( has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) && has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_animal, true ) &&
5228 has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_wind, true ) && has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_mana, true ) ) ) {
5229 add_msg( _( "The %s's engine dies!" ), name );
5230 }
5231 engine_on = false;
5232 }
5233
5234 if( !warm_enough_to_plant( g->u.pos() ) ) {
5235 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "PLANTER" ) ) {
5236 if( g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
5237 add_msg( _( "The %s's planter turns off due to low temperature." ), name );
5238 }
5239 vp.part().enabled = false;
5240 }
5241 }
5242
5243 if( !on_map ) {
5244 return;
5245 } else {
5246 update_time( calendar::turn );
5247 }
5248
5249 process_emitters();
5250
5251 if( has_part( "STEREO", true ) ) {
5252 play_music();
5253 }
5254
5255 if( has_part( "CHIMES", true ) ) {
5256 play_chimes();
5257 }
5258
5259 if( has_part( "CRASH_TERRAIN_AROUND", true ) ) {
5260 crash_terrain_around();
5261 }
5262
5263 if( is_alarm_on ) {
5264 alarm();
5265 }
5266}
5267
5268void vehicle::on_move()
5269{
5270 if( has_part( "TRANSFORM_TERRAIN", true ) ) {
5271 transform_terrain();
5272 }
5273 if( has_part( "SCOOP", true ) ) {
5274 operate_scoop();
5275 }
5276 if( has_part( "PLANTER", true ) ) {
5277 operate_planter();
5278 }
5279 if( has_part( "REAPER", true ) ) {
5280 operate_reaper();
5281 }
5282
5283 occupied_cache_time = calendar::before_time_starts;
5284}
5285
5286void vehicle::slow_leak()
5287{
5288 // for each badly damaged tanks (lower than 50% health), leak a small amount
5289 for( auto &p : parts ) {
5290 auto health = p.health_percent();
5291 if( !p.is_leaking() || p.ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
5292 continue;
5293 }
5294
5295 auto fuel = p.ammo_current();
5296 int qty = std::max( ( 0.5 - health ) * ( 0.5 - health ) * p.ammo_remaining() / 10, 1.0 );
5297 point q = coord_translate( p.mount );
5298 const tripoint dest = global_pos3() + tripoint( q, 0 );
5299
5300 if( fuel != fuel_type_battery && !g->m.inbounds( dest ) ) {
5301 // Don't try to leak off the edge of the world
5302 continue;
5303 }
5304
5305 // damaged batteries self-discharge without leaking, plutonium leaks slurry
5306 if( fuel != fuel_type_battery && fuel != fuel_type_plutonium_cell ) {
5307 item leak( fuel, calendar::turn, qty );
5308 g->m.add_item_or_charges( dest, leak );
5309 p.ammo_consume( qty, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5310 } else if( fuel == fuel_type_plutonium_cell ) {
5311 if( p.ammo_remaining() >= PLUTONIUM_CHARGES / 10 ) {
5312 item leak( "plut_slurry_dense", calendar::turn, qty );
5313 g->m.add_item_or_charges( dest, leak );
5314 p.ammo_consume( qty * PLUTONIUM_CHARGES / 10, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5315 } else {
5316 p.ammo_consume( p.ammo_remaining(), global_part_pos3( p ) );
5317 }
5318 } else {
5319 p.ammo_consume( qty, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5320 }
5321 }
5322}
5323
5324// total volume of all the things
5325units::volume vehicle::stored_volume( const int part ) const
5326{
5327 return get_items( part ).stored_volume();
5328}
5329
5330units::volume vehicle::max_volume( const int part ) const
5331{
5332 return get_items( part ).max_volume();
5333}
5334
5335units::volume vehicle::free_volume( const int part ) const
5336{
5337 return get_items( part ).free_volume();
5338}
5339
5340void vehicle::make_active( item_location &loc )
5341{
5342 item &target = *loc;
5343 if( !target.needs_processing() ) {
5344 return;
5345 }
5346 auto cargo_parts = get_parts_at( loc.position(), "CARGO", part_status_flag::any );
5347 if( cargo_parts.empty() ) {
5348 return;
5349 }
5350 // System insures that there is only one part in this vector.
5351 vehicle_part *cargo_part = cargo_parts.front();
5352 active_items.add( target, cargo_part->mount );
5353}
5354
5355int vehicle::add_charges( int part, const item &itm )
5356{
5357 if( !itm.count_by_charges() ) {
5358 debugmsg( "Add charges was called for an item not counted by charges!" );
5359 return 0;
5360 }
5361 const int ret = get_items( part ).amount_can_fit( itm );
5362 if( ret == 0 ) {
5363 return 0;
5364 }
5365
5366 item itm_copy = itm;
5367 itm_copy.charges = ret;
5368 return add_item( part, itm_copy ) ? ret : 0;
5369}
5370
5371cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator> vehicle::add_item( vehicle_part &pt, const item &obj )
5372{
5373 int idx = index_of_part( &pt );
5374 if( idx < 0 ) {
5375 debugmsg( "Tried to add item to invalid part" );
5376 return cata::nullopt;
5377 }
5378 return add_item( idx, obj );
5379}
5380
5381cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator> vehicle::add_item( int part, const item &itm )
5382{
5383 if( part < 0 || part >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
5384 debugmsg( "int part (%d) is out of range", part );
5385 return cata::nullopt;
5386 }
5387 // const int max_weight = ?! // TODO: weight limit, calculation per vpart & vehicle stats, not a hard user limit.
5388 // add creaking sounds and damage to overloaded vpart, outright break it past a certain point, or when hitting bumps etc
5389 vehicle_part &p = parts[ part ];
5390 if( p.is_broken() ) {
5391 return cata::nullopt;
5392 }
5393
5394 if( p.base.is_gun() ) {
5395 if( !itm.is_ammo() || !p.base.ammo_types().count( itm.ammo_type() ) ) {
5396 return cata::nullopt;
5397 }
5398 }
5399 bool charge = itm.count_by_charges();
5400 vehicle_stack istack = get_items( part );
5401 const int to_move = istack.amount_can_fit( itm );
5402 if( to_move == 0 || ( charge && to_move < itm.charges ) ) {
5403 return cata::nullopt; // @add_charges should be used in the latter case
5404 }
5405 if( charge ) {
5406 item *here = istack.stacks_with( itm );
5407 if( here ) {
5408 invalidate_mass();
5409 if( !here->merge_charges( itm ) ) {
5410 return cata::nullopt;
5411 } else {
5412 return cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator>( istack.get_iterator_from_pointer( here ) );
5413 }
5414 }
5415 }
5416
5417 item itm_copy = itm;
5418
5419 if( itm_copy.is_bucket_nonempty() ) {
5420 itm_copy.contents.spill_contents( global_part_pos3( part ) );
5421 }
5422
5423 const vehicle_stack::iterator new_pos = p.items.insert( itm_copy );
5424 if( itm_copy.needs_processing() ) {
5425 active_items.add( *new_pos, p.mount );
5426 }
5427
5428 invalidate_mass();
5429 return cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator>( new_pos );
5430}
5431
5432bool vehicle::remove_item( int part, item *it )
5433{
5434 const cata::colony<item> &veh_items = parts[part].items;
5435 const cata::colony<item>::const_iterator iter = veh_items.get_iterator_from_pointer( it );
5436 if( iter == veh_items.end() ) {
5437 return false;
5438 }
5439 remove_item( part, iter );
5440 return true;
5441}
5442
5443vehicle_stack::iterator vehicle::remove_item( int part, vehicle_stack::const_iterator it )
5444{
5445 cata::colony<item> &veh_items = parts[part].items;
5446
5447 // remove from the active items cache (if it isn't there does nothing)
5448 active_items.remove( &*it );
5449
5450 invalidate_mass();
5451 return veh_items.erase( it );
5452}
5453
5454vehicle_stack vehicle::get_items( const int part )
5455{
5456 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( part );
5457 return vehicle_stack( &parts[part].items, pos.xy(), this, part );
5458}
5459
5460vehicle_stack vehicle::get_items( const int part ) const
5461{
5462 // HACK: callers could modify items through this
5463 // TODO: a const version of vehicle_stack is needed
5464 return const_cast<vehicle *>( this )->get_items( part );
5465}
5466
5467void vehicle::place_spawn_items()
5468{
5469 if( !type.is_valid() ) {
5470 return;
5471 }
5472
5473 for( const auto &pt : type->parts ) {
5474 if( pt.with_ammo ) {
5475 int turret = part_with_feature( pt.pos, "TURRET", true );
5476 if( turret >= 0 && x_in_y( pt.with_ammo, 100 ) ) {
5477 parts[ turret ].ammo_set( random_entry( pt.ammo_types ), rng( pt.ammo_qty.first,
5478 pt.ammo_qty.second ) );
5479 }
5480 }
5481 }
5482
5483 for( const auto &spawn : type.obj().item_spawns ) {
5484 if( rng( 1, 100 ) <= spawn.chance ) {
5485 int part = part_with_feature( spawn.pos, "CARGO", false );
5486 if( part < 0 ) {
5487 debugmsg( "No CARGO parts at (%d, %d) of %s!", spawn.pos.x, spawn.pos.y, name );
5488
5489 } else {
5490 // if vehicle part is broken only 50% of items spawn and they will be variably damaged
5491 bool broken = parts[ part ].is_broken();
5492 if( broken && one_in( 2 ) ) {
5493 continue;
5494 }
5495
5496 std::vector<item> created;
5497 for( const itype_id &e : spawn.item_ids ) {
5498 created.emplace_back( item( e ).in_its_container() );
5499 }
5500 for( const item_group_id &e : spawn.item_groups ) {
5501 item_group::ItemList group_items = item_group::items_from( e, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
5502 for( auto spawn_item : group_items ) {
5503 created.emplace_back( spawn_item );
5504 }
5505 }
5506
5507 for( item &e : created ) {
5508 if( e.is_null() ) {
5509 continue;
5510 }
5511 if( broken && e.mod_damage( rng( 1, e.max_damage() ) ) ) {
5512 continue; // we destroyed the item
5513 }
5514 if( e.is_tool() || e.is_gun() || e.is_magazine() ) {
5515 bool spawn_ammo = rng( 0, 99 ) < spawn.with_ammo && e.ammo_remaining() == 0;
5516 bool spawn_mag = rng( 0, 99 ) < spawn.with_magazine && !e.magazine_integral() &&
5517 !e.magazine_current();
5518
5519 if( spawn_mag ) {
5520 e.put_in( item( e.magazine_default(), e.birthday() ) );
5521 }
5522 if( spawn_ammo ) {
5523 e.ammo_set( e.ammo_default() );
5524 }
5525 }
5526 add_item( part, e );
5527 }
5528 }
5529 }
5530 }
5531}
5532
5533void vehicle::gain_moves()
5534{
5535 fuel_used_last_turn.clear();
5536 check_falling_or_floating();
5537 const bool pl_control = player_in_control( g->u );
5538 if( is_moving() || is_falling ) {
5539 if( !loose_parts.empty() ) {
5540 shed_loose_parts();
5541 }
5542 of_turn = 1 + of_turn_carry;
5543 const int vslowdown = slowdown( velocity );
5544 if( vslowdown > std::abs( velocity ) ) {
5545 if( cruise_on && cruise_velocity && pl_control ) {
5546 velocity = velocity > 0 ? 1 : -1;
5547 } else {
5548 stop();
5549 }
5550 } else if( velocity < 0 ) {
5551 velocity += vslowdown;
5552 } else {
5553 velocity -= vslowdown;
5554 }
5555 } else {
5556 of_turn = .001;
5557 }
5558 of_turn_carry = 0;
5559 // cruise control TODO: enable for NPC?
5560 if( ( pl_control || is_following || is_patrolling ) && cruise_on && cruise_velocity != velocity ) {
5561 thrust( ( cruise_velocity ) > velocity ? 1 : -1 );
5562 }
5563
5564 // Force off-map vehicles to load by visiting them every time we gain moves.
5565 // Shouldn't be too expensive if there aren't fifty trillion vehicles in the graph...
5566 // ...and if there are, it's the player's fault for putting them there.
5567 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, distribution_graph::noop_visitor_veh,
5568 distribution_graph::noop_visitor_grid );
5569
5570 if( check_environmental_effects ) {
5571 check_environmental_effects = do_environmental_effects();
5572 }
5573
5574 // turrets which are enabled will try to reload and then automatically fire
5575 // Turrets which are disabled but have targets set are a special case
5576 for( auto e : turrets() ) {
5577 if( e->enabled || e->target.second != e->target.first ) {
5578 automatic_fire_turret( *e );
5579 }
5580 }
5581
5582 if( velocity < 0 ) {
5583 beeper_sound();
5584 }
5585}
5586
5587void vehicle::dump_items_from_part( const size_t index )
5588{
5589 vehicle_part &vp = parts[ index ];
5590 for( item &e : vp.items ) {
5591 g->m.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( vp ), e );
5592 }
5593 vp.items.clear();
5594}
5595
5596bool vehicle::decrement_summon_timer()
5597{
5598 if( !summon_time_limit ) {
5599 return false;
5600 }
5601 if( *summon_time_limit <= 0_turns ) {
5602 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
5603 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
5604 dump_items_from_part( p );
5605 }
5606 if( g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
5607 add_msg( m_info, _( "Your %s winks out of existence." ), name );
5608 }
5609 g->m.destroy_vehicle( this );
5610 return true;
5611 } else {
5612 *summon_time_limit -= 1_turns;
5613 }
5614 return false;
5615}
5616
5617void vehicle::suspend_refresh()
5618{
5619 // disable refresh and cache recalculation
5620 no_refresh = true;
5621 mass_dirty = false;
5622 mass_center_precalc_dirty = false;
5623 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = false;
5624 coeff_rolling_dirty = false;
5625 coeff_air_dirty = false;
5626 coeff_water_dirty = false;
5627 coeff_air_changed = false;
5628}
5629
5630void vehicle::enable_refresh()
5631{
5632 // force all caches to recalculate
5633 no_refresh = false;
5634 mass_dirty = true;
5635 mass_center_precalc_dirty = true;
5636 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = true;
5637 coeff_rolling_dirty = true;
5638 coeff_air_dirty = true;
5639 coeff_water_dirty = true;
5640 coeff_air_changed = true;
5641 refresh();
5642}
5643
5644/**
5645 * Refreshes all caches and refinds all parts. Used after the vehicle has had a part added or removed.
5646 * Makes indices of different part types so they're easy to find. Also calculates power drain.
5647 */
5648void vehicle::refresh()
5649{
5650 if( no_refresh ) {
5651 return;
5652 }
5653
5654 alternators.clear();
5655 engines.clear();
5656 reactors.clear();
5657 solar_panels.clear();
5658 wind_turbines.clear();
5659 sails.clear();
5660 water_wheels.clear();
5661 funnels.clear();
5662 emitters.clear();
5663 relative_parts.clear();
5664 loose_parts.clear();
5665 wheelcache.clear();
5666 rail_wheelcache.clear();
5667 rotors.clear();
5668 steering.clear();
5669 speciality.clear();
5670 floating.clear();
5671 alternator_load = 0;
5672 extra_drag = 0;
5673 rail_profile.clear();
5674
5675 // Used to sort part list so it displays properly when examining
5676 struct sort_veh_part_vector {
5677 vehicle *veh;
5678 inline bool operator()( const int p1, const int p2 ) {
5679 return veh->part_info( p1 ).list_order < veh->part_info( p2 ).list_order;
5680 }
5681 } svpv = { this };
5682
5683 mount_min.x = 123;
5684 mount_min.y = 123;
5685 mount_max.x = -123;
5686 mount_max.y = -123;
5687
5688 bool refresh_done = false;
5689
5690 // Main loop over all vehicle parts.
5691 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
5692 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
5693 const vpart_info &vpi = vp.info();
5694 if( vp.part().removed ) {
5695 continue;
5696 }
5697 refresh_done = true;
5698
5699 // Build map of point -> all parts in that point
5700 const point pt = vp.mount();
5701 mount_min.x = std::min( mount_min.x, pt.x );
5702 mount_min.y = std::min( mount_min.y, pt.y );
5703 mount_max.x = std::max( mount_max.x, pt.x );
5704 mount_max.y = std::max( mount_max.y, pt.y );
5705
5706 // This will keep the parts at point pt sorted
5707 std::vector<int>::iterator vii = std::lower_bound( relative_parts[pt].begin(),
5708 relative_parts[pt].end(),
5709 static_cast<int>( p ), svpv );
5710 relative_parts[pt].insert( vii, p );
5711
5712 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_FLOATS ) ) {
5713 floating.push_back( p );
5714 }
5715
5716 if( vp.part().is_unavailable() ) {
5717 continue;
5718 }
5719 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ALTERNATOR ) ) {
5720 alternators.push_back( p );
5721 }
5722 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
5723 engines.push_back( p );
5724 }
5725 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_REACTOR ) ) {
5726 reactors.push_back( p );
5727 }
5728 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_SOLAR_PANEL ) ) {
5729 solar_panels.push_back( p );
5730 }
5731 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ROTOR ) ) {
5732 rotors.push_back( p );
5733 }
5734 if( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) ) {
5735 wind_turbines.push_back( p );
5736 }
5737 if( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_POWERED" ) ) {
5738 sails.push_back( p );
5739 }
5740 if( vpi.has_flag( "WATER_WHEEL" ) ) {
5741 water_wheels.push_back( p );
5742 }
5743 if( vpi.has_flag( "FUNNEL" ) ) {
5744 funnels.push_back( p );
5745 }
5746 if( vpi.has_flag( "UNMOUNT_ON_MOVE" ) ) {
5747 loose_parts.push_back( p );
5748 }
5749 if( vpi.has_flag( "EMITTER" ) ) {
5750 emitters.push_back( p );
5751 }
5752 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_WHEEL ) ) {
5753 wheelcache.push_back( p );
5754 }
5755 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_RAIL ) ) {
5756 rail_wheelcache.push_back( p );
5757
5758 const int rail_pos = vp.mount().y;
5759 const auto it = std::find( rail_profile.cbegin(), rail_profile.cend(), rail_pos );
5760 if( it == rail_profile.cend() ) {
5761 rail_profile.push_back( rail_pos );
5762 }
5763 }
5764 if( ( vpi.has_flag( "STEERABLE" ) && part_with_feature( pt, "STEERABLE", true ) != -1 ) ||
5765 vpi.has_flag( "TRACKED" ) ) {
5766 // TRACKED contributes to steering effectiveness but
5767 // (a) doesn't count as a steering axle for install difficulty
5768 // (b) still contributes to drag for the center of steering calculation
5769 steering.push_back( p );
5770 }
5771 if( vpi.has_flag( "SECURITY" ) ) {
5772 speciality.push_back( p );
5773 }
5774 if( vp.part().enabled && vpi.has_flag( "EXTRA_DRAG" ) ) {
5775 extra_drag += vpi.power;
5776 }
5777 if( vpi.has_flag( "EXTRA_DRAG" ) && ( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) ||
5778 vpi.has_flag( "WATER_WHEEL" ) ) ) {
5779 extra_drag += vpi.power;
5780 }
5781 if( camera_on && vpi.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
5782 vp.part().enabled = true;
5783 } else if( !camera_on && vpi.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
5784 vp.part().enabled = false;
5785 }
5786 if( vpi.has_flag( "TURRET" ) && !has_part( global_part_pos3( vp.part() ), "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ) {
5787 vp.part().enabled = false;
5788 }
5789 }
5790
5791 front_left.x = mount_max.x;
5792 front_left.y = mount_min.y;
5793 front_right = mount_max;
5794
5795 if( !refresh_done ) {
5796 mount_min = mount_max = point_zero;
5797 }
5798
5799 refresh_position();
5800
5801 check_environmental_effects = true;
5802 insides_dirty = true;
5803 zones_dirty = true;
5804 invalidate_mass();
5805}
5806
5807void vehicle::refresh_position()
5808{
5809 if( !parts.empty() ) {
5810 precalc_mounts( 0, pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0] );
5811 if( attached ) {
5812 adjust_zlevel();
5813 shift_zlevel();
5814 }
5815 }
5816}
5817
5818const point &vehicle::pivot_point() const
5819{
5820 if( pivot_dirty ) {
5821 refresh_pivot();
5822 }
5823
5824 return pivot_cache;
5825}
5826
5827void vehicle::refresh_pivot() const
5828{
5829 // Const method, but messes with mutable fields
5830 pivot_dirty = false;
5831
5832 if( wheelcache.empty() || !valid_wheel_config() ) {
5833 // No usable wheels, use CoM (dragging)
5834 pivot_cache = local_center_of_mass();
5835 return;
5836 }
5837
5838 // The model here is:
5839 //
5840 // We are trying to rotate around some point (xc,yc)
5841 // This produces a friction force / moment from each wheel resisting the
5842 // rotation. We want to find the point that minimizes that resistance.
5843 //
5844 // For a given wheel w at (xw,yw), find:
5845 // weight(w): a scaling factor for the friction force based on wheel
5846 // size, brokenness, steerability/orientation
5847 // center_dist: the distance from (xw,yw) to (xc,yc)
5848 // centerline_angle: the angle between the X axis and a line through
5849 // (xw,yw) and (xc,yc)
5850 //
5851 // Decompose the force into two components, assuming that the wheel is
5852 // aligned along the X axis and we want to apply different weightings to
5853 // the in-line vs perpendicular parts of the force:
5854 //
5855 // Resistance force in line with the wheel (X axis)
5856 // Fi = weightI(w) * center_dist * sin(centerline_angle)
5857 // Resistance force perpendicular to the wheel (Y axis):
5858 // Fp = weightP(w) * center_dist * cos(centerline_angle);
5859 //
5860 // Then find the moment that these two forces would apply around (xc,yc)
5861 // moment(w) = center_dist * cos(centerline_angle) * Fi +
5862 // center_dist * sin(centerline_angle) * Fp
5863 //
5864 // Note that:
5865 // cos(centerline_angle) = (xw-xc) / center_dist
5866 // sin(centerline_angle) = (yw-yc) / center_dist
5867 // -> moment(w) = weightP(w)*(xw-xc)^2 + weightI(w)*(yw-yc)^2
5868 // = weightP(w)*xc^2 - 2*weightP(w)*xc*xw + weightP(w)*xw^2 +
5869 // weightI(w)*yc^2 - 2*weightI(w)*yc*yw + weightI(w)*yw^2
5870 //
5871 // which happily means that the X and Y axes can be handled independently.
5872 // We want to minimize sum(moment(w)) due to wheels w=0,1,..., which
5873 // occurs when:
5874 //
5875 // sum( 2*xc*weightP(w) - 2*weightP(w)*xw ) = 0
5876 // -> xc = (weightP(0)*x0 + weightP(1)*x1 + ...) /
5877 // (weightP(0) + weightP(1) + ...)
5878 // sum( 2*yc*weightI(w) - 2*weightI(w)*yw ) = 0
5879 // -> yc = (weightI(0)*y0 + weightI(1)*y1 + ...) /
5880 // (weightI(0) + weightI(1) + ...)
5881 //
5882 // so it turns into a fairly simple weighted average of the wheel positions.
5883
5884 float xc_numerator = 0;
5885 float xc_denominator = 0;
5886 float yc_numerator = 0;
5887 float yc_denominator = 0;
5888
5889 for( int p : wheelcache ) {
5890 const auto &wheel = parts[p];
5891
5892 // TODO: load on tire?
5893 int contact_area = wheel.wheel_area();
5894 float weight_i; // weighting for the in-line part
5895 float weight_p; // weighting for the perpendicular part
5896 if( wheel.is_broken() ) {
5897 // broken wheels don't roll on either axis
5898 weight_i = contact_area * 2.0;
5899 weight_p = contact_area * 2.0;
5900 } else if( part_with_feature( wheel.mount, "STEERABLE", true ) != -1 ) {
5901 // Unbroken steerable wheels can handle motion on both axes
5902 // (but roll a little more easily inline)
5903 weight_i = contact_area * 0.1;
5904 weight_p = contact_area * 0.2;
5905 } else {
5906 // Regular wheels resist perpendicular motion
5907 weight_i = contact_area * 0.1;
5908 weight_p = contact_area;
5909 }
5910
5911 xc_numerator += weight_p * wheel.mount.x;
5912 yc_numerator += weight_i * wheel.mount.y;
5913 xc_denominator += weight_p;
5914 yc_denominator += weight_i;
5915 }
5916
5917 if( xc_denominator < 0.1 || yc_denominator < 0.1 ) {
5918 debugmsg( "vehicle::refresh_pivot had a bad weight: xc=%.3f/%.3f yc=%.3f/%.3f",
5919 xc_numerator, xc_denominator, yc_numerator, yc_denominator );
5920 pivot_cache = local_center_of_mass();
5921 } else {
5922 pivot_cache.x = std::round( xc_numerator / xc_denominator );
5923 pivot_cache.y = std::round( yc_numerator / yc_denominator );
5924 }
5925}
5926
5927void vehicle::do_towing_move()
5928{
5929 if( !no_towing_slack() || velocity <= 0 ) {
5930 return;
5931 }
5932 bool invalidate = false;
5933 if( !tow_data.get_towed() ) {
5934 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but no towed vehicle!" );
5935 invalidate = true;
5936 }
5937 const int tow_index = get_tow_part();
5938 if( tow_index == -1 ) {
5939 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but no tow part" );
5940 invalidate = true;
5941 }
5942 vehicle *towed_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
5943 if( !towed_veh ) {
5944 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but towed vehicle dosnt exist." );
5945 invalidate_towing();
5946 return;
5947 }
5948 const int other_tow_index = towed_veh->get_tow_part();
5949 if( other_tow_index == -1 ) {
5950 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move but towed vehicle has no towing part" );
5951 invalidate = true;
5952 }
5953 if( towed_veh->global_pos3().z != global_pos3().z ) {
5954 // how the hellicopter did this happen?
5955 // yes, this can happen when towing over a bridge (see #47293)
5956 invalidate = true;
5957 add_msg( m_info, _( "A towing cable snaps off of %s." ), tow_data.get_towed()->disp_name() );
5958 }
5959 if( invalidate ) {
5960 invalidate_towing( true );
5961 return;
5962 }
5963 const tripoint tower_tow_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( tow_index ) );
5964 const tripoint towed_tow_point = g->m.getabs( towed_veh->global_part_pos3( other_tow_index ) );
5965 // same as above, but where the pulling vehicle is pulling from
5966 units::angle towing_veh_angle = towed_veh->get_angle_from_targ( tower_tow_point );
5967 const bool reverse = towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_BACK;
5968 int accel_y = 0;
5969 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
5970 int turn_x = get_turn_from_angle( towing_veh_angle, vehpos, tower_tow_point, reverse );
5971 if( rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) < 6 ) {
5972 accel_y = reverse ? -1 : 1;
5973 }
5974 if( towed_veh->velocity <= velocity && rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) >= 7 ) {
5975 accel_y = reverse ? 1 : -1;
5976 }
5977 if( rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) >= 12 ) {
5978 towed_veh->velocity = velocity * 1.8;
5979 if( reverse ) {
5980 towed_veh->velocity = -towed_veh->velocity;
5981 }
5982 } else {
5983 towed_veh->velocity = reverse ? -velocity : velocity;
5984 }
5985 if( towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_FRONT ) {
5986 towed_veh->selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
5987 } else if( towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_BACK ) {
5988 accel_y = 10;
5989 towed_veh->selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
5990 } else {
5991 towed_veh->skidding = true;
5992 std::vector<tripoint> lineto = line_to( g->m.getlocal( towed_tow_point ),
5993 g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ) );
5994 tripoint nearby_destination;
5995 if( lineto.size() >= 2 ) {
5996 nearby_destination = lineto[1];
5997 } else {
5998 nearby_destination = tower_tow_point;
5999 }
6000 const int destination_delta_x = g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ).x - nearby_destination.x;
6001 const int destination_delta_y = g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ).y - nearby_destination.y;
6002 const int destination_delta_z = towed_veh->global_pos3().z;
6003 const tripoint move_destination( clamp( destination_delta_x, -1, 1 ),
6004 clamp( destination_delta_y, -1, 1 ),
6005 clamp( destination_delta_z, -1, 1 ) );
6006 g->m.move_vehicle( *towed_veh, move_destination, towed_veh->face );
6007 towed_veh->move = tileray( point( destination_delta_x, destination_delta_y ) );
6008 }
6009
6010}
6011
6012bool vehicle::is_external_part( const tripoint &part_pt ) const
6013{
6014 for( const tripoint &elem : g->m.points_in_radius( part_pt, 1 ) ) {
6015 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( elem );
6016 if( !vp ) {
6017 return true;
6018 }
6019 if( vp && &vp->vehicle() != this ) {
6020 return true;
6021 }
6022 }
6023 return false;
6024}
6025
6026bool vehicle::is_towing() const
6027{
6028 bool ret = false;
6029 if( !tow_data.get_towed() ) {
6030 return ret;
6031 } else {
6032 if( !tow_data.get_towed()->tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
6033 debugmsg( "vehicle %s is towing, but the towed vehicle has no tower defined", name );
6034 return ret;
6035 }
6036 ret = true;
6037 }
6038 return ret;
6039}
6040
6041bool vehicle::is_towed() const
6042{
6043 bool ret = false;
6044 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
6045 return ret;
6046 } else {
6047 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by()->tow_data.get_towed() ) {
6048 debugmsg( "vehicle %s is marked as towed, but the tower vehicle has no towed defined", name );
6049 return ret;
6050 }
6051 ret = true;
6052 }
6053 return ret;
6054}
6055
6056int vehicle::get_tow_part() const
6057{
6058 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6059 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6060 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6061 continue;
6062 }
6063
6064 if( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) >= 0 && vp.part().is_available() ) {
6065 return p;
6066 }
6067 }
6068 return -1;
6069}
6070
6071bool vehicle::has_tow_attached() const
6072{
6073 bool ret = false;
6074 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6075 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6076 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6077 continue;
6078 }
6079
6080 if( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) >= 0 && vp.part().is_available() ) {
6081 ret = true;
6082 break;
6083 }
6084 }
6085 return ret;
6086}
6087
6088void vehicle::set_tow_directions()
6089{
6090 const int length = mount_max.x - mount_min.x + 1;
6091 const point mount_of_tow = parts[get_tow_part()].mount;
6092 const point normalized_tow_mount = point( std::abs( mount_of_tow.x - mount_min.x ),
6093 std::abs( mount_of_tow.y - mount_min.y ) );
6094 if( length >= 3 ) {
6095 const int trisect = length / 3;
6096 if( normalized_tow_mount.x <= trisect ) {
6097 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_BACK;
6098 } else if( normalized_tow_mount.x > trisect && normalized_tow_mount.x <= trisect * 2 ) {
6099 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_SIDE;
6100 } else {
6101 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_FRONT;
6102 }
6103 } else {
6104 // its a small vehicle, no danger if it flips around.
6105 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_FRONT;
6106 }
6107}
6108
6109bool towing_data::set_towing( vehicle *tower_veh, vehicle *towed_veh )
6110{
6111 if( !towed_veh || !tower_veh ) {
6112 return false;
6113 }
6114 towed_veh->tow_data.towed_by = tower_veh;
6115 tower_veh->tow_data.towing = towed_veh;
6116 tower_veh->set_tow_directions();
6117 towed_veh->set_tow_directions();
6118 return true;
6119}
6120
6121void vehicle::invalidate_towing( bool first_vehicle )
6122{
6123 if( !is_towing() && !is_towed() ) {
6124 return;
6125 }
6126 vehicle *other_veh = nullptr;
6127 if( is_towing() ) {
6128 other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
6129 } else if( is_towed() ) {
6130 other_veh = tow_data.get_towed_by();
6131 }
6132 if( other_veh && first_vehicle ) {
6133 other_veh->invalidate_towing();
6134 }
6135 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6136 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6137 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6138 continue;
6139 }
6140
6141 if( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) >= 0 ) {
6142 if( first_vehicle ) {
6143 vehicle_part *part = &parts[part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true )];
6144 item drop = part->properties_to_item();
6145 g->m.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( *part ), drop );
6146 }
6147 remove_part( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) );
6148 break;
6149 }
6150 }
6151 tow_data.clear_towing();
6152}
6153
6154// to be called on the towed vehicle
6155bool vehicle::tow_cable_too_far() const
6156{
6157 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
6158 debugmsg( "checking tow cable length on a vehicle that has no towing vehicle" );
6159 return false;
6160 }
6161 int index = get_tow_part();
6162 if( index == -1 ) {
6163 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6164 return false;
6165 }
6166 tripoint towing_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( index ) );
6167 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by()->tow_data.get_towed() ) {
6168 debugmsg( "vehicle %s has data for a towing vehicle, but that towing vehicle does not have %s listed as towed",
6169 disp_name(), disp_name() );
6170 return false;
6171 }
6172 int other_index = tow_data.get_towed_by()->get_tow_part();
6173 if( other_index == -1 ) {
6174 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6175 return false;
6176 }
6177 tripoint towed_point = g->m.getabs( tow_data.get_towed_by()->global_part_pos3( other_index ) );
6178 if( towing_point == tripoint_zero || towed_point == tripoint_zero ) {
6179 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6180 return false;
6181 }
6182 return rl_dist( towing_point, towed_point ) >= 25;
6183}
6184
6185// the towing cable only starts pulling at a certain distance between the vehicles
6186// to be called on the towing vehicle
6187bool vehicle::no_towing_slack() const
6188{
6189 if( !tow_data.get_towed() ) {
6190 return false;
6191 }
6192 int index = get_tow_part();
6193 if( index == -1 ) {
6194 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6195 return false;
6196 }
6197 tripoint towing_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( index ) );
6198 if( !tow_data.get_towed()->tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
6199 debugmsg( "vehicle %s has data for a towed vehicle, but that towed vehicle does not have %s listed as tower",
6200 disp_name(), disp_name() );
6201 return false;
6202 }
6203 int other_index = tow_data.get_towed()->get_tow_part();
6204 if( other_index == -1 ) {
6205 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6206 return false;
6207 }
6208 tripoint towed_point = g->m.getabs( tow_data.get_towed()->global_part_pos3( other_index ) );
6209 if( towing_point == tripoint_zero || towed_point == tripoint_zero ) {
6210 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6211 return false;
6212 }
6213 return rl_dist( towing_point, towed_point ) >= 8;
6214
6215}
6216
6217void vehicle::remove_remote_part( int part_num )
6218{
6219 if( parts[part_num].has_flag( vehicle_part::targets_grid ) ) {
6220 vehicle_connector_tile *connector =
6221 active_tiles::furn_at<vehicle_connector_tile>( tripoint_abs_ms( parts[part_num].target.second ) );
6222 if( connector != nullptr ) {
6223 auto &vehs = connector->connected_vehicles;
6224 auto iter = std::find( vehs.begin(), vehs.end(), tripoint_abs_ms( g->m.getabs( global_pos3() ) ) );
6225 if( iter != vehs.end() ) {
6226 vehs.erase( iter );
6227 }
6228 }
6229 return;
6230 }
6231 auto veh = find_vehicle( parts[part_num].target.second );
6232
6233 // If the target vehicle is still there, ask it to remove its part
6234 if( veh != nullptr ) {
6235 const tripoint local_abs = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part_num ) );
6236
6237 for( size_t j = 0; j < veh->loose_parts.size(); j++ ) {
6238 int remote_partnum = veh->loose_parts[j];
6239 auto remote_part = &veh->parts[remote_partnum];
6240
6241 if( veh->part_flag( remote_partnum, "POWER_TRANSFER" ) && remote_part->target.first == local_abs ) {
6242 veh->remove_part( remote_partnum );
6243 return;
6244 }
6245 }
6246 }
6247}
6248
6249void vehicle::shed_loose_parts()
6250{
6251 // remove_part rebuilds the loose_parts vector, when all of those parts have been removed,
6252 // it will stay empty.
6253 while( !loose_parts.empty() ) {
6254 const int elem = loose_parts.front();
6255 if( part_flag( elem, "POWER_TRANSFER" ) ) {
6256 remove_remote_part( elem );
6257 }
6258 if( is_towing() || is_towed() ) {
6259 vehicle *other_veh = is_towing() ? tow_data.get_towed() : tow_data.get_towed_by();
6260 if( other_veh ) {
6261 other_veh->remove_part( other_veh->part_with_feature( other_veh->get_tow_part(), "TOW_CABLE",
6262 true ) );
6263 other_veh->tow_data.clear_towing();
6264 }
6265 tow_data.clear_towing();
6266 }
6267 auto part = &parts[elem];
6268 item drop = part->properties_to_item();
6269 if( !magic ) {
6270 g->m.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( *part ), drop );
6271 }
6272
6273 remove_part( elem );
6274 }
6275}
6276
6277bool vehicle::enclosed_at( const tripoint &pos )
6278{
6279 refresh_insides();
6280 std::vector<vehicle_part *> parts_here = get_parts_at( pos, "BOARDABLE",
6281 part_status_flag::working );
6282 if( !parts_here.empty() ) {
6283 return parts_here.front()->inside;
6284 }
6285 return false;
6286}
6287
6288void vehicle::refresh_insides()
6289{
6290 if( !insides_dirty ) {
6291 return;
6292 }
6293 insides_dirty = false;
6294 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6295 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6296 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6297 continue;
6298 }
6299 /* If there's no roof, or there is a roof but it's broken, it's outside.
6300 * (Use short-circuiting && so broken frames don't screw this up) */
6301 if( !( part_with_feature( p, "ROOF", true ) >= 0 && vp.part().is_available() ) ) {
6302 vp.part().inside = false;
6303 continue;
6304 }
6305
6306 // inside if not otherwise
6307 parts[p].inside = true;
6308 // let's check four neighbor parts
6309 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
6310 point near_mount = parts[ p ].mount + offset;
6311 std::vector<int> parts_n3ar = parts_at_relative( near_mount, true );
6312 // if we aren't covered from sides, the roof at p won't save us
6313 bool cover = false;
6314 for( auto &j : parts_n3ar ) {
6315 // another roof -- cover
6316 if( part_flag( j, "ROOF" ) && parts[ j ].is_available() ) {
6317 cover = true;
6318 break;
6319 } else if( part_flag( j, "OBSTACLE" ) && parts[ j ].is_available() ) {
6320 // found an obstacle, like board or windshield or door
6321 if( parts[j].inside || ( part_flag( j, "OPENABLE" ) && parts[j].open ) ) {
6322 // door and it's open -- can't cover
6323 continue;
6324 }
6325 cover = true;
6326 break;
6327 }
6328 //Otherwise keep looking, there might be another part in that square
6329 }
6330 if( !cover ) {
6331 vp.part().inside = false;
6332 break;
6333 }
6334 }
6335 }
6336}
6337
6338bool vpart_position::is_inside() const
6339{
6340 // TODO: this is a bit of a hack as refresh_insides has side effects
6341 // this should be called elsewhere and not in a function that intends to just query
6342 // it's also a no-op if the insides are up to date.
6343 vehicle().refresh_insides();
6344 return vehicle().part( part_index() ).inside;
6345}
6346
6347void vehicle::unboard_all()
6348{
6349 std::vector<int> bp = boarded_parts();
6350 for( auto &i : bp ) {
6351 g->m.unboard_vehicle( global_part_pos3( i ) );
6352 }
6353}
6354
6355int vehicle::damage( int p, int dmg, damage_type type, bool aimed )
6356{
6357 if( dmg < 1 ) {
6358 return dmg;
6359 }
6360
6361 std::vector<int> pl = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
6362 if( pl.empty() ) {
6363 // We ran out of non removed parts at this location already.
6364 return dmg;
6365 }
6366
6367 if( !aimed ) {
6368 bool found_obs = false;
6369 for( auto &i : pl ) {
6370 if( part_flag( i, "OBSTACLE" ) &&
6371 ( !part_flag( i, "OPENABLE" ) || !parts[i].open ) ) {
6372 found_obs = true;
6373 break;
6374 }
6375 }
6376
6377 if( !found_obs ) { // not aimed at this tile and no obstacle here -- fly through
6378 return dmg;
6379 }
6380 }
6381
6382 int target_part = part_info( p ).rotor_diameter() ? p : random_entry( pl );
6383
6384 // door motor mechanism is protected by closed doors
6385 if( part_flag( target_part, "DOOR_MOTOR" ) ) {
6386 // find the most strong openable that is not open
6387 int strongest_door_part = -1;
6388 int strongest_door_durability = INT_MIN;
6389 for( int part : pl ) {
6390 if( part_flag( part, "OPENABLE" ) && !parts[part].open ) {
6391 int door_durability = part_info( part ).durability;
6392 if( door_durability > strongest_door_durability ) {
6393 strongest_door_part = part;
6394 strongest_door_durability = door_durability;
6395 }
6396 }
6397 }
6398
6399 // if we found a closed door, target it instead of the door_motor
6400 if( strongest_door_part != -1 ) {
6401 target_part = strongest_door_part;
6402 }
6403 }
6404
6405 int damage_dealt;
6406
6407 int armor_part = part_with_feature( p, "ARMOR", true );
6408 if( armor_part < 0 ) {
6409 // Not covered by armor -- damage part
6410 damage_dealt = damage_direct( target_part, dmg, type );
6411 } else {
6412 // Covered by armor -- hit both armor and part, but reduce damage by armor's reduction
6413 int protection = part_info( armor_part ).damage_reduction[ type ];
6414 // Parts on roof aren't protected
6415 bool overhead = part_flag( target_part, "ROOF" ) || part_info( target_part ).location == "on_roof";
6416 // Calling damage_direct may remove the damaged part
6417 // completely, therefore the other index (target_part) becomes
6418 // wrong if target_part > armor_part.
6419 // Damaging the part with the higher index first is save,
6420 // as removing a part only changes indices after the
6421 // removed part.
6422 if( armor_part < target_part ) {
6423 damage_direct( target_part, overhead ? dmg : dmg - protection, type );
6424 damage_dealt = damage_direct( armor_part, dmg, type );
6425 } else {
6426 damage_dealt = damage_direct( armor_part, dmg, type );
6427 damage_direct( target_part, overhead ? dmg : dmg - protection, type );
6428 }
6429 }
6430
6431 return damage_dealt;
6432}
6433
6434void vehicle::damage_all( int dmg1, int dmg2, damage_type type, const point &impact )
6435{
6436 if( dmg2 < dmg1 ) {
6437 std::swap( dmg1, dmg2 );
6438 }
6439
6440 if( dmg1 < 1 ) {
6441 return;
6442 }
6443
6444 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6445 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6446 int distance = 1 + square_dist( vp.mount(), impact );
6447 if( distance > 1 && part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure &&
6448 !part_info( p ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
6449 damage_direct( p, rng( dmg1, dmg2 ) / ( distance * distance ), type );
6450 }
6451 }
6452}
6453
6454/**
6455 * Shifts all parts of the vehicle by the given amounts, and then shifts the
6456 * vehicle itself in the opposite direction. The end result is that the vehicle
6457 * appears to have not moved. Useful for re-zeroing a vehicle to ensure that a
6458 * (0, 0) part is always present.
6459 * @param delta How much to shift along each axis
6460 */
6461void vehicle::shift_parts( const point &delta )
6462{
6463 // Don't invalidate the active item cache's location!
6464 active_items.subtract_locations( delta );
6465 for( auto &elem : parts ) {
6466 elem.mount -= delta;
6467 }
6468
6469 decltype( labels ) new_labels;
6470 for( auto &l : labels ) {
6471 new_labels.insert( label( l - delta, l.text ) );
6472 }
6473 labels = new_labels;
6474
6475 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
6476 for( auto const &z : loot_zones ) {
6477 new_zones.emplace( z.first - delta, z.second );
6478 }
6479 loot_zones = new_zones;
6480
6481 pivot_anchor[0] -= delta;
6482 refresh();
6483 //Need to also update the map after this
6484 g->m.reset_vehicle_cache( );
6485}
6486
6487/**
6488 * Detect if the vehicle is currently missing a 0,0 part, and
6489 * adjust if necessary.
6490 * @return bool true if the shift was needed.
6491 */
6492bool vehicle::shift_if_needed()
6493{
6494 std::vector<int> vehicle_origin = parts_at_relative( point_zero, true );
6495 if( !vehicle_origin.empty() && !parts[ vehicle_origin[ 0 ] ].removed ) {
6496 // Shifting is not needed.
6497 return false;
6498 }
6499 //Find a frame, any frame, to shift to
6500 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6501 if( vp.info().location == "structure"
6502 && !vp.has_feature( "PROTRUSION" )
6503 && !vp.part().removed ) {
6504 shift_parts( vp.mount() );
6505 refresh();
6506 return true;
6507 }
6508 }
6509 // There are only parts with PROTRUSION left, choose one of them.
6510 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6511 if( !vp.part().removed ) {
6512 shift_parts( vp.mount() );
6513 refresh();
6514 return true;
6515 }
6516 }
6517 return false;
6518}
6519
6520int vehicle::break_off( int p, int dmg )
6521{
6522 /* Already-destroyed part - chance it could be torn off into pieces.
6523 * Chance increases with damage, and decreases with part max durability
6524 * (so lights, etc are easily removed; frames and plating not so much) */
6525 if( rng( 0, part_info( p ).durability / 10 ) >= dmg ) {
6526 return dmg;
6527 }
6528 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( p );
6529 const auto scatter_parts = [&]( const vehicle_part & pt ) {
6530 for( const item &piece : pt.pieces_for_broken_part() ) {
6531 // inside the loop, so each piece goes to a different place
6532 // TODO: this may spawn items behind a wall
6533 const tripoint where = random_entry( g->m.points_in_radius( pos, SCATTER_DISTANCE ) );
6534 // TODO: balance audit, ensure that less pieces are generated than one would need
6535 // to build the component (smash a vehicle box that took 10 lumps of steel,
6536 // find 12 steel lumps scattered after atom-smashing it with a tree trunk)
6537 if( !magic ) {
6538 g->m.add_item_or_charges( where, piece );
6539 }
6540 }
6541 };
6542 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
6543 // For structural parts, remove other parts first
6544 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
6545 for( int index = parts_in_square.size() - 1; index >= 0; index-- ) {
6546 // Ignore the frame being destroyed
6547 if( parts_in_square[index] == p ) {
6548 continue;
6549 }
6550
6551 if( parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].is_broken() ) {
6552 // Tearing off a broken part - break it up
6553 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6554 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %s's %s breaks into pieces!" ), name,
6555 parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].name() );
6556 }
6557 scatter_parts( parts[parts_in_square[index]] );
6558 } else {
6559 // Intact (but possibly damaged) part - remove it in one piece
6560 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6561 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is torn off!" ), name,
6562 parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].name() );
6563 }
6564 item part_as_item = parts[parts_in_square[index]].properties_to_item();
6565 if( !magic ) {
6566 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos, part_as_item );
6567 }
6568 }
6569 remove_part( parts_in_square[index] );
6570 }
6571 // After clearing the frame, remove it.
6572 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6573 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is destroyed!" ), name, parts[ p ].name() );
6574 }
6575 scatter_parts( parts[p] );
6576 remove_part( p );
6577 find_and_split_vehicles( p );
6578 } else {
6579 //Just break it off
6580 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6581 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is destroyed!" ), name, parts[ p ].name() );
6582 }
6583
6584 scatter_parts( parts[p] );
6585 remove_part( p );
6586 }
6587
6588 return dmg;
6589}
6590
6591bool vehicle::explode_fuel( int p, damage_type type )
6592{
6593 const itype_id &ft = part_info( p ).fuel_type;
6594 item fuel = item( ft );
6595 if( !fuel.has_explosion_data() ) {
6596 return false;
6597 }
6598 fuel_explosion data = fuel.get_explosion_data();
6599
6600 if( parts[ p ].is_broken() ) {
6601 leak_fuel( parts[ p ] );
6602 }
6603
6604 int explosion_chance = type == DT_HEAT ? data.explosion_chance_hot : data.explosion_chance_cold;
6605 if( one_in( explosion_chance ) ) {
6606 g->events().send<event_type::fuel_tank_explodes>( name );
6607 const int pow = 120 * ( 1 - std::exp( data.explosion_factor / -5000 *
6608 ( parts[p].ammo_remaining() * data.fuel_size_factor ) ) );
6609 //debugmsg( "damage check dmg=%d pow=%d amount=%d", dmg, pow, parts[p].amount );
6610
6611 explosion_handler::explosion( global_part_pos3( p ), nullptr, pow, 0.7, data.fiery_explosion );
6612 mod_hp( parts[p], 0 - parts[ p ].hp(), DT_HEAT );
6613 parts[p].ammo_unset();
6614 }
6615
6616 return true;
6617}
6618
6619int vehicle::damage_direct( int p, int dmg, damage_type type )
6620{
6621 map &here = get_map();
6622 // Make sure p is within range and hasn't been removed already
6623 if( ( static_cast<size_t>( p ) >= parts.size() ) || parts[p].removed ||
6624 !here.inbounds( global_part_pos3( p ) ) ) {
6625 return dmg;
6626 }
6627 // If auto-driving and damage happens, bail out
6628 if( is_autodriving ) {
6629 stop_autodriving();
6630 }
6631 here.set_memory_seen_cache_dirty( global_part_pos3( p ) );
6632 if( parts[p].is_broken() ) {
6633 return break_off( p, dmg );
6634 }
6635
6636 int tsh = std::min( 20, part_info( p ).durability / 10 );
6637 if( dmg < tsh && type != DT_TRUE ) {
6638 if( type == DT_HEAT && parts[p].is_fuel_store() ) {
6639 explode_fuel( p, type );
6640 }
6641
6642 return 0;
6643 }
6644
6645 dmg -= std::min<int>( dmg, part_info( p ).damage_reduction[ type ] );
6646 int dres = dmg - parts[p].hp();
6647 if( mod_hp( parts[ p ], 0 - dmg, type ) ) {
6648 insides_dirty = true;
6649 pivot_dirty = true;
6650
6651 // destroyed parts lose any contained fuels, battery charges or ammo
6652 leak_fuel( parts [ p ] );
6653
6654 for( const auto &e : parts[p].items ) {
6655 here.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( p ), e );
6656 }
6657 parts[p].items.clear();
6658
6659 invalidate_mass();
6660 coeff_air_changed = true;
6661
6662 // refresh cache in case the broken part has changed the status
6663 refresh();
6664 }
6665
6666 if( parts[p].is_fuel_store() ) {
6667 explode_fuel( p, type );
6668 } else if( parts[ p ].is_broken() && part_flag( p, "UNMOUNT_ON_DAMAGE" ) ) {
6669 here.spawn_item( global_part_pos3( p ), part_info( p ).item, 1, 0, calendar::turn );
6670 monster *mon = get_pet( p );
6671 if( mon != nullptr && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
6672 mon->remove_effect( effect_harnessed );
6673 }
6674 if( part_flag( p, "TOW_CABLE" ) ) {
6675 invalidate_towing( true );
6676 } else {
6677 remove_part( p );
6678 }
6679 }
6680
6681 return std::max( dres, 0 );
6682}
6683
6684void vehicle::leak_fuel( vehicle_part &pt )
6685{
6686 // only liquid fuels from non-empty tanks can leak out onto map tiles
6687 if( !pt.is_tank() || pt.ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
6688 return;
6689 }
6690
6691 // leak in random directions but prefer closest tiles and avoid walls or other obstacles
6692 std::vector<tripoint> tiles = closest_points_first( global_part_pos3( pt ), 1 );
6693 tiles.erase( std::remove_if( tiles.begin(), tiles.end(), []( const tripoint & e ) {
6694 return !g->m.passable( e );
6695 } ), tiles.end() );
6696
6697 // leak up to 1/3 of remaining fuel per iteration and continue until the part is empty
6698 const itype *fuel = &*pt.ammo_current();
6699 while( !tiles.empty() && pt.ammo_remaining() ) {
6700 int qty = pt.ammo_consume( rng( 0, std::max( pt.ammo_remaining() / 3, 1 ) ),
6701 global_part_pos3( pt ) );
6702 if( qty > 0 ) {
6703 g->m.add_item_or_charges( random_entry( tiles ), item( fuel, calendar::turn, qty ) );
6704 }
6705 }
6706
6707 pt.ammo_unset();
6708}
6709
6710std::map<itype_id, int> vehicle::fuels_left() const
6711{
6712 std::map<itype_id, int> result;
6713 for( const auto &p : parts ) {
6714 if( p.is_fuel_store() && !p.ammo_current().is_null() ) {
6715 result[ p.ammo_current() ] += p.ammo_remaining();
6716 }
6717 }
6718 return result;
6719}
6720
6721bool vehicle::is_foldable() const
6722{
6723 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6724 if( !vp.has_feature( "FOLDABLE" ) ) {
6725 return false;
6726 }
6727 }
6728 return true;
6729}
6730
6731bool vehicle::restore( const std::string &data )
6732{
6733 std::istringstream veh_data( data );
6734 try {
6735 JsonIn json( veh_data );
6736 parts.clear();
6737 json.read( parts );
6738 } catch( const JsonError &e ) {
6739 debugmsg( "Error restoring vehicle: %s", e.c_str() );
6740 return false;
6741 }
6742 refresh();
6743 face.init( 0_degrees );
6744 turn_dir = 0_degrees;
6745 turn( 0_degrees );
6746 precalc_mounts( 0, pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0] );
6747 precalc_mounts( 1, pivot_rotation[1], pivot_anchor[1] );
6748 last_update = calendar::turn;
6749 return true;
6750}
6751
6752std::set<tripoint> &vehicle::get_points( const bool force_refresh )
6753{
6754 if( force_refresh || occupied_cache_time != calendar::turn ) {
6755 occupied_cache_time = calendar::turn;
6756 occupied_points.clear();
6757 for( const auto &p : parts ) {
6758 occupied_points.insert( global_part_pos3( p ) );
6759 }
6760 }
6761
6762 return occupied_points;
6763}
6764
6765vehicle_part &vpart_reference::part() const
6766{
6767 assert( part_index() < static_cast<size_t>( vehicle().part_count() ) );
6768 return vehicle().part( part_index() );
6769}
6770
6771const vpart_info &vpart_reference::info() const
6772{
6773 return part().info();
6774}
6775
6776player *vpart_reference::get_passenger() const
6777{
6778 return vehicle().get_passenger( part_index() );
6779}
6780
6781point vpart_position::mount() const
6782{
6783 return vehicle().part( part_index() ).mount;
6784}
6785
6786tripoint vpart_position::pos() const
6787{
6788 return vehicle().global_part_pos3( part_index() );
6789}
6790
6791bool vpart_reference::has_feature( const std::string &f ) const
6792{
6793 return info().has_flag( f );
6794}
6795
6796bool vpart_reference::has_feature( const vpart_bitflags f ) const
6797{
6798 return info().has_flag( f );
6799}
6800
6801static bool is_sm_tile_over_water( const tripoint &real_global_pos )
6802{
6803
6804 const tripoint smp = ms_to_sm_copy( real_global_pos );
6805 const point p( modulo( real_global_pos.x, SEEX ), modulo( real_global_pos.y, SEEY ) );
6806 auto sm = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( smp );
6807 if( sm == nullptr ) {
6808 debugmsg( "is_sm_tile_outside(): couldn't find submap %d,%d,%d", smp.x, smp.y, smp.z );
6809 return false;
6810 }
6811
6812 if( p.x < 0 || p.x >= SEEX || p.y < 0 || p.y >= SEEY ) {
6813 debugmsg( "err %d,%d", p.x, p.y );
6814 return false;
6815 }
6816
6817 return ( sm->get_ter( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_CURRENT ) ||
6818 sm->get_furn( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_CURRENT ) );
6819}
6820
6821static bool is_sm_tile_outside( const tripoint &real_global_pos )
6822{
6823
6824 const tripoint smp = ms_to_sm_copy( real_global_pos );
6825 const point p( modulo( real_global_pos.x, SEEX ), modulo( real_global_pos.y, SEEY ) );
6826 auto sm = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( smp );
6827 if( sm == nullptr ) {
6828 debugmsg( "is_sm_tile_outside(): couldn't find submap %d,%d,%d", smp.x, smp.y, smp.z );
6829 return false;
6830 }
6831
6832 if( p.x < 0 || p.x >= SEEX || p.y < 0 || p.y >= SEEY ) {
6833 debugmsg( "err %d,%d", p.x, p.y );
6834 return false;
6835 }
6836
6837 return !( sm->get_ter( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_INDOORS ) ||
6838 sm->get_furn( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_INDOORS ) );
6839}
6840
6841void vehicle::update_time( const time_point &update_to )
6842{
6843 const time_point update_from = last_update;
6844 if( update_to < update_from ) {
6845 // Special case going backwards in time - that happens
6846 last_update = update_to;
6847 return;
6848 }
6849
6850 if( update_to >= update_from && update_to - update_from < 1_minutes ) {
6851 // We don't need to check every turn
6852 return;
6853 }
6854 time_duration elapsed = update_to - last_update;
6855 last_update = update_to;
6856
6857 if( sm_pos.z < 0 ) {
6858 return;
6859 }
6860
6861 // Weather stuff, only for z-levels >= 0
6862 // TODO: Have it wash cars from blood?
6863 if( funnels.empty() && solar_panels.empty() && wind_turbines.empty() && water_wheels.empty() ) {
6864 return;
6865 }
6866 // Get one weather data set per vehicle, they don't differ much across vehicle area
6867 const weather_sum accum_weather = sum_conditions( update_from, update_to,
6868 global_square_location().raw() );
6869 // make some reference objects to use to check for reload
6870 const item water( "water" );
6871 const item water_clean( "water_clean" );
6872
6873 for( int idx : funnels ) {
6874 const auto &pt = parts[idx];
6875
6876 // we need an unbroken funnel mounted on the exterior of the vehicle
6877 if( pt.is_unavailable() || !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( pt ) ) ) ) {
6878 continue;
6879 }
6880
6881 // we need an empty tank (or one already containing water) below the funnel
6882 auto tank = std::find_if( parts.begin(), parts.end(), [&]( const vehicle_part & e ) {
6883 return pt.mount == e.mount && e.is_tank() &&
6884 ( e.can_reload( water ) || e.can_reload( water_clean ) );
6885 } );
6886
6887 if( tank == parts.end() ) {
6888 continue;
6889 }
6890
6891 double area = std::pow( pt.info().size / units::legacy_volume_factor, 2 ) * M_PI;
6892 int qty = roll_remainder( funnel_charges_per_turn( area, accum_weather.rain_amount ) );
6893 int c_qty = qty + ( tank->can_reload( water_clean ) ? tank->ammo_remaining() : 0 );
6894 int cost_to_purify = c_qty * itype_water_purifier->charges_to_use();
6895
6896 if( qty > 0 ) {
6897 if( has_part( global_part_pos3( pt ), "WATER_PURIFIER", true ) &&
6898 ( fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) > cost_to_purify ) ) {
6899 tank->ammo_set( itype_water_clean, c_qty );
6900 discharge_battery( cost_to_purify );
6901 } else {
6902 tank->ammo_set( itype_water, tank->ammo_remaining() + qty );
6903 }
6904 invalidate_mass();
6905 }
6906 }
6907
6908 if( !solar_panels.empty() ) {
6909 int epower_w = 0;
6910 for( int part : solar_panels ) {
6911 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
6912 continue;
6913 }
6914
6915 if( !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
6916 continue;
6917 }
6918
6919 epower_w += part_epower_w( part );
6920 }
6921 double intensity = accum_weather.sunlight / default_daylight_level() / to_turns<double>( elapsed );
6922 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w * intensity, elapsed );
6923 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6924 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from solar panels", name, energy_bat );
6925 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6926 }
6927 }
6928 if( !wind_turbines.empty() ) {
6929 // TODO: use accum_weather wind data to backfill wind turbine
6930 // generation capacity.
6931 int epower_w = total_wind_epower_w();
6932 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w, elapsed );
6933 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6934 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from wind turbines", name, energy_bat );
6935 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6936 }
6937 }
6938 if( !water_wheels.empty() ) {
6939 int epower_w = total_water_wheel_epower_w();
6940 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w, elapsed );
6941 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6942 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from water wheels", name, energy_bat );
6943 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6944 }
6945 }
6946}
6947
6948void vehicle::process_emitters()
6949{
6950 // Parts emitting fields
6951 for( int idx : emitters ) {
6952 const vehicle_part &pt = parts[idx];
6953 if( pt.is_unavailable() || !pt.enabled ) {
6954 continue;
6955 }
6956 for( const emit_id &e : pt.info().emissions ) {
6957 g->m.emit_field( global_part_pos3( pt ), e );
6958 }
6959 }
6960}
6961
6962void vehicle::invalidate_mass()
6963{
6964 mass_dirty = true;
6965 mass_center_precalc_dirty = true;
6966 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = true;
6967 // Anything that affects mass will also affect the pivot
6968 pivot_dirty = true;
6969 coeff_rolling_dirty = true;
6970 coeff_water_dirty = true;
6971}
6972
6973void vehicle::refresh_mass() const
6974{
6975 calc_mass_center( true );
6976}
6977
6978void vehicle::calc_mass_center( bool use_precalc ) const
6979{
6980 units::quantity<float, units::mass::unit_type> xf;
6981 units::quantity<float, units::mass::unit_type> yf;
6982 units::mass m_total = 0_gram;
6983 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6984 const size_t i = vp.part_index();
6985 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6986 continue;
6987 }
6988
6989 units::mass m_part = 0_gram;
6990 units::mass m_part_items = 0_gram;
6991 m_part += vp.part().base.weight();
6992 for( const auto &j : get_items( i ) ) {
6993 m_part_items += j.weight();
6994 }
6995 if( vp.part().info().cargo_weight_modifier != 100 ) {
